SiteContent.shareDescription: U.S. Naval Academy graduate, Navy helicopter pilot, former federal prosecutor, wife, and mother of four kids – Mikie Sherrill is running for governor to make life easier and more affordable for Garden State families. Her career has been defined by service to her country and New Jersey.

data.text:
Vivienda

Las familias de Nueva Jersey están pagando demasiado por la vivienda y, para muchas, el sueño de tener una casa propia está cada vez más fuera de su alcance. Esta crisis de vivienda afecta a millones de habitantes en Nueva Jersey. Implica que los jóvenes ya no pueden vivir donde crecieron después de graduarse de la universidad, que los adultos mayores ya no pueden envejecer o encontrar un hogar cerca de sus hijos y sus nietos cuando se jubilen y deseen mudarse a un lugar más pequeño, y que las empresas opten por establecerse en otros estados porque su fuerza laboral no puede darse el lujo de vivir aquí. Para la mayoría de las familias, tener una vivienda propia es la mayor inversión que harán y la mejor oportunidad que tendrán para construir un patrimonio; sin embargo, nuestra crisis de vivienda actual supone que muchas familias nunca tendrán esa oportunidad. 

La raíz del problema es una grave escasez de viviendas y una falta de oferta en todos los niveles. Desde 2019, Nueva Jersey ha experimentado la segunda mayor disminución en el inventario de viviendas disponibles en todo el país. Eso no es sostenible para las familias ni para nuestra economía. Debemos revivir a Nueva Jersey como un estado que construye, lidera e innova en materia de vivienda.

Como gobernadora, me comprometo a mejorar la accesibilidad de la vivienda al aumentar la construcción de viviendas nuevas que satisfagan las necesidades de todos los residentes. Contar con una mayor oferta de vivienda incrementará las oportunidades de tener casa propia y ayudará a reducir los precios de las rentas. Trabajaré en conjunto con nuestros municipios para aumentar las viviendas “Missing Middle” que incrementen nuestra oferta y satisfagan las necesidades de nuestras comunidades. Trabajaré para brindar financiamiento y asistencia a los municipios para ayudarlos a reutilizar la infraestructura subutilizada; por ejemplo, para convertir edificios comerciales en unidades habitacionales. También fortaleceré los programas para compradores de vivienda por primera vez para permitir que más residentes de Nueva Jersey generen equidad en las comunidades donde trabajan y para combatir a los propietarios que discriminan ilegalmente a las familias y no mantienen sus propiedades en condiciones habitables. Reducir los costos de la vivienda desbloqueará el crecimiento económico y ayudará a las familias a conservar una mayor parte de sus salarios.

Lea el plan de Mikie para reducir los costos de la vivienda.

data.text:
Medioambiente

Para abordar las necesidades medioambientales de Nueva Jersey —desde la costa hasta los pantanos, los bosques y las tierras de cultivo— se requiere un gobernador que haga que las cosas sucedan. Necesitamos medidas urgentes para mitigar las inundaciones, producir energía limpia, sanear antiguos terrenos industriales, limpiar los sitios Superfund, y eliminar el plomo y los contaminantes persistentes de nuestra agua potable. Como congresista, he luchado y logrado devolver millones de dólares a Nueva Jersey para hacer que nuestras comunidades sean más resistentes a las inundaciones, sustituir las líneas de servicio de plomo y la infraestructura hídrica, y combatir la contaminación ambiental. Me siento orgullosa de haber liderado la aprobación de la Ley de Espacios Abiertos de Estados Unidos (Great American Outdoors Act) para proteger los espacios abiertos de Nueva Jersey, entre ellos el Delaware Water Gap, el Great Swamp y Sandy Hook.

Como gobernadora, tomaré medidas contundentes para proteger nuestras comunidades y ecosistemas, construir infraestructura resistente al clima y reducir nuestras emisiones de carbono; asimismo, reduciré los costos de la energía y otros servicios públicos. Y esto no es sólo lo correcto para nuestro medio ambiente, sino también para nuestra economía. Detener las inundaciones y preservar nuestros bosques y tierras de cultivo generará más empleos en industrias de todo el estado —desde el turismo hasta la agricultura, entre otras—, e incrementará los ahorros para las familias a través de primas de seguro más bajas. Mientras Trump elimina las inversiones federales para reducir los costos de energía, tomaré medidas al nivel estatal para invertir en energías limpias como la solar, una de las fuentes de energía más baratas para desarrollar. Además, incentivaré la recuperación de antiguos terrenos industriales para proteger nuestro medioambiente y abrir oportunidades económicas y de vivienda. La crisis climática es real. Y, en Nueva Jersey, abordarla no es una cuestión partidista sino económica y de salud pública que nos impacta a todos.

Lea el plan de Mikie para reducir los precios de servicios públicos y priorizar energía limpia .

data.text: Nueva Jersey construyó esta nación. Nunca hemos tenido miedo de actuar. Seamos el estado que ofrezca una vida más accesible para las familias de Nueva Jersey. Aumentemos las oportunidades y ayudemos a nuestros niños a prosperar. Estos retos no son nuevos; ya es momento de que los enfrentemos. Mi misión es lograr resultados para Nueva Jersey y me emociona poder compartir más con ustedes.

items.title:
Devuelva su boleta antes del 4 de noviembre

  • Solicite una boleta por correo antes del 28 de octubre. 

  • Las boletas se enviarán en o antes del 20 de septiembre.

  • Puede devolverla en un buzón seguro de su condado, devolverla al Board of Elections de su condado antes de las 8 p. m. del 4 de noviembre, o enviarla por correo (solo algunos condados ofrecen una estampilla, así que revise bien su sobre)

  • Su boleta tiene que ser matasellado antes del 4 de noviembre a las 8 p. m. y recibido antes de las 8 p. m. del 10 de noviembre

Del 25 de octubre al 2 de noviembre

  • Puede votar en cualquier centro de votación anticipada de su condado.

  • Horario:

    • Lunes a sábado: 10 a. m. a 8 p. m.

    • Domingo: 10 a. m. a 6 p. m.

4 de noviembre

  • Las urnas estarán abiertas de 6 a. m. a 8 p. m.

data.text:
Graduada de la Academia Naval de los EE. UU., piloto de helicóptero de la Marina, exfiscal federal, esposa y madre de cuatro hijos: Mikie Sherrill se enorgullece de servir en el distrito 11 del Congreso de Nueva Jersey y se postula para gobernadora para hacer la vida más fácil y más asequible para las familias del Garden State. Su carrera se ha definido por el servicio a su país y a Nueva Jersey.

Mikie se inspiró para unirse a las fuerzas armadas gracias a su abuelo, un veterano de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.

Desde pequeña supo que quería volar y hacer grandes cosas. Después de graduarse de la Academia Naval en 1994 (la primera promoción de mujeres elegibles para roles de combate en barcos y aviones), Mikie pasó casi 10 años en servicio activo en la Armada de los Estados Unidos. Como pilota de helicóptero Sea King, dirigió misiones en toda Europa y Oriente Medio. Trabajó en el piso de vigilancia de batalla en el teatro europeo durante la guerra de Irak, sirvió como asistente de bandera del subcomandante de la Flota Atlántica de los EE. UU. Fue oficial de políticas rusas en apoyo de la implementación de nuestras obligaciones del tratado nuclear y supervisó la relación entre la Armada de los Estados Unidos y la Armada de la Federación Rusa.

Tras su servicio en la Marina, Mikie asistió y se graduó en la facultad de derecho.

Trabajó en la práctica privada y luego se unió a la Fiscalía Federal en Nueva Jersey. Como coordinadora de extensión y reingreso, Mikie estableció programas para desarrollar la confianza entre las fuerzas del orden y las comunidades a las que sirven y ayudó a las personas que salían de prisión a obtener empleo, vivienda y educación para reiniciar sus vidas. Luego, como fiscal federal adjunta, procesó casos federales para mantener seguras a nuestras comunidades y trabajó para sacar las armas ilegales de las calles de Nueva Jersey.

Después de que Donald Trump fuera elegido por primera vez, Mikie supo que tenía que hacer algo para defender a Nueva Jersey, su país y los valores que había jurado defender en la Marina.

En su primera candidatura a un cargo, lideró un movimiento de base y fue elegida miembro de la Cámara de Representantes de Estados Unidos en 2018. Su campaña, en la que expulsó de la carrera a un titular republicano arraigado, marcó el segundo mayor cambio del rojo al azul en el país ese año.

Como madre que cría a cuatro hijos, Mikie es una voz fuerte en el Congreso para las familias de Nueva Jersey.

Mikie está trabajando arduamente para reducir los costos para las familias, ya sean los precios de los comestibles, el cuidado infantil o el límite SALT de Trump que castigó a las familias de Nueva Jersey. Después de constantes obstáculos por parte de las administraciones de Christie y Trump, Mikie ayudó a entregar una parte justa de los fondos federales a Nueva Jersey del Proyecto del Túnel Gateway, el proyecto de infraestructura más grande en la historia de Estados Unidos, que creará empleos sindicales bien remunerados y reducirá los tiempos de viaje de las familias. Ella lucha por la libertad reproductiva, defendiendo el derecho al aborto, así como el acceso a la anticoncepción y la FIV. Ella forma parte del Comité de Servicios Armados de la Cámara y del nuevo Comité Selecto de la Cámara sobre el Partido Comunista Chino.

Tiene una licenciatura de la Academia Naval de los Estados Unidos, una maestría en Historia Global de la London School of Economics and Political Science y una licenciatura en derecho de la Universidad de Georgetown.

data.text:
Aborto y Derechos Reproductivos

La decisión de formar una familia y cuándo hacerlo es algo que cada mujer debe tomar por sí misma. Siempre he luchado por el acceso al aborto y a la atención integral en salud sexual y reproductiva. Desde que la Corte Suprema elegida personalmente por Trump anuló el fallo Roe vs. Wade, he liderado la lucha para proteger el acceso a la atención del aborto de emergencia, bloquear los esfuerzos para prohibir el aborto con medicamentos como la mifepristona y garantizar que las mujeres en el servicio militar tengan acceso al aborto y a los anticonceptivos, sin importar dónde estén ubicadas. Si bien Nueva Jersey es líder en libertad reproductiva, estoy consciente de que, como gobernadora, existe mucho más por hacer para garantizar que todas las mujeres tengan acceso a la atención en salud sexual y reproductiva que necesitan. Y con Donald Trump de regreso en la Casa Blanca, necesitamos proteger el acceso al derecho al aborto aquí en Nueva Jersey.

Apoyo firmemente la consagración del derecho al aborto en la constitución del estado de Nueva Jersey para proteger de manera permanente la libertad reproductiva. A pesar de las leyes vigentes para proteger el acceso a la atención médica, con mucha frecuencia las mujeres en Nueva Jersey enfrentan obstáculos para recibir a esa atención. Nuestro estado debe tomar medidas para exigir una cobertura de seguro integral para todos los servicios de salud reproductiva, incluido el aborto. Continuaré trabajando en ampliar el acceso a los servicios de anticoncepción y FIV para que todos los habitantes de Nueva Jersey tengan acceso económico a los servicios de planificación familiar que necesiten. Seremos la primera línea de defensa para proteger los derechos reproductivos.

data.text:
Costos de atención médica

Nueva Jersey cuenta con una industria de atención médica de clase mundial, pero para muchas familias, los costos son abrumadores. Como congresista ayudé a aprobar una ley federal que disminuyó drásticamente el costo de la atención médica para los adultos mayores y limitó el precio de la insulina a $35 USD mensuales —y limitará, además, el gasto de los adultos mayores en medicamentos de prescripción a $2,000 USD anuales—. Nueva Jersey adoptó las medidas correctas, siguió el ejemplo y extendió el límite del precio de la insulina establecido por la Ley de Reducción de la Inflación a GetCoveredNJ, además de los planes de beneficios para empleados públicos. Pero tenemos que hacer más. Como gobernadora, ordenaré identificar líneas de acción oportunas para que los pacientes ahorren en medicamentos de prescripción.

Recibir atención médica de calidad no debería suponer una carga financiera. Para afrontar los costos exorbitantes es fundamental que exista una mayor transparencia en los precios de la atención médica. En el resto de las decisiones financieras importantes, como comprar una casa, las personas saben por adelantado cuánto pagarán. Pero en el ámbito de la atención médica, los pacientes muchas veces no conocen los precios hasta que reciben la factura hospitalaria. Cuando los pacientes tengan la opción de comparar precios con antelación, la competencia aumentará y hará que los precios disminuyan. Mantener los costos de la atención médica bajo control garantizará que todos en Nueva Jersey tengan acceso a la atención que necesitan sin endeudarse.

Lea el plan de Mikie para reducir los costos de la atención médica.

data.text:
Privacy Policy

This privacy policy has been compiled to better serve those who are concerned with how their ‘Personally Identifiable Information’ (PII) is being used online. PII, as described in US privacy law and information security, is information that can be used on its own or with other information to identify, contact, or locate a single person, or to identify an individual in context. Please read our privacy policy carefully to get a clear understanding of how we collect, use, protect or otherwise handle your Personally Identifiable Information in accordance with our website.

What personal information do we collect from the people that visit our blog, website or app?

When ordering or registering on our site, as appropriate, you may be asked to enter your email address, mailing address or other details to help you with your experience.

When do we collect information?

We collect information from you when you fill out a form or enter information on our site.

How do we use your information?

We may use the information we collect from you when you register, make a contribution, sign up for our newsletter, respond to a survey or marketing communication, surf the website, or use certain other site features in the following ways:

• To personalize your experience and to allow us to deliver the type of content and product offerings in which you are most interested.

How do we protect your information?

Our website is scanned on a regular basis for security holes and known vulnerabilities in order to make your visit to our site as safe as possible.

We use regular Malware Scanning.

Your personal information is contained behind secured networks and is only accessible by a limited number of persons who have special access rights to such systems, and are required to keep the information confidential. In addition, all sensitive/credit information you supply is encrypted via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) technology.

We implement a variety of security measures when a user enters, submits, or accesses their information to maintain the safety of your personal information.

For your convenience we may store your credit card information kept for more than 60 days in order to expedite future orders, and to automate the billing process.

Do we use ‘cookies’?

Yes. Cookies are small files that a site or its service provider transfers to your computer’s hard drive through your Web browser (if you allow) that enables the site’s or service provider’s systems to recognize your browser and capture and remember certain information. For instance, we use cookies to help us remember and process the items in your shopping cart. They are also used to help us understand your preferences based on previous or current site activity, which enables us to provide you with improved services. We also use cookies to help us compile aggregate data about site traffic and site interaction so that we can offer better site experiences and tools in the future.

We use cookies to:

• Compile aggregate data about site traffic and site interactions in order to offer better site experiences and tools in the future. We may also use trusted third-party services that track this information on our behalf.

You can choose to have your computer warn you each time a cookie is being sent, or you can choose to turn off all cookies. You do this through your browser settings. Since browser is a little different, look at your browser’s Help Menu to learn the correct way to modify your cookies.

If you turn cookies off, Some of the features that make your site experience more efficient may not function properly.It won’t affect the user’s experience that make your site experience more efficient and may not function properly.

Third-party disclosure

We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer to outside parties your Personally Identifiable Information unless we provide users with advance notice. This does not include website hosting partners and other parties who assist us in operating our website, conducting our business, or serving our users, so long as those parties agree to keep this information confidential. We may also release information when it’s release is appropriate to comply with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect ours or others’ rights, property or safety.

However, non-personally identifiable visitor information may be provided to other parties for marketing, advertising, or other uses.

Third-party links

We do not include or offer third-party products or services on our website.

Google

Google’s advertising requirements can be summed up by Google’s Advertising Principles. They are put in place to provide a positive experience for users. https://support.google.com/adwordspolicy/answer/1316548?hl=en

We use Google AdSense Advertising on our website.

Google, as a third-party vendor, uses cookies to serve ads on our site. Google’s use of the DART cookie enables it to serve ads to our users based on previous visits to our site and other sites on the Internet. Users may opt-out of the use of the DART cookie by visiting the Google Ad and Content Network privacy policy.

We have implemented the following:

• Remarketing with Google AdSense

We, along with third-party vendors such as Google use first-party cookies (such as the Google Analytics cookies) and third-party cookies (such as the DoubleClick cookie) or other third-party identifiers together to compile data regarding user interactions with ad impressions and other ad service functions as they relate to our website.

Opting out:

Users can set preferences for how Google advertises to you using the Google Ad Settings page. Alternatively, you can opt out by visiting the Network Advertising Initiative Opt Out page or by using the Google Analytics Opt Out Browser add on.

COPPA (Children Online Privacy Protection Act)

When it comes to the collection of personal information from children under the age of 13 years old, the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) puts parents in control. The Federal Trade Commission, United States’ consumer protection agency, enforces the COPPA Rule, which spells out what operators of websites and online services must do to protect children’s privacy and safety online.

We do not specifically market to children under the age of 13 years old.
Fair Information Practices

Do we let third-parties, including ad networks or plug-ins collect PII from children under 13?

The Fair Information Practices Principles form the backbone of privacy law in the United States and the concepts they include have played a significant role in the development of data protection laws around the globe. Understanding the Fair Information Practice Principles and how they should be implemented is critical to comply with the various privacy laws that protect personal information.

In order to be in line with Fair Information Practices we will take the following responsive action, should a data breach occur:

We will notify the users via in-site notification

• Within 7 business days

We also agree to the Individual Redress Principle which requires that individuals have the right to legally pursue enforceable rights against data collectors and processors who fail to adhere to the law. This principle requires not only that individuals have enforceable rights against data users, but also that individuals have recourse to courts or government agencies to investigate and/or prosecute non-compliance by data processors.

CAN SPAM Act

The CAN-SPAM Act is a law that sets the rules for commercial email, establishes requirements for commercial messages, gives recipients the right to have emails stopped from being sent to them, and spells out tough penalties for violations.

We collect your email address in order to:

• Send information, respond to inquiries, and/or other requests or questions

To be in accordance with CANSPAM, we agree to the following:

If at any time you would like to unsubscribe from receiving future emails, you can email us at and we will promptly remove you from ALL correspondence.

SMS

Text messaging originator opt-in data and consent will not be shared with any third party, except: (1) with vendors, consultants, and other service providers who need access to such information to carry out work on our behalf (and who will not use such information for their own purposes); (2) if we deem disclosure to be required by any applicable law, rule, or regulation or to comply with law enforcement or legal process; and (3) if the user consents to our sharing of such information.

Contacting Us

If there are any questions regarding this privacy policy, you may contact us using the information below.

info@mikiesherrill.com

data.headline: Let’s Get Big Things Done for New Jersey
data.description: New Jersey built this nation. We’ve always been unafraid to do the big things. Let’s be the state that makes life more affordable for families. Let's expand opportunities and help our kids thrive. These challenges aren’t new, so let's confront them head on. I'm on a mission to get things done for New Jersey, and I'm excited to share more with you.

data.headline: nara letter
data.description: Add your description here

data.text: Check out Mikie’s plan to make New Jersey more affordable.

Primera infancia

El acceso a una guardería de calidad es un gran apoyo para las familias y fortalece nuestra economía, pero muchos padres no logran encontrar guarderías disponibles y, cuando lo hacen, no pueden pagarla. Algunos padres se ven obligados a inscribir a sus hijos en programas que no se ajustan a su presupuesto o incluso a abandonar su trabajo para poder cuidarlos. Como madre de cuatro hijos, este tema es personal para mí. Recuerdo haber tenido que tomar esa decisión cuando buscaba una guardería para mis hijos. Así que trabajaré para reducir el costo de las guarderías, para que los padres puedan reincorporarse a la fuerza laboral o trabajar más horas y fortalecer así la seguridad financiera de su familia.

Ya he abordado este tema en el Congreso. Presenté una legislación —inspirada en el ejército y en Head Start— que limitaría los gastos de guardería de una familia al 7 por ciento de sus ingresos y reforzaría la fuerza laboral en la educación preescolar para garantizar que cada familia pueda acceder a una guardería de calidad. Asimismo, ayudé a aprobar una ley que aumentó el crédito tributario por hijos a nivel federal, lo que sacó a casi tres millones de niños de la pobreza. Como gobernadora, aumentaré el crédito tributario por hijos de Nueva Jersey, para reducir la pobreza infantil y ayudar a las familias a costear una guardería —o cualquier otra cosa que necesiten—. 

Nuestras empresas locales experimentan una gran tensión cuando sus empleados no pueden acceder a una guardería confiable. Trabajaré con las empresas de Nueva Jersey para establecer programas de apoyo que les permitan ofrecer las opciones de cuidado infantil que sus empleados necesitan. Las guarderías accesibles no sólo son necesarias para los padres, también son esenciales para las empresas y la economía de Nueva Jersey.

Lea el plan de Mikie para reducir los costos de criar a los niños.

items.title: Item 1
items.value: Delivered millions of dollars in federal funding to projects across New Jersey, with transparency explicitly built into the projects. This focus on transparency included disclosures to prevent self-dealing, public details on what organization had been awarded funding and for what purpose and cost, and certifications of project need.

items.title: Item 2
items.value: Introduced the Supreme Court Ethics and Investigations Act, which would establish a dedicated investigative body and ethics counsel within the Supreme Court to expand transparency and accountability through exhaustive investigations into alleged ethical improprieties and reports to Congress on its findings.

items.title: Item 1
items.value: Led efforts to oppose Donald Trump’s firing of dozens of Inspector Generals, the independent watchdogs who serve within federal agencies and are tasked with investigating allegations of fraud, waste, and abuse.

items.title: Item 1
items.value: Helped lead efforts to pass the Amtrak Transparency and Accountability for Passengers and Taxpayer Act, legislation that would require Amtrak to release more information to the public about the timing and location of their board meetings, allow Americans to observe their meetings, and produce publicly available minutes.

items.title: Item 1
items.value: Passed legislation improving Department of Defense auditing and accountability. These bills boosted Pentagon efforts to make all defense spending fully auditable and helped implement expanded oversight on the Navy’s use of taxpayer dollars.

items.title: Item 1
items.value: Helped to lead amendments to the National Defense Authorization Act that would hold the Pentagon accountable for reviewing and certifying secure protocols for transmitting classified information.

data.text:
U.S. Naval Academy graduate, Navy helicopter pilot, former federal prosecutor, wife, and mother of four kids – Mikie Sherrill proudly serves New Jersey in Congress and is running for governor to make life easier and more affordable for Garden State families. Her career has been defined by service to her country and New Jersey.

Mikie was inspired to join the military by her grandfather, a World War II veteran.

From a young age, she knew she wanted to fly and do big things. After graduating from the Naval Academy in 1994 – the first class of women eligible for combat roles on ships and aircraft – Mikie spent almost 10 years on active duty in the United States Navy. As a Sea King Helicopter pilot, she led missions throughout Europe and the Middle East. She worked on the Battle Watch Floor in the European Theater during the Iraq War, served as a Flag Aide to the Deputy Commander of the U.S. Atlantic Fleet, and was a Russian policy officer aiding in the implementation of our nuclear treaty obligations and oversaw the relationship between the U.S. Navy and Russian Federation Navy.

Following her service in the Navy, Mikie attended and graduated from law school.

She worked in private practice and then joined the U.S. Attorney’s Office in New Jersey. As an Outreach and Reentry Coordinator, Mikie established programs to develop trust between law enforcement and the communities they serve and helped people leaving prison to gain employment, housing, and education to restart their lives. Then as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, she prosecuted federal cases to keep our communities safe and worked to take illegal guns off the streets of New Jersey.

After Donald Trump was first elected, Mikie knew she had to do something to stand up for New Jersey, her country, and the values she swore an oath to defend in the Navy.

In her first-ever run for office, she led a grassroots movement and was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives in 2018 to represent New Jersey’s 11th Congressional District. Her campaign – where she drove an entrenched Republican incumbent out of the race – marked the biggest swing from red to blue in the country that year. 

As a mother raising four children, Mikie is a strong voice in Congress for New Jersey’s families.

Mikie is working hard to bring down costs for families – whether it’s grocery prices, child care, or Trump’s SALT cap that punished New Jersey families. After constant roadblocks from the Christie and Trump administrations, Mikie helped deliver New Jersey’s fair share of federal funding on the Gateway Tunnel Project – the single-largest infrastructure project in American history, which will create good-paying union jobs and reduce commute times for families. She is fighting for reproductive freedom, defending abortion rights, as well as access to contraception and IVF.

And as Donald Trump and Elon Musk threaten New Jerseyans, Mikie is fighting back against the cruelty and destruction coming out of Washington  and defending the programs that working people rely on, including Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, and our schools. 

Mikie holds a Bachelor’s degree from the United States Naval Academy, a Master’s degree in Global History from the London School of Economics and Political Science, and a law degree from Georgetown University.

data.text:
Seguridad pública y justicia 

Todos los habitantes de Nueva Jersey tienen derecho a crecer y vivir en una comunidad segura. Pero para muchas familias, el crimen se ha convertido en una preocupación frecuente. Como gobernadora, me enfocaré de lleno en brindar seguridad para nuestros pueblos y ciudades. 

Como madre de cuatro hijos, soy consciente de las consecuencias que la violencia armada sigue teniendo en nuestros hijos y nuestras comunidades. Nueva Jersey tiene la séptima ley más estricta del país en materia de armas de fuego y, como resultado de estas políticas, tenemos la cuarta tasa de muertes por armas de fuego más baja del país. Me comprometo a aprovechar este éxito incrementando los esfuerzos policiales para sacar las armas ilegales de nuestras calles, evitando que delincuentes violentos adquieran legalmente armas de fuego y aumentando los requisitos para almacenar de manera segura las armas de fuego, especialmente en lugares donde hay niños presentes.

Mientras trabajé en la Fiscalía Federal, vi de primera mano cómo desarrollar la confianza entre la policía y las comunidades a las que sirven, financiar estrategias policiales inteligentes e invertir en servicios públicos basados ​​en evidencia era esencial para combatir la violencia y reducir el crimen. En el Congreso, presenté el paquete de iniciativas SAFE NJ para implementar las siguientes estrategias a nivel federal: financiar iniciativas policiales para prevenir el robo de automóviles, invertir en programas de empleo para jóvenes y ampliar el acceso a tratamientos de salud mental y abuso de sustancias. Como gobernadora, me comprometo a implementar estos programas basados ​​en evidencia en Nueva Jersey y a ampliar programas innovadores y probados como ARRIVE Together, que priorizan los servicios y tratamientos de salud mental y, al mismo tiempo, reducen el uso de la fuerza.

También debemos asegurarnos de que los policías tengan el apoyo y los recursos necesarios para realizar su labor con éxito. Como congresista he trabajado de cerca con líderes policiales para proporcionar a nuestros departamentos de policía las herramientas necesarias, desde la actualización de la infraestructura del 911 hasta la financiación de lectores de placas para combatir el robo de automóviles, para que los agentes puedan servir a nuestras comunidades y nos mantengan seguros. Y, como gobernadora, continuaré haciéndolo.

También es fundamental que invirtamos en servicios integrales de reinserción social para las personas en el sistema de justicia penal. Una condena no es una sentencia de cadena perpetua, pero sabemos que las tasas de reincidencia son extremadamente altas. Para abordar esto con éxito, debemos asegurarnos de que las personas adquieran habilidades reales y tengan acceso a atención y tratamiento de salud mental mientras están en prisión, para que tengan oportunidades reales de educación, vivienda y empleo cuando se reintegren a nuestras comunidades. Los ciudadanos de Nueva Jersey merecen un gobernador que priorice su seguridad y garantice el acceso a la justicia para todos.

items.title: List Title
items.value:
• Launch the New Jersey Report Card — a first-of-its-kind public platform that makes state spending transparent, accessible, and accountable. The Report Card will feature an easy-to-use online portal that shows the payments, contracts, and programs funded by the state government.
  • Require state agencies to evaluate the programs that they operate and identify whether funded programs are actually meeting their goals.
  • Make state contracts fully transparent. Contracts will be posted online, detailing in plain, simple language who won the contract, its total cost, what the state is expected to receive in return, and what was eventually delivered to New Jerseyans.

items.title: List Title
items.value:
• Allow residents to track where their taxpayer dollars are going, how the funding levels of certain programs have changed over time, and the drivers of long-term trends in the state budget and spending.
  • Take a hard look at what state funding actually achieves and how cost-effectively it does so. For programs and contracts that are funded by the state, the Report Card will display costs to taxpayers and evidence-based information on what they deliver for families.
  • Provide New Jerseyans with a plain-language, interactive version of the budget that will allow residents to see what the governor proposed, the changes made by the Legislature, and what was ultimately signed into law.

data.text:
Educación

Nueva Jersey cuenta con algunas de las mejores escuelas públicas del país. Sin embargo, aún existe una desigualdad de oportunidades educativas en varias zonas del estado. Esto genera que mucho talento se desaproveche. Una base sólida comienza por lograr la disponibilidad y accesibilidad de la educación preescolar en todos los rincones del estado. 

Asimismo, estudiantes de todos los distritos de Nueva Jersey siguen enfrentando problemas de salud mental y pérdida de aprendizaje derivados de la pandemia. Es por eso que luché por recuperar los fondos federales para reabrir las escuelas de manera segura y reencaminar a los niños, incluso mediante legislaciones que brindan tutoría de calidad a los estudiantes. Como gobernadora, magnificaré este progreso mediante el apoyo de programas eficaces, como las tutorías de alto impacto, que aborden la pérdida de aprendizaje. Abordaremos la crisis de salud mental al aumentar el número de consejeros escolares, psicólogos y servicios de salud mental en nuestras escuelas. Y, como madre de cuatro hijos, sé que los niños aprenden mejor cuando tienen el estómago lleno. Por ello, haré que todos los estudiantes de Nueva Jersey tengan acceso a comidas escolares gratuitas, porque sabemos que una buena nutrición es esencial para el éxito académico.

Asimismo, al crear vías más sólidas entre las escuelas y el mundo laboral, podemos preparar mejor a los estudiantes que se gradúan de la preparatoria e inician su vida universitaria o profesional. Esto incluye ofrecer más programas de formación profesional, trabajar estrechamente con empresas y universidades, y ampliar los programas de capacitación laboral. Nuestros programas de formación sindical y de capacitación laboral producen algunos de los mejores técnicos del país, y debemos asegurarnos de que cuenten con lo necesario para empoderar a la siguiente generación de trabajadores altamente calificados. Una educación de calidad abre puertas y brinda a los habitantes de Nueva Jersey la oportunidad de forjar su propio camino hacia el éxito.

data.text:
Dr. Dale Caldwell is an educator, pastor, father, and public servant.

Dale has spent his life serving New Jersey, including leadership roles in the public sector, private sector, and higher education. He currently serves as the President of Centenary University. He formerly served as the executive director of the Rothman Institute of Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Fairleigh Dickinson University, President of the Educational Services Commission (ESCNJ), Deputy Commissioner of the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs (DCA), founding executive director of the Newark Alliance and senior manager at Deloitte Consulting. He volunteered on the New Brunswick school board for 26 years, serving as president for six.

Dale is a pastor of the Covenant United Methodist Church in Plainfield, NJ. There, he has built a congregation based on the values of inclusivity, community, and acceptance. He is guided by Proverbs 31:89, which directs us to "speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves."

Service to others was instilled in Dale from a young age. His mother was a teacher and his father, Rev. Gilbert Caldwell, was a leader in the Civil Rights Movement who knew and marched arm-in-arm with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. 

Dale is an avid tennis player and coach.

He was the President and CEO of the United States Tennis Association (USTA) Eastern Section, founded the Black Tennis Hall of Fame, and is a member of the Eastern Tennis Hall of Fame.

Dale currently lives in New Brunswick, NJ, and has one daughter, Ashley, who is studying public policy at Rutgers University.

Dale graduated from Princeton University in 1982, earned his Master’s in Business Administration from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 1988, and a Doctorate in Education Administration from Seton Hall University in 2017.

data.text:
Innovación y tecnología

Nueva Jersey es sede de las empresas más innovadoras y competitivas del mundo, atraídas por el sistema de educación pública y la mano de obra cualificada que brinda el Estado Jardín, y una de las mejores del país. Nueva Jersey ha estado históricamente en el centro de la economía de la innovación de la nación, y estoy comprometida a hacer de nuestro estado el líder en investigación, desarrollo y aplicación de tecnología avanzada una vez más. 

Las nuevas tecnologías — como la inteligencia artificial, los semiconductores, el blockchain, las criptomonedas, y la computación cuántica —  están transformando la economía global del siglo XXI. Estas innovaciones impulsan el crecimiento económico y la creación de empleos de calidad. Necesitamos asegurarnos que Nueva Jersey aproveche esta oportunidad. Nuestro estado no puede quedarse atrás. Como gobernadora, voy a modernizar la manera en que el gobierno colabora con estos sectores e implementaré estrategias en todo el aparato estatal para apoyar a la innovación y hacer crecer nuestra comunidad de empresas emergentes y construir la generación y transmisión de energía limpia para impulsar el desarrollo de nuevas tecnologías e impulsar la asequibilidad para los contribuyentes.

Además necesitamos proteger a las comunidades y familias de quienes se  aprovechan y buscan explotar la tecnología tales como la inteligencia artificial y los “deepfakes” que es utilizado para acosar a los niños o para estafar a personas mayores. La seguridad de nuestros niños es una de mis principales prioridades, una lucha que orgullosamente la he liderado en el Congreso para protegerlos contra el uso de “deepfakes” en la escuela, como vimos en Nueva Jersey el año pasado. Trabajaré con la legislatura para garantizar que las leyes de privacidad de datos, acoso y fraude en el estado se modernicen para combatir a estos malos actores y disuadirlos de atacar a nuestros residentes.

Lea más sobre la Agenda de Seguridad de Mikie y cómo mantendrá a los niños seguros en línea y fortalecerá nuestra democracia.

data.text:
Transporte

En Nueva Jersey, el transporte no es solamente una política, sino la columna vertebral de nuestro estado. Y, hoy, está causando muchos dolores de cabeza a nuestros vecinos.

La población flotante y las familias de Nueva Jersey —incluida la mía— han enfrentado retrasos, congestión y fallas inaceptables en el sistema de transporte, del que dependemos diariamente. Muchos pasajeros han experimentado la frustración de esperar un tren o autobús que llega demasiado tarde o que, incluso, nunca llega. Esto provoca que no lleguen a tiempo a sus trabajos, a reuniones familiares o a eventos de sus hijos. Y nuestra paciencia se pone a prueba al enfrentarnos día con día a los embotellamientos en nuestras carreteras. 

Nueva Jersey necesita un transporte público económico y accesible en el que nuestras familias y pasajeros puedan confiar. Como gobernadora, abordaré el congestionamiento invirtiendo en transporte público y, al mismo tiempo, mejoraré y le daré mantenimiento a nuestra infraestructura vial obsoleta.

He defendido incansablemente la mejora del servicio a lo largo del Corredor Noreste al exigir responsabilidad al gobierno federal por las fallas en el servicio causadas por el descuido y la falta de mantenimiento a los equipos de Amtrak, para que los pasajeros de Nueva Jersey no sigan sufriendo “veranos infernales” año tras año. 

Desde que llegué al Congreso, he sido una firme defensora del Proyecto Gateway para construir un nuevo túnel bajo el río Hudson. Incluso se han referido a mí como “la congresista que está obsesionada con los túneles”. Luché exitosamente para que el dinero de nuestros impuestos regresara a Nueva Jersey para financiar la mayor inversión federal en el sistema de transporte en la historia de Estados Unidos. Este proyecto duplicará la capacidad de los trenes entre Nueva Jersey y Nueva York y creará miles de empleos sindicales bien remunerados. 

A través de la Ley Bipartidista de Infraestructura, recuperé miles de millones de dólares federales para reparar los viejos caminos y puentes de Nueva Jersey, y como gobernadora, continuaré haciendo de las mejoras la principal prioridad.

Por cada dólar gastado en la infraestructura, generamos cinco dólares en actividad económica.  Se trata de un gran rendimiento de la inversión y un motor económico para nuestro estado y región. La línea ferroviaria del Corredor Noreste llega al 20 por ciento de toda la economía estadounidense y las mercancías desde el puerto de Nueva York y Nueva Jersey llegan a cerca del 50 por ciento de los estadounidenses en 36 horas. No podemos permitir que nuestra infraestructura frene este motor económico. Un mayor acceso a esta red de transporte creará vías clave hacia la clase media para las familias de Nueva Jersey. Trabajaré con socios federales y con el estado de Nueva York para mantener el Proyecto Gateway financiado y en tiempo, y aseguraré otras inversiones que mejoren el servicio y la confiabilidad. Y también es momento de que NJ TRANSIT adopte una mentalidad orientada al cliente, mejore su comunicación con los pasajeros y realice inversiones que brinden una mejor experiencia para que las personas lleguen a sus empleos a tiempo. Un sistema de transporte confiable, conveniente y accesible es vital para Nueva Jersey; conectará a las personas con las oportunidades e impulsará la economía de la innovación.

data.text:
Accesibilidad

En Nueva Jersey, nos enorgullecemos de la calidad de nuestras escuelas públicas, del talento de nuestra fuerza laboral y de tener algunas de las empresas más innovadoras del mundo. Sin embargo, nuestro estado se ha vuelto cada vez más inaccesible y ha obligado a muchas familias a tomar la decisión de mudarse a otro estado. Desde que fui elegida por primera vez, he luchado por reducir los impuestos, los costos de la atención médica y los precios de la energía eléctrica, y he combatido el aumento excesivo de precios, con la finalidad de hacer de Nueva Jersey un lugar más accesible para las familias.

Tomemos como ejemplo el altísimo costo de los alimentos. Me he reunido con varias familias de Nueva Jersey y he escuchado de viva voz que el precio de los alimentos es una gran preocupación. Como madre que adquiere alimentos para una familia de seis miembros, incluidos dos hijos adolescentes, me identifico. Como congresista presenté un proyecto de ley que ofrecería incentivos a pequeñas tiendas de alimentos para ayudarlas a competir contra grandes corporaciones y reducir los precios. Como gobernadora, trabajaré con nuestras pequeñas empresas para igualar las condiciones y aumentar la competencia en todo nuestro estado, lo que reducirá directamente los gastos de alimentos para las familias.


Continuaré trabajando para reducir el costo de vida para que las familias puedan permanecer juntas aquí en Nueva Jersey. Me enfocaré en aumentar la disponibilidad y la accesibilidad de la vivienda, en mejorar la transparencia y reducir los costos de la atención médica, y en incrementar la competencia para evitar el aumento excesivo de precios en los supermercados. Como gobernadora, trabajaré constantemente para reducir los gastos para las familias, desde los costos de vivienda y alimentos hasta los de guarderías y atención médica.

Lea el plan de Mikie para reducir costos.

data.title: MEMO: Sherrill’s Decisive, Historic Win in NJ’s Most Competitive Gubernatorial Primary
data.description:
To: Interested Parties
From: Alex Ball, Campaign Manager, Mikie Sherrill for Governor 
Date: June 12, 2025
Subject: Sherrill’s Decisive, Historic Win in NJ’s Most Competitive Gubernatorial Primary

In the most competitive primary in New Jersey history, there was one candidate who clearly soared above the rest — Mikie Sherrill. 

Mikie Sherrill heads into the general election with a resounding victory as a battle-tested candidate who is ready to take on Trenton and fight for families in New Jersey. This is Jack Ciattarelli’s worst fear come to life, because while he flew to Bedminster to pledge his loyalty to Donald Trump, New Jersey voters flew to the polls to overwhelmingly make their voices heard and defend our state from MAGA attacks. With record turnout in a gubernatorial primary, Democrats are motivated, mobilized, and ready for November — united behind Mikie Sherrill. 

From before she announced to the moment the race was called, Mikie Sherrill was underestimated and we were told by the press that this was “wide open,” “anyone’s game,” and “a competitive race with an unpredictable outcome.” But Mikie Sherrill didn’t enter the race for governor with a typical political playbook, and didn’t listen to the doubters, because she’s always been a different kind of leader focused on the mission in front of her. With her training in the Navy and her experience running tough races, our campaign began and ended with listening to voters — not the punditry or media narrative — sharing Mikie’s agenda to deliver for New Jerseyans on the issues that matter most. Above all, we stayed true to the value of servant leadership, dedicated to making life better for New Jerseyans, which clearly resonated across the state. 

Mikie Sherrill was vastly outspent, but never outworked. She was the last entrant into a six-candidate field in November 2024 and solidified a base of support, methodically building on that foundation month over month. 

And when the dust settled and the votes were counted, it was abundantly clear that no one came close to the operation Mikie Sherrill built — and that’s why she had such a commanding victory on election night.  

I. Voters Are Connecting With Mikie’s Commitment to Service and Vision for New Jersey

In addition to all the hard work, discipline, and innovation, the campaign did indeed have a superpower: Mikie Sherrill. Voters across New Jersey embraced Mikie and her extraordinary record of service and dedication to something bigger than herself. Her unconventional life story — Navy helicopter pilot, former federal prosecutor, “most effective” House member from New Jersey, and mom of four — connected with voters in ways traditional candidates couldn’t. Voters inherently understood her commitment to service above self, her dedication to running toward the fight, and her willingness to challenge the conventional ways of doing things. The voters of New Jersey know who Mikie Sherrill is, so they know who she’d fight for, and they chose Mikie to lead New Jersey forward.

Mikie understands that voters are fed up with a broken system and a status quo where families work hard and do everything right, but still can’t get ahead. That’s why she offered a comprehensive and detailed vision for driving down costs with her Affordability Agenda and was the only candidate in the field who shared a plan for protecting our kids and our democracy with her Online Safety Agenda. Her plan would make New Jersey a national leader in safe and accountable tech, and former Rep. Tom Malinowski called it “the most comprehensive I have seen from any candidate in the country.” 

What’s more, voters knew that her agenda wasn’t just words. As voters and community leaders in her district repeatedly reaffirmed, when Mikie Sherrill makes a commitment, you know she will break through walls to make it happen. In a moment where voters are losing trust in institutions, the Democratic Party, and traditional politicians, voters understand that Mikie’s word means something; it’s why she was rated the most trustworthy candidate in the field by a margin of nearly 20 points.  

II. Mikie Sherrill is Powered by the People 

The Mikie Sherrill coalition stretches from every corner of New Jersey, and we saw that in Tuesday’s election results. Mikie went everywhere and talked to everyone, and that resonated with voters and got them involved in the campaign. 

Democrats are energized as Mikie defied the “conventional wisdom” of the race and once again, turned out voters like no other candidate in New Jersey history. This election was historic and is on track to exceed 800,000 Democrats voting in the 2025 gubernatorial primary — a New Jersey record. Mikie dominated the field and currently leads with a margin of more than 100,000 votes and a nearly 14-point spread to her nearest competitor. This record-breaking turnout and Mikie’s overwhelming victory were powered in part by a surge of voters who don’t ordinarily show up, which should give Ciattarelli warning signs for the fall. 

Mikie built a diverse coalition that will propel her to victory in November. The campaign made strategic statewide investments to reach diverse communities, both in paid media and on the ground. Middlesex County is the most diverse county in New Jersey, and Mikie Sherrill had a resounding win. In several counties with significant African-American populations — including Camden, Mercer, and Burlington — Mikie prevailed. She won in townships with a large Latino population, including Belleville, Dover, Vineland, Victory Gardens, Perth Amboy, Union City, and West New York. She won with AAPI voters in communities across the state including in Edison, Montgomery, South Brunswick, and Clifton. And while press coverage pushed a narrative that there were only two candidates competing for the progressive voter, Mikie won progressive strongholds including Maplewood, Westfield, Cranford, Somerville, Manchester, and Ridgewood. 

Mikie dominated up and down New Jersey. She is currently winning in a staggering 15 of 21 counties statewide, many of which she did not have support from the county Democratic Party. In Morris County — a formerly red county that Mikie has won and made competitive for Democrats — she won 62 percent of the vote and counting. It’s no surprise the press has noted Mikie’s candidacy gives the GOP "palpitations," because this is a county that former Gov. Chris Christie won twice and Gov. Phil Murphy lost in the 2017 general election. Mikie also outperformed the presidential ticket in 2020 and 2024 in Morris County. 

Then take a look at Camden County in South Jersey — a Sweeney stronghold — where Mikie is leading with more than 99 percent of the vote counted. She did not have county party support in Camden, but she did have a message and vision that moved voters, and that was the case in other counties in South Jersey where Mikie won like Cape May, Atlantic, Burlington, and Ocean. 

Mikie Sherrill also overperformed Murphy’s 2017 statewide primary vote total. She currently has 270,457 votes and counting, while Murphy received 243,643 votes in the 2017 primary. 

Simply put: Mikie handily won in North, Central, and South Jersey. There was no area of New Jersey where Mikie did not have an incredibly strong showing. 

III. A Disciplined Campaign from a Battle-Tested Candidate 

Our campaign ran the most disciplined operation in the field with an aggressive strategy to reach voters, overcoming a significant money disadvantage and false attacks. 

From day one, spending discipline was a priority for the campaign, given the significant resources of our opponents. While our opponents dropped over $40 million before we spent a dollar on paid communication, and some started their paid media campaigns extremely early, our team decided to hold our resources until voters started to pay more attention to the primary. Also, the chaos coming from Washington and Trump’s second term was loud and distracting; we knew that any attempt to break through early would be a miscalculation. When we hit go, we launched a full-on paid media campaign across both the New York and Philadelphia media markets to English and Spanish-speaking voters. Our strategy resulted in a 2:1 spending advantage over any other candidate in the final week of the campaign — which also translated into a 2:1 turnout advantage over the Republican field on Election Day. 

While we conserved our paid communications resources, we started immediately from launch day to build the grassroots volunteer network that has been the hallmark of Mikie Sherrill campaigns. We competed in every open county convention, earning votes and support from hard-working local Democrats who are in touch with their communities. She was endorsed by grassroots and labor groups including the League of Conservation Voters, Sierra Club, Chatham Moms for Change, Door to Door Democracy, Laborers International Union of North America, New Jersey Firefighters Mutual Benevolent Association, among others. In all, we recruited nearly 2,000 volunteers who shared Mikie’s vision for New Jersey. By Election Day, Team Mikie completed more than 1 million voter contact attempts, including nearly 580,000 phone calls made, more than 555,700 texts sent, and more than 120,000 doors knocked. That outreach spanned from politically active Democrats to disengaged voters who were looking for new leadership, in urban, suburban, and rural communities across the Garden State. 

The campaign aggressively leveraged earned media and digital opportunities to reach voters where they are. That included traditional media outlets and dozens of pieces of content with online influencers & non-traditional media outlets, because our campaign understands that the media landscape has changed. We didn’t play it safe — we went big. Mikie Sherrill now has the blueprint for how to compete online with MAGA. We were ready to respond to the false attacks coming from MAGA Republicans and our opponents. This “go everywhere, talk to everyone” attitude meant our campaign conducted more interviews and reached more voters than any other in the field. The primary will no doubt be a preview for the desperate and false attacks to come from Jack Ciattarelli. Voters resoundingly rejected those attacks in the primary, and they will do it again in the November general election. 

In all, no other campaign had the infrastructure, insight, or fortitude to keep up with Team Mikie. We will build on this from June to November to earn every vote and deliver for New Jersey families. 

IV. Jack Ciattarelli is a Two-Time Loser and Mikie Will Send Him Packing Once and For All

Our next mission is to secure a victory in November, and Mikie is prepared for the fight and to turn out voters in this must-win race that will determine New Jersey’s future and set the stage for Democrats nationwide. Republicans have their sights set on Jersey, with their Trump-endorsed, two-time loser candidate Jack Ciattarelli. That’s why a dark money GOP group spent undisclosed sums and targeted Mikie with false attacks during the primary, because at the end of the day, a Mikie Sherrill candidacy in the general election was their worst fear, now realized. 

And they should be afraid. Mikie is prepared to take on Jack Ciattarelli, stand up to Trump’s Washington, and deliver on her vision for change. She has a track record of beating MAGA Republicans by double-digit margins, galvanizing Democrats and bringing along independents and moderate Republicans. The first head-to-head poll of the general election had Mikie Sherrill with a 13-point advantage, leading 51-38. 

Jack Ciattarelli is on the wrong side of the issues that will decide this election. A failed Trenton insider who is “100% MAGA,” Jack serves himself at New Jersey’s expense. While Jack bills himself as a small business owner, the real story is much more grim: He made millions while peddling misinformation about opioid addiction into our communities, helping fuel a drug epidemic that has devastated New Jersey families. His record as a career politician is also deeply flawed: with taxes going up at every level of government at which he’s served, voting against Superstorm Sandy relief, and defunding Planned Parenthood. Jack won’t stand up to Trump even when he attacks our rights or Social Security and Medicare — in fact, he’s pledged to never sue the Trump administration over illegal executive orders, and couldn’t name a single issue on which he and Trump disagreed. Jack makes big promises on the campaign trail, but the reality is that he has never been with us, and he never will be. 

There is a narrative that after two Democratic terms, Republicans are poised to take the governor’s office. At the same time, there is an equally powerful historical precedent for the party out of power in the White House to take the governor’s seat in New Jersey’s off-year election. But this election will not simply be about looking back – it is about moving forward. Mikie Sherrill has defied the odds her entire career, and is about to do so again. 

Just as Mikie said, quoting George Washington, on election night: She’s resolved to take Trenton and deliver a win for New Jersey. 

###

VIEW THIS MEMO AS A PDF

data.title: Affordability
data.description:
In New Jersey, we pride ourselves on our quality public schools, our talented workforce, and some of the most innovative businesses in the world. But for too many families, our state is increasingly unaffordable, and it’s forced too many New Jerseyans to consider leaving home for another state. Since I was first elected, I’ve focused on making New Jersey a more affordable place for families by fighting for tax relief, lowering health care and energy costs, and cracking down on price gouging.

Take the skyrocketing cost of groceries as an example. I have met with families across New Jersey, and I have heard time and time again that the high price of groceries is a critical concern. As a mom buying food for a family of six, including two teenage boys, I get it. In Congress, I introduced a bill that would provide incentives to small food retailers, helping them compete with big corporations and lower grocery prices. As governor, I will work to create a welcoming business environment for food retailers, increasing competition throughout our state, which will directly reduce grocery bills for families.

I will continue to do more to reduce the cost of living so families can stay together right here in New Jersey. I will focus on making housing more available and more affordable, improving transparency and cutting costs in our health care sector, and expanding competition to prevent price gouging at the supermarket. From housing and grocery prices, to child care and health care, I will work constantly as your governor to bring down costs for families.

Read more about Mikie’s Affordability Agenda, and how it will bring down the cost of living.
data.shortExtraDescription: Write a short blurb about an issue your campaign is highlighting. Try to keep the text a similar size between the various issue blurbs.

data.title: Housing
data.description:
New Jersey families are paying too much for housing, and for too many, the dream of home ownership is getting further and further out of reach. This housing affordability crisis impacts millions of New Jerseyans. It means that students can’t live where they grew up after graduating from college, that seniors can’t age in place or find a home near their children and grandchildren when they retire and are ready to downsize, and that businesses choose to set up shop in other states because their workforce can’t afford to live here. For most families, home ownership is the largest investment they will make and the best opportunity they will have to build generational wealth. But our current housing crisis and high property taxes mean many families may never get that opportunity. 

At the root of the problem is a severe housing shortage and a lack of supply at all levels. Since 2019, New Jersey has seen the second-largest decline in available housing inventory in the entire nation. That is not sustainable for families or our economy. We must revive New Jersey as a state that builds, leads, and innovates on housing. 

As governor, I am committed to improving housing affordability by increasing new home construction that meets the needs of all residents. More housing will expand opportunities for home ownership and help drive down rental costs as supply increases. I will work with our municipalities to expand “Missing Middle” housing that both grows our supply and works for our communities. I will work to provide financing and assistance to municipalities to help them repurpose underutilized infrastructure, like converting commercial buildings into housing units. By supporting new housing and redevelopment, municipalities can boost their tax base without burdening homeowners with higher rates. I will also strengthen first-time homebuyer programs to allow more New Jerseyans to build equity in the communities where they work and crack down on landlords who illegally discriminate against families and neglect to keep their properties in livable condition. Bringing down housing costs will unlock economic growth and help families keep more of their paychecks.

Read more about Mikie’s Affordability Agenda, and how it will bring down the cost of housing.

data.title: ICYMI: New Jersey League of Conservation Voters Endorses Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
Leading environmental advocacy group issues bold early endorsement of candidate for New Jersey Governor with strong record of leadership on climate, energy and environmental issues who is prepared to stand up to Trump

Hamilton, New Jersey — On Wednesday, February 19, New Jersey’s leading environmental advocacy organization, the New Jersey League of Conservation Voters (New Jersey LCV), endorsed Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill’s campaign to serve as the next Governor of the Garden State. 

“Based on Mikie Sherrill’s outstanding record of environmental leadership in Congress, New Jersey LCV has concluded she is far and away the best candidate to deliver bold environmental policy leadership that will make a crucial difference in fighting the climate crisis, lowering energy costs, and protecting our environment and every New Jersey family’s right to breathe clean air and drink pure water,” said Ed Potosnak, Executive Director, New Jersey LCV. “At a time when our environment is under unprecedented attack from Donald Trump, Congresswoman Sherrill has the courage to stand up for New Jersey’s working families against dirty oil and gas CEOs. And she has the ability to unite people across New Jersey from all walks of life around a shared vision of a brighter and more prosperous future for us all.”

“Since Day One, this has been a campaign we’re building together to address New Jersey’s most pressing challenges. That includes protecting our environment, and I’m honored to have the New Jersey League of Conservation Voters’ endorsement as we fight for cleaner and healthier communities across the Garden State. As governor, I’ll make bold investments to fix our grid and transition to clean energy — not only will it create good-paying jobs of the future, it will produce emission-free energy sources while bringing more price stability for families’ utilities,” said Mikie Sherrill. “While Elon Musk and President Trump try to roll back our efforts to combat climate change, we have to chart a different path forward in New Jersey. I will work every day to reduce energy costs, build flood-resilient infrastructure, protect our open spaces, and make sure that every one of our children can drink clean water and breathe clean air, no matter their ZIP code. Let’s get to work!”

Congresswoman Sherrill’s leadership in Washington and on the ground in New Jersey has made a critical difference in securing multiple major legislative victories in recent years that boosted clean energy, protected New Jersey communities from the impacts of climate change and created union jobs.

She championed provisions in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to help address methane emissions that have long plagued low-income communities as well as landmark legislation  for clean energy that will create jobs and lower energy costs. Sherrill also helped secure $72 million to improve resiliency up and down the Jersey Shore, protecting communities from the increasingly severe storms caused by climate change in ways that revitalize sensitive ecosystems and expand access to open space.

Sherrill’s aggressive support of clean energy and environmental protections is more important than ever, as Donald Trump has launched an unprecedented attack on the environment, seeking to further enrich oil and gas billionaires, who are already enjoying Federal subsidies and reaping record profits, at the expense of the health and safety of New Jersey residents.

Congresswoman Sherrill has been a leader on the environment from her earliest days in Congress, working with local officials to understand their most pressing concerns and driving federal action towards solutions. She collaborated with six municipalities to kickstart and deliver funding for a regional flood mitigation initiative for the Whippany River, and advanced flood mitigation projects with the Army Corps of Engineers after decades of delays. She has proven she can deliver  during her tenure in the U.S. House of Representatives, helping local communities take on issues that threaten our air and drinking water, like PFAS (forever chemicals) contamination and lead service lines. She knows what it takes to address our biggest challenges and is the person we need in Trenton during this unprecedented assault on our environmental future. 

Sherrill has also worked with local elected officials, state agencies, and environmental organizations to secure funding for NJ TRANSIT to prevent more “Summers of Hell” and reduce emissions, and has outlined a comprehensive strategy to put NJ TRANSIT’s long-term budget on a sustainable footing.

With Trump seeking to roll back federal clean energy investments and environmental regulations, it is more important than ever that New Jersey have a governor in Trenton who will fight for our state’s working families by vigorously enforcing laws that keep our air and water safe and by doubling down on our state’s commitment to fighting climate change.

New Jersey LCV issued this endorsement after a comprehensive process designed to identify the candidate with the strongest environmental vision who combined with the ability to build the broad-based coalition necessary to win and govern in one of the most diverse states in the nation.

The organization’s board, which voted on the endorsement, required two-thirds of its members to approve and conducted extensive interviews with the candidates currently in the race.

By making this endorsement so early in the election cycle, New Jersey LCV is elevating the importance of strong climate action and environmental protection. Today’s announcement is the first step of a comprehensive and well-funded electoral effort to elect Sherrill because of her bold vision for the environment that will strengthen New Jersey families by lowering costs and creating jobs.

“From sanitation to flood risk management to reducing and eliminating the dangers of ‘forever’ PFAS chemicals, Mikie Sherrill has led on issue after issue to help reduce environment-caused risk to every day New Jerseyans and their families,” said Randy Jones, New Jersey LCV Board Chair. “For all these reasons and more, Congresswoman Sherrill has earned New Jersey LCV’s full confidence. Congresswoman Sherrill will serve as an outstanding Governor for New Jersey and will protect our environment and public health needs for years to come.”
 

###

data.title: WHAT MONMOUTH IS READING: “Mikie Sherrill's charisma is that she's completely herself”
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In case you missed it, the triCityNews — a weekly newspaper in Monmouth County — is out with a new story about the different kind of leadership that Mikie will bring to New Jersey, rooted in her nearly 10 years in the U.S. Navy as a helicopter aircraft commander and Russian policy officer. 

See below for key excerpts and the full story: 

  • Politicians are great actors. This woman is not an actor, doesn’t want to be an actor and couldn’t do it even if she tried. If you want a great show, go stream one on Netflix. Sherrill’s charisma is that she’s completely herself. 

  • There is just something about this woman that transcends politics — no doubt from her military service that melded Americans from all different backgrounds into a single mission on behalf of our country.

  • But Sherrill is different. I sense that the partisan stops at some healthy point within her. And then instincts take over of unity of purpose instilled in her formative years in the Navy.

  • Sherrill is the opposite of the divisive chaos we now see engulfing our country. This woman is solid, stable and ruthlessly competent. Yet Sherrill is warm, funny and engaging in person. I can totally picture her as Governor.

  • Clearly, her leadership qualities were formed by her experience in the Navy as a helicopter pilot and earlier as an undergraduate at the U.S. Naval Academy. To become a naval aviator is intense — including simulated torture that felt awfully real as part of her training in case she was shot down and captured by an enemy.

  • “It develops a mental toughness,” Sherrill said of serving in the military. “It develops an ability to face hard things and challenges. In fact, that’s why people go into the military, to test yourself. To put yourself up to these challenges. We do it to put ourselves in service to our country. No one goes in there to make a million dollars. We’re all very proud of what we do.”

  • It’s about unity of purpose among people of all types and differences — exactly what’s dangerously missing in this country. Twenty years out of the Navy, that’s still what she’s about at her core. That’s what attracts me to her as Governor. And I got to see it for myself in our lengthy discussion. It goes right along with a calm and confidence that you get in pilots like her.

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Rolls Out Comprehensive Strategy to Tackle New Jersey’s Cost of Living Crisis
data.description:
Mikie’s Affordability Agenda is a Roadmap for How She’ll Bring a Different Type of Leadership to Trenton to Lower Costs for Families

BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill brought together working New Jerseyans at the Bloomfield Fire Station today to introduce her Affordability Agenda — a roadmap for how she will lower costs for New Jerseyans as governor. Mikie’s agenda is an innovative plan that outlines how she will tackle the biggest factors that are driving up costs for families. 

“I hear from New Jerseyans all across the state about how they love living here — but, from housing to health care to utilities, life is just too expensive. For too long, career politicians have promised to do something about it, but nothing seems to change. I’ll bring a different kind of leadership to Trenton — I was trained in the Navy to focus on the mission and I’ve never backed down from a tough challenge. My top priority as governor will be lowering costs and building opportunities for New Jerseyans — and my Affordability Agenda is a plan for how we’ll get there. I’ll start by going after Donald Trump, Elon Musk, and anyone else who tries to rip New Jerseyans off and sell us out — and I’ll make bold investments to ensure that working families can live and thrive here,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

You can read the detailed plan here. 

Mikie’s Affordability Agenda contains six pillars to address the major issues driving New Jersey’s affordability crisis. As governor, Mikie will:

  • Lower housing costs by working collaboratively with municipalities to redevelop underused commercial properties into homes — and by providing assistance and incentives to localities to build a range of housing options like workforce housing and “Missing Middle” units. She will also streamline state permitting and give assistance to first-time homebuyers — while cracking down on predatory actors who buy up properties and collude to rig rental prices. 

  • Reduce utility bills by taking bold action to invest in cheap, clean energy like solar — and host it on more state properties. By developing clean power resources, we can reduce our carbon footprint, increase energy independence, and help families across the state save money.

  • Keep health care costs under control by improving price transparency for patients, holding Pharmacy Benefit Managers accountable for ripping New Jerseyans off on prescription drugs, and expanding access to primary and preventative care.

  • Provide tax relief by expanding the Child Tax Credit, incentivizing the use of shared services to keep property taxes down, cracking down on tax cheats who don’t pay their fair share, and conducting a third-party audit of the State Health Benefits Program claims to claw back overpayments.

  • Support kids and their parents by expanding on-the-job training for child care providers to help open more slots, providing school meals to students at no cost to parents, and expanding access to high-impact tutoring and mental health care.

  • Drive down food prices by giving incentives to local grocers to boost competition in the market, expanding support for New Jersey’s farmers, and going after the large corporations that jack up food prices to turn a profit.

###

data.title: ICYMI: Jack’s Very Bad Debate Night on Taxes and Affordability
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In last night’s debate, Jack Ciattarelli doubled down on his disastrous, tax-raising record. While Mikie outlined her plans to lower costs, Jack opposed property tax relief and embraced Trump’s MAGA agenda which is already costing New Jersey. 

“In 1990, Jack Ciattarelli took his first of many votes to raise taxes – the same year I took my first oath to the Constitution as a teenager in the Navy. He doubled down on that disastrous record last night: calling property tax relief a gimmick and wholeheartedly embracing Trump’s MAGA agenda that’s costing New Jersey, from Medicaid cuts to tariffs. While Jack has repeatedly said a 10% sales tax is on the table, I have been very clear on this: it’s off the table for me and I will not raise the sales tax as your governor,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

Here are the facts from the debate: 

  • Jack opposed senior property tax relief and called them “gimmicks.” 
     

  • He doubled down on his support of Trump’s extension of the SALT deduction cap, which will cost New Jersey $30 billion more in property taxes.
     

  • Jack reinforced his support of Trump’s plan to defund the Department of Education, which could raise property taxes in New Jersey communities.
     

  • He embraced Trump’s cuts to Medicaid, which will eliminate healthcare for over 350,000 New Jerseyans and blow a $3.6 billion hole into our state budget.
     

  • After saying New Jersey would have to feel “pain” on Trump’s tariffs, Jack was silent when pressed by Mikie; these tariffs are already hurting businesses and costing the average family $2,300 more a year because of higher prices on everyday things we buy.
     

  • He opposed consolidation and defended the status quo “even though it might cost more taxes.”
     

That’s because his record of raising taxes is extensive and indefensible: 

  • On the campaign trail, Jack has continued to float a 10 percent sales tax in New Jersey, saying all options are on the table, and has been talking about raising the sales tax since 2017.
     

  • Jack has voted to raise taxes in every office he has held.
     

  • He voted against $1 billion in property tax relief in the state legislature.
     

  • Jack admitted in certain municipalities “property taxes are going to go up because of my school reform plan.”
     

  • In 2021, NorthJersey.com reported: “On paper, Ciattarelli’s proposals make for a lopsided ledger: about $13 billion in revenue cuts from the current budget if his ideas became policy.” 


Bottom line: No wonder Jack’s career as a CPA was short-lived: his math doesn’t add up and it always leads to higher costs for the people of New Jersey.

###
