data.title: Sherrill: Ciattarelli Will Be an Enthusiastic Yes-Man to Trump
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after Trump endorsed Jack Ciattarelli in the Republican gubernatorial primary: 

“We know Donald Trump looks for nothing less than 100 percent loyalty and complete subservience, so it’s no surprise that he found an obedient ‘yes-man’ in Jack Ciattarelli, who he says is ‘ALL IN’ on MAGA. This endorsement makes clear that Ciattarelli won’t have the backbone it takes to break with Trump or be an independent voice for New Jersey. He’s pledged to bring Elon Musk’s DOGE to the Garden State, which would harm families and wreak havoc on our economy. Now it’s even more important for Democrats to nominate a candidate who can win — I have the track record of beating MAGA Republicans in every election, and I’ll do it again in November.” 
 

###

data.title: Jack-Backed Bill will Cause 500,000 New Jerseyans’ Health Insurance Prices to “Soar”
data.description:
Jack-backed bill is “forcing New Jersey residents to dig deeper to pay for health insurance”

BLOOMFIELD — In another example of Jack Ciattarelli bowing down to Donald Trump and costing New Jerseyans more of their hard earned money, Jack supported the price hike bill that is forcing more than half a million New Jerseyans to “dig deeper to pay for health insurance.”

New Jerseyans are scared, saying, “I'm afraid to know (how much it will be), to tell you the truth… It's so much money as it is.” An average family of four currently getting tax credits (which the overwhelming majority of people in Get Covered NJ do) would see their premium increase by more than $4,000.

“Every New Jerseyan should be able to access the care they need without falling into medical debt. It’s unacceptable that Jack backs the bill that will cause more than half a million New Jerseyans’ health insurance prices to soar. I’m running for governor to make life more affordable for Garden State families, while Jack is lock-step with Trump’s plan to throw people off coverage and raise costs,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Peggy Driscoll is one of the many New Jerseyans whose health insurance prices will “soar” because of the Jack/Trump MAGA agenda: 

  • Peggy Driscoll, 63-year-old Hazlet resident already “pays $536 a month… after getting $834 in subsidies and a $100 state tax credit.” 

  • Peggy said “she struggles keeping up with the payments, noting she tries to avoid doctors visits when she can because of out-of-pocket costs.” 

  • Because of the bill Jack supports, Peggy’s “premium could more than double. But she has little choice but to buy the coverage; she said has gone without health insurance before and knows it's not a risk she wants to take again.”

  • Peggy is nervous about the increasing costs, telling the Asbury Park Press, “I'm afraid to know (how much it will be), to tell you the truth… It's so much money as it is.”

data.title: En el debate de anoche, Jack mostró lo que siempre hace: aumentar los impuestos y los costos para Nueva Jersey, mientras Mikie los baja
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — En el debate de anoche, Jack Ciattarelli confirmó lo que ya sabemos: su historial está lleno de aumentos de impuestos y decisiones que hacen más cara la vida en Nueva Jersey. Mientras Mikie Sherrill presentó un plan real para reducir los costos que enfrentan nuestras familias, Jack se opuso al alivio en los impuestos a la propiedad y se alineó sin reservas con la agenda MAGA de Trump que está costando caro a las familias trabajadoras del estado.

“En 1990, mientras yo servía a mi país en la Marina y hacía mi primer juramento a la Constitución, Jack empezaba su carrera política votando para subir impuestos por primera vez. Anoche, volvió con la misma fórmula fracasada: llamó al alivio de impuestos a la propiedad un ‘truco’ y defendió la agenda MAGA de Trump que está vaciando los bolsillos de Nueva Jersey —desde recortes a Medicaid que ponen en riesgo la salud de nuestras familias, hasta aranceles que aumentan el precio de la comida, la energía y lo que compramos todos los días.

Jack ha dicho varias veces que un impuesto de ventas del 10% está sobre la mesa. Yo he sido clara: como su gobernadora, no subiré el impuesto a las ventas. Al contrario, mi prioridad es darles un respiro a las familias trabajadoras de Nueva Jersey”, afirmó Mikie Sherrill.

Lo que Jack dejó en claro en el debate:

  • Se opuso al alivio de impuestos a la propiedad para los adultos mayores y lo llamó un “truco”.
     

  • Defendió la extensión del límite a la deducción SALT impuesto por Trump, que le costará a Nueva Jersey 30 mil millones de dólares más en impuestos a la propiedad.
     

  • Respaldó el plan de Trump de recortar fondos al Departamento de Educación, lo que subiría los impuestos locales y afectaría directamente a nuestras escuelas.
     

  • Apoyó los recortes de Trump a Medicaid, poniendo en riesgo la cobertura médica de más de 350,000 residentes de Nueva Jersey y creando un hueco de 3.6 mil millones en el presupuesto estatal.
     

  • Dijo que Nueva Jersey debía sentir el “dolor” de los aranceles de Trump, y cuando Mikie lo enfrentó, se quedó callado. Estos aranceles ya están asfixiando a los negocios y le cuestan a la familia promedio $2,300 más al año en lo que compramos día a día.
     

  • Defendió el status quo y se opuso a la consolidación, aunque eso signifique más impuestos para todos.


El historial de Jack no miente:

  • Desde 2017, ha defendido públicamente un impuesto a las ventas del 10% en Nueva Jersey.
     

  • En cada cargo que ha ocupado, ha votado para subir impuestos.
     

  • Votó en contra de $1,000 millones en alivio de impuestos a la propiedad que habrían beneficiado directamente a nuestras familias.
     

  • Admitió que con su plan de “reforma escolar” los impuestos a la propiedad subirán en varios municipios.
     

  • Según NorthJersey.com (2021), sus propuestas habrían creado un déficit de $13 mil millones en el presupuesto estatal.
     

En resumen: Jack siempre elige más impuestos, costos más altos y más dolor para nuestras familias y ni siquiera como contador público certificado logra que sus números cuadren. En cambio, Mikie elige alivio, soluciones reales y un Nueva Jersey más justo para todos. 

###

data.title: ICYMI: New Jersey UFCW Locals Endorse U.S. Rep. Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
TRENTON – The United Food and Commercial Workers International Union (UFCW) Locals 152, 312, 360, 464A, 888, and 1262, representing more than 66,000 workers across the Garden State, announced their endorsement of Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill for Governor of New Jersey. 

“UFCW Local 152 is proud to endorse Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill for Governor of New Jersey,” said Daniel Ross, Jr., president of UFCW Local 152. “Our local represents thousands of workers across the state, and with Congresswoman Sherrill as governor, there lies an opportunity to have a strong ally in Trenton who shares our mission to protect workers’ rights and advocate for all working families in New Jersey.”

“Congresswoman Sherrill’s 100 percent record of voting with labor shows that she has been a constant partner to us throughout her time in Congress,” said Robert LaSalle, president of UFCW Local 312. “We know she’ll fight every day to lower health care costs, secure pensions, and improve the lives of UFCW Local 312 members as governor. We’re excited to endorse her and send her to Trenton this fall.”

"Mikie Sherrill has always stood with working people,” said Sam Ferraino, president of UFCW Local 360. “She listens, she shows up, and she fights for the issues that matter to our members—good jobs, fair wages, and the right to organize. We’re proud to support her because we know she has our back."

“Mikie Sherrill is my Congressional Representative in the 11th District where I reside,” said John T. Niccollai, president of UFCW Local 464A. “I can personally attest to the fact that she gets involved in everything important and fights tirelessly on our behalf. She is the real deal.”

“I have firsthand experience of the political skills and leadership of Mikie, having lived in the 11th district of Morris County for over 20 years – a ruby red district that she was able to flip blue in 2018 after the retirement of 12-term Republican Congressman Frelinghuysen,” said Max Bruny, president of UFCW Local 888. “She is the fighter New Jersey needs during these challenging times. On behalf of UFCW Local 888, I wholeheartedly endorse Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill as our next governor.”

“Local 1262 is proud to report that our Executive Board voted unanimously to endorse Mikie Sherrill in her bid to become New Jersey’s next governor,” said Harvey Whille, president of UFCW Local 1262. “Mikie is, as they say, ‘the real deal,’ and as governor, will continue to fight for New Jersey’s working families, including our 22,000 members.”

Congresswoman Sherrill has been a relentless advocate for UFCW members and all working people in New Jersey throughout her time in Congress:

  • Congresswoman Sherrill co-sponsored the PRO Act, which would expand the rights of workers to form unions, protect them from union-busting, and allow them to secure strong contracts that raise wages, provide health care, and ensure better working conditions.

  • As Congress debates new tax and spending legislation, Congresswoman Sherrill has consistently opposed any cuts to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program and Medicaid, which support thousands of jobs held by UFCW members in the Garden State. Sherrill has a 100 percent record of voting with labor.

  • During her campaign for governor, she has committed to appointing a Commissioner of Labor and Attorney General who will strongly carry out all wage and hour laws and vigorously protect the labor rights of UFCW members and all workers in New Jersey.

UFCW Locals 152, 312, 360, 464A, 888, and 1262 represent over 66,000 members who work in food and non-food retail, healthcare, cannabis, manufacturing, food processing, warehouses, and public sector industries across New Jersey and are part of the UFCW International, the largest private sector union in the United States. Learn more about the UFCW at ufcw.org.
 

###

data.title: ICYMI: Largest Federal Employee Union Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Last week, the American Federation of Government Employees, the largest union of federal employees, endorsed Mikie Sherrill for governor because of her “100% voting record on issues critical to union families” and her strong record fighting for workers, protecting collective bargaining rights, and commitment to expanding opportunity to all New Jerseyans.

“I am honored to have the support of AFGE. Our dedicated and tireless public servants keep this state running, and I am committed to ensuring they have the resources they need to best help our residents. At a time when unions are under attack from Donald Trump and his lackey Jack Ciattarelli, I will be the governor who stands up for New Jerseyans and fights to build a Garden State that works for all our families,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

“During her time in Congress, Rep. Sherrill has earned a 100 percent lifetime voting record from AFGE and the AFL-CIO on issues critical to union members and working families. As New Jersey’s next governor, Mikie Sherrill will fight to protect our social safety net programs like Social Security and Medicare and defend working people’s right to form and join a union,” AFGE District 2 National Vice President David Gonzalez said.

###

data.title: DAY ONE: State of Emergency on Utility Costs
data.description:
KENILWORTH — Utility bills just keep getting more expensive, and New Jerseyans are paying the price. We can’t afford to wait any longer. So on Day One as governor, Mikie is going to enact a State of Emergency on Utility Costs. She’ll freeze the rate hikes, massively build out cheaper and cleaner power generation, and require more transparency from our utility companies, including PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric, and Rockland Electric, and our grid operator, PJM. 

“New Jersey families are being crushed by their utility bills and we’ve reached a crisis point. But in the Navy, you learn that in times of crisis, you have to lead, follow, or get out of the way. I’m running to lead, and I am going to be the governor who lowers your utility bills. So on Day One, I’m going to declare a State of Emergency on Utility Costs to freeze these rate hikes and build out New Jersey’s energy arsenal, which will immediately lower costs. And I’m not afraid to take on anyone – whether it’s the utility companies, our grid operator, or my own party — to get it done. Meanwhile, Jack Ciattarelli is going to sit back and let Donald Trump drive up energy costs while making New Jerseyans foot the bill,” said Mikie Sherrill.


Mikie announced her plans today in Kenilworth alongside Herb Michitsch, a Kenilworth senior, and Keith Misciagna from IBEW Local 164, who shared how the 20% utility rate increases are already stretching their budgets thin:

“Utilities are really putting a dent in our budget. When we first moved in, I believe our electric bill was under $100 a month, now it’s creeping up close to $400 a month. When Mikie is governor, I’m sure on day one, she will stop the increase in utilities. Mikie will sure help make New Jersey as affordable for my family and for others in this state, bringing down the costs of living and utility prices,” said Herb Michitsch, a Kenilworth senior. 

“It’s extremely important that Mikie declares a state of emergency on utility costs. She’ll eliminate unnecessary red tape and permitting delays, so new, cheaper, cleaner energy can be built. This new arsenal in our state will bring down bills and help working families make ends meet. More power generation means more good-paying union jobs and more families with a pathway to a middle class,” said Keith Misciagna from IBEW Local 164.

Read Mikie’s full plan here and below:

STATE OF EMERGENCY ON UTILITY COSTS


Utility costs are out of control in New Jersey. Families are spending almost their entire budget just to pay the electric bill this summer. It’s time for action, because people just can’t wait any longer. So on Day One as New Jersey’s next governor, I’m going to declare a State of Emergency on Utility Costs and freeze your utility rates, massively build out cheaper and cleaner power generation, and require more transparency from our utility companies including PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric, and Rockland Electric.

INTRODUCTION

Life in New Jersey is too expensive and every single New Jerseyan who pays the bills knows it. It’s appalling that while costs rise on everything, New Jerseyans are now being slapped with a 20% increase in their utility bills, and Donald Trump’s tax hike bill will increase costs by an additional $220 per year by cancelling cheap and clean generation and energy efficiency programs. We’ve all had enough of it; no one can afford it; it’s got to stop. That changes when I’m governor. Too many people – our utility companies and grid operator, the administration in Trenton, and Donald Trump in Washington — have kicked the can down the road and not been held accountable for their decisions. New Jersey isn’t generating even close to enough in-state power to keep costs low, and we risk missing the clean energy targets that we need to protect our environment for generations to come. I’m not going to accept that.

In the military, you’re trained to run towards a crisis. When I was leading my crews as a Navy helicopter pilot, everyone was accountable to me and delaying my response to an emergency wasn’t an option. New Jersey is facing an energy crisis now because no one has taken leadership and no one has been held accountable. That’s not how I was trained, and it’s not how I will govern. I will bring a different kind of leadership and accountability to lower utility costs for families. That starts with declaring a State of Emergency on Day One, through which I will freeze utility costs,massively expand cheaper and cleaner energy generation to build an energy arsenalin our state, open the books and require more transparency from our utility companies, and force our grid operator PJM to end its years of mismanagement and add powerimmediately. Prices are spiking because of a huge power shortage — I’ll transform New Jersey’s energy picture to build new, cheaper, and cleaner energy generation, bring down families’ bills, and put the Garden State on track to hit our emissions and clean air goals. 

ACTIONS UNDER THE STATE OF EMERGENCY

  1. To provide immediate relief, I will freeze utility costs for families as we rapidly expand new, cheaper, and cleaner power generation to lower costs. 

    1. I will ensure that the average New Jersey family sees no increase in their utility rates over the next year

  2. I will massively increase New Jersey’s power generation to build an energy arsenal in our state and make our energy supply cheaper and cleaner.

    1. I’ll eliminate unnecessary red tape and permitting delays to open up the floodgates on new energy projects that increase our power supply, lower costs, and make our air cleaner, because more power generation means lower bills.

    2. This means immediately breaking ground on new solar and battery storage projects, expediting capacity upgrades at our existing nuclear plants, and streamlining the modernization of existing natural gas facilities to make them cleaner and more efficient — which will lower costs, reduce carbon emissions, and boost reliability and energy independence right now.

    3. Due to Trump’s price hike bill, new solar projects must begin construction by July 2026 to receive federal tax credits, so we have no time to waste. Solar is the fastest energy source to build right now and the cheapest form of power generation nationwide, but permitting roadblocks and interconnection delays are preventing us from hitting our goals — which is increasing utility bills and making our air dirtier.

    4. We’re importing dirty and expensive energy like coal from other states, and that has to stop.

    5. I’ll also immediately develop plans for new nuclear capacity in Salem County, which is critical to meeting our energy needs. I’ll sit down with neighboring states to harness economies of scale to build new reactors in our region at a low cost.

  3. I will require a new level of transparency and accountability from our utility companies, including PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric, and Rockland Electric.

    1. I’ll immediately open up their books to see where rising costs to families are going, and make sure their voting records at our grid operator’s board meetings are consistent with what is best for New Jersey.

    2. I’ll ensure that price gouging and collusion isn’t happening in energy and utility markets.

    3. And I’ll immediately convene an emergency meeting of New Jersey’s utility companies to ensure they are connecting new, cheaper, and cleaner power generating projects to our energy supply as fast as possible, including by working with them to address bottlenecks at our grid operator, PJM.

  4. I will instruct my Attorney General to take Trump and New Jersey’s grid operator, PJM, to court – in coordination with governors in our region — to force them to end their mismanagement and instead accelerate the development of cheaper and cleaner energy sources and connect new power generation to our grid immediately.

    1. New energy projects can’t lower utility bills if they’re waiting years to start producing energy, but PJM refuses to connect them quickly.

    2. President Trump is actively thwarting the development of new, needed power plants. I will take him on over his destructive efforts to block crucial power supplies, which will reduce our energy rates and make our air cleaner.

TAKING ON ANYONE TO LOWER UTILITY COSTS

In my administration, bringing down the cost of living and being accountable to the people of New Jersey will be my number one priority. 

Make no mistake: I am willing to take on anybody, including my own party and the powerful utility companies, to get this job done for New Jersey.New Jersey’s grid operator PJM has refused to connect enough new, cheap, and clean energy generation to the grid for years, but New Jersey waited to act until we were hit with a 20% rate increase. While other states were taking action, New Jersey hesitated and was sidelined for far too long. The result is that we don’t have enough in-state generation to keep costs low and we risk missing our clean power targets. That is unacceptable. In my administration, Board of Public Utilities nominees, who hold huge power over rate hikes, will share my commitment to driving down energy costs above all else. If they don’t, they shouldn’t get too comfortable. 

I will take bold action to reduce costs – no matter who it ticks off in New Jersey or Washington, DC.Trump’s price hike bill is increasing utility costs by $220 per year by cancelling hundreds of new, cheap, and clean power generation projects across our state. PJM’s mismanagement and refusal to connect projects to the grid is costing families a further $400 a year. I’ll take them on and beat them, because we have to lower utility bills right now.

When I become governor, I will take on Trump, the utility companies, and anyone who refuses to put New Jerseyans first.

###

data.title: What They Are Saying: Mikie Outlined Her Plan For A More Affordable Garden State While Jack Refused To Break With Trump
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Earlier this week, Mikie Sherrill laid out a bold vision for how she will serve the people of New Jersey to bring costs down, while Jack Ciattarelli embraced and supported Trump’s MAGA agenda. Whether it was on utility costs, online safety, standing up to Trump, or making state government work for New Jerseyans — all issues that are top of mind for voters this election — the contrast was clear: Mikie has a plan to fight for New Jersey families, “100% MAGA” Jack will fight for Trump. 

In case you missed the debate — the AP summed up Jack’s debate (and his entire campaign) in one sentence: “Ciattarelli did not criticize Trump or break with the Republican president on any issue, expressing support for his ‘big, beautiful’ budget bill and his plans to end the Department of Education and revise national vaccine policies.” 

Here’s what people are saying about Mikie’s commanding debate performance: 

“Only one candidate in this race is committed to making New Jersey more affordable – that’s Mikie Sherrill. She made her laser focus on cutting costs and taking on the grid operators raising energy prices crystal clear last night, and all Jack Ciattarelli did was dodge the fact that he’s raised taxes at every level of government he’s served,” said New Jersey state Senator Vin Gopal. 

“Our next governor needs to put affordability at the center of every decision they make, and that’s exactly what Mikie Sherrill is going to do. She laid out a comprehensive agenda for ending utility rate hikes and saving time and money here in New Jersey,” said Former New Jersey state Senator Steve Sweeney.

“Last night, Jack showed that kissing up to Donald Trump will always come before supporting our kids. Whether his shocking defense of school segregation, cheering along RFK Jr.'s attacks on science and vaccines that protect our kids, or support for Trump’s plan to defund the Department of Education — it’s clear a Ciattarelli administration would make our kids’ less healthy and their lives more dangerous. Mikie has a plan to build opportunities for our kids and ensure that every child, regardless of zip code, has access to a world-class education,” said New Jersey state Assemblyman Al Abdelaziz. 

“We know that families across New Jersey are struggling with out-of-control costs, and we need our next governor to fight for working families. Mikie Sherrill will take on anyone to lower costs for New Jerseyans, but Jack Ciattarelli is only focused on Trump and the extreme MAGA agenda,” said New Jersey state Assemblywoman Ellen Park.  

“Mikie Sherrill commanded the stage in the first New Jersey gubernatorial debate, highlighting her vision for the state and her plan to lower utility costs, protect kids online, and support small businesses. Jack Ciattarelli, once again, tied himself completely to Donald Trump and hid his record because even he knows it’s indefensible. The contrast couldn’t be clearer and EMILYs List is proud to be working to elect Mikie Sherrill as New Jersey’s next governor,” said Jessica Mackler, president of EMILYs List. 
 

“It’s clear that Mikie is the bold leader that we need in Trenton to ensure New Jersey businesses have the tools they need to succeed and that the Garden State is open for business. She’ll make sure that the state government works for us by cutting red tape and bureaucracy to help lower costs and make it easier to grow a business in Hudson County and across the Garden State,” said Stacy Gemma, member of the Hudson County Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors and Sales Associate at Donovan Realty and Development.

data.title: PRIMER DÍA: Estado de emergencia debido a los altos costos de los servicios públicos
data.description:
KENILWORTH — Las facturas de los servicios públicos no dejan de subir y las familias de Nueva Jersey están pagando las consecuencias. No podemos esperar más. Por eso, en su primer día como gobernadora, Mikie Sherril declarará un estado de emergencia por los costes de los servicios públicos: congelará los incrementos de tarifas, impulsará la generación de energía más barata y limpia, y exigirá más transparencia a empresas como PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric y Rockland Electric, así como a nuestro operador de red, PJM.

“Las familias de Nueva Jersey están siendo abrumadas por la presión que las altas facturas de servicios públicos está ocasionando en sus hogares. En la Marina aprendí que, en crisis, hay que liderar. Me postulo para gobernadora para reducir sus costes desde el primer día: declararé un estado de emergencia para congelar tarifas y desarrollar nuestro arsenal energético. No temo enfrentarme a las empresas, al operador de red o a mi propio partido para lograrlo. Mientras tanto, Republicano Jack Ciattarelli se quedará de brazos cruzados y permitirá que Donald Trump suba los costes mientras las familias que viven en Nueva Jersey pagan la factura,” afirmó Mikie Sherrill.

“Realmente, las facturas de servicios públicos están agotando nuestro presupuesto. Creo que cuando nos mudamos, nuestro recibo de electricidad estaba por debajo de los $100 al mes; ahora ha subido casi a los $400. Estoy seguro de que cuando Mikie sea gobernadora, detendrá este aumento desde el primer día.  Mikie asegurará que Nueva Jersey sea un estado asequible,  tanto para mi familia como para las personas que viven aquí,  bajando el costo de vida y los precios de los servicios," dijo Herb Michitsch, residente de Kenilworth.

Medidas bajo un estado de emergencia

  • Congelar las tarifas de servicios públicos mientras ampliamos rápidamente la generación de energía barata y limpia.

  • Aumentar la generación de energía en Nueva Jersey para reducir costes y crear empleos.

  • Eliminar la burocracia y retrasos en permisos para nuevos proyectos de energía limpia.

  • Exigir transparencia y responsabilidad a las empresas de servicios públicos y al operador de red PJM.

Lea el plan completo de Mikie aquí.

“Reducir el coste de vida y rendir cuentas al pueblo de Nueva Jersey será mi prioridad número uno. Tomaré medidas audaces para reducir los costes, sin importar a quién moleste en Trenton o Washington,” concluyó Mikie Sherrill.


###

data.title: MEMO: What to expect from tonight’s gubernatorial debate between Mikie and “100% MAGA” Jack
data.description:
To: Interested Parties
From: Alex Ball, Campaign Manager, Mikie Sherrill for Governor 
SUBJECT: What to expect from tonight’s gubernatorial debate between Mikie and “100% MAGA” Jack

Tonight on the debate stage, New Jersey voters can expect to see a sharp contrast between Mikie Sherrill’s record of delivering for New Jersey families and that of her Republican opponent, “100% MAGA” Jack Ciattarelli, who has proven that at every turn, he will put Trump over New Jersey, no matter the cost. 

As a former Navy helicopter pilot, federal prosecutor, and mother of four, Mikie Sherrill delivers real accountability where others make tired excuses — taking on anyone to cut costs and secure our kids' future. Mikie’s career has been defined by service to her country and New Jersey. 

Tonight, she will lay out her positive vision to bring down costs and make Trenton work for New Jerseyans — including her plan to end utility rate hikes on Day One as governor, take care of our kids, and make government work for families. Mikie’s vision for New Jersey is one that she has brought to communities up and down the Garden State, and tonight, families across New Jersey will have the opportunity to hear exactly how she will make their lives better.

In sharp contrast, Jack will be performing on the debate stage for an audience of one: Donald Trump. Here's what New Jerseyans can expect from “100% MAGA” Jack tonight:

Jack has turned his back on New Jerseyans time and again. Instead, Jack only answers to his loyalty to Donald Trump above New Jersey, focusing on bringing national Republicans’ chaotic and dangerous agenda to Trenton. 

  • Jack “supports the president wholeheartedly,” and even said his “job is to help [Trump].” 

  • Jack has repeatedly refused to name a single issue where he and the president disagree, and even promises that he is “not going to be different” from Trump.

  • Trump has praised Jack as “100% MAGA.”

Tonight, you will hear Jack tout his record of jacking up costs,including his support for Trump’s disastrous and deeply unpopular budget bill that guts Medicaid, rips away food assistance from New Jersey kids, kills jobs, forces hospitals to close, and raises New Jersey families’ utility costs by over $200 per year. 

  • In his own words, Jack has repeatedly discussed how a “10% sales tax on everything, including food and clothing,” is “on the table.” 

  • Jack wholeheartedly backed Trump’s harmful, disruptive tariffs that are hurting New Jersey small businesses, even saying that it’s okay if New Jerseyans feel “pain.”

Finally, you will hear about his extreme and out-of-touch policy proposals borrowed right from the MAGA playbook — like supporting an abortion ban and inflicting devastating cuts on the New Jersey Department of Education and other agencies that provide essential services to hardworking New Jerseyans. 

  • Jack supports an abortion ban, voted six times against restoring funding to Planned Parenthood, and has a “years long” anti-abortion record. 

  • Jack believes Trump’s “greatest legacy” is “his transformation of the federal bench” with the conservatives who overturned Roe v. Wade, something that Jack himself plans to replicate in New Jersey with “ultra conservatives.”

  • Jack was one of the biggest cheerleaders of the One Big Beautiful Bill that raises costs and kicks 300,000 New Jerseyans off their healthcare.

  • Since Jack loves drinking games, we suggest you take a shot every time he denies he’s with Trump. Either you’ll be stone sober because he doesn't dare defy Trump or you’ll have to call a ride to get home because he’s trying to mislead New Jerseyans about where his real loyalty is — Trump.

While Mikie Sherrill continues to show how she’ll stand up to anyone and everyone to lower costs for families, and chart a better path forward for New Jersey, tonight will remind New Jerseyans exactly why they already rejected “100% MAGA” Jack Ciattarelli twice — and why they will do so again this November.

###

data.title: Sherrill Picks Dr. Dale Caldwell for Lt. Gov. Running Mate
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill today announced Dr. Dale Caldwell as her Lieutenant Governor running mate. Dr. Caldwell is the President of Centenary University, a pastor in the United Methodist Church, and a former Deputy Commissioner of the Department of Community Affairs. 

Mikie and Dale, who both come from a lifetime dedicated to service above self and have taken untraditional paths to leadership, will hit the campaign trail for the first time together as a ticket on Saturday. They are united in their commitment to making New Jersey more affordable while protecting our rights and freedoms from Trump’s attacks.

“I’m proud to select Dale Caldwell as my Lieutenant Governor running mate because we share a commitment to public service and challenging the status quo. Dale is the son of civil rights leaders who marched with Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. in Selma — and he’s followed in his parents’ footsteps and he has always been a voice for the voiceless. Not only has Dale given back to the community for nearly 30 years, he brings experience in the private sector, higher education, nonprofits, and the Department of Community Affairs. As Jack Ciattarelli is committed to Trump, Dale and I are committed to New Jersey, and I can’t wait to hit the campaign trail with Dale this Saturday,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

“Mikie Sherrill and I represent a different kind of leadership that sees possibilities, not a blind commitment to doing things the way they’ve always been done. My life, much like Mikie’s, has been dedicated to service: to my church, my students, and my community. That’s why I’m honored and humbled to join Mikie’s ticket. The Sherrill administration will be focused on creating opportunity for the people of New Jersey — lowering costs so families can get ahead and stay ahead. While we will be a voice for the people, Jack Ciattarelli will be a voice for Trump and the MAGA movement that is costing New Jersey our wallets and our freedoms,” said Dale Caldwell. 

Dr. Dale Caldwell is the President of Centenary University. He formerly served as the executive director of the Rothman Institute of Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Fairleigh Dickinson University, President of the Educational Services Commission (ESCNJ), Deputy Commissioner of the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs (DCA), founding executive director of the Newark Alliance, and senior manager at Deloitte Consulting. He volunteered on the New Brunswick school board for 26 years, serving as president for six.

He is a pastor of the Covenant United Methodist Church in Plainfield, NJ, where he builds a congregation based on the values of inclusivity, community, and acceptance. He is guided by Proverbs 31:89, which directs us to "speak up for those who cannot speak for themselves."

Service to others was instilled in Dale from a young age. His mother was a teacher and his father, Rev. Gilbert Caldwell, was a leader in the Civil Rights Movement who knew and marched arm-in-arm with the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. 

Dale is an avid tennis player and coach. He was the President and CEO of the United States Tennis Association (USTA) Eastern Section, founded the Black Tennis Hall of Fame, and is a member of the Eastern Tennis Hall of Fame.

Dale graduated from Princeton University in 1982, earned his Master’s in Business Administration from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania in 1988, and a Doctorate in Education Administration from Seton Hall University in 2017. Dale currently lives in New Brunswick, NJ, and has one daughter, Ashley, who is studying public policy at Rutgers University.

###

data.title: Sherrill Slams Trump’s Tariffs that Will Raise Costs for New Jersey Families
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement today after President Trump imposed a 25 percent tariff on goods from Canada and Mexico, two of New Jersey’s largest trading partners: 

“Today, Donald Trump decided to enact a massive sales tax on New Jersey families and businesses. These tariffs will make everyday goods more expensive and put jobs and economic growth at risk. As governor, one of my top priorities will be to build new housing — but these tariffs will make lumber and housing construction even more expensive, putting the dream of homeownership further out of reach for the middle and working class. As families face an affordability crisis, Trump’s tariffs will raise the cost of gasoline, cars, and groceries even further. Canada — New Jersey’s largest export market — has already announced retaliatory tariffs on $155 billion in U.S. goods, which will devastate New Jersey businesses and jobs. Despite promising to lower costs, the president’s policies so far have driven them up for everyone except for billionaires like Elon Musk. Unlike Washington, I’ll make Trenton work for working people.”

data.title: Mikie Calls on Jack to Release His Tax Returns
data.description:
Mikie Sherrill has gone above and beyond on transparency; "Let’s hope others follow her example"

Jack has refused to release his taxes for nearly a decade. What’s Jack hiding?

BLOOMFIELD — Today, Mikie Sherrill highlighted the need for transparency in Trenton and called on Jack Ciattarelli to “follow her example” and release his federal and state tax returns. 

Earlier today, Mikie unveiled her Transparency and Accountability Agenda, where she will shed light on how state programs are performing and bring accountability to Trenton. Mikie herself has gone above and beyond by releasing “exact values of her finances,” a “greater level of transparency and detail than what [she] is required by law to make public.” During the primary, she also released two years of state and federal tax returns. 

In contrast, Jack has refused to release his tax returns for nearly ten years — making him the only gubernatorial candidate in the general election in over two decades to not do so. What we do know is that Jack made millions in profits peddling misinformation about opioids, leading to an addiction crisis that cost lives and livelihoods. 

“I’ve always held myself to the highest standards of accountability, from my time as a Navy pilot to now as a candidate for governor. I will always go above and beyond to ensure the people of New Jersey know I only answer to them. Transparency and accountability are important — I’m not afraid of it. I think Jack is, since he refuses to release his tax returns or any information about the millions he made profiting off the opioid epidemic,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

See also: New Jersey Globe: Sherrill releases exact values of her finances, showing no unusual stock gains

data.title: BREAKING: Trump Administration Threatens Gateway, Mikie Sherrill Will Go to Bat for New Jersey
data.description:
Choose your fighter: “Tunnel Obsessed Congresswoman” versus “100% MAGA” Jack

BLOOMFIELD — Today, senior Trump administration official Russ Vought announced that federal funding for the Gateway Project is being frozen. Gateway is the nation’s largest and most important infrastructure project, which will replace the 100-year-old railway tunnels between New Jersey and New York to reduce traffic and delays. The project is generating tens of thousands of good-paying union jobs and will bring billions of dollars back to the Northeast region to reduce traffic and pollution, and improve public transportation services.

“I first ran on a promise to build the Gateway Tunnel, and I delivered. We proudly secured a full funding agreement. Shovels are in the ground. The first part of the project is set to be completed in 2026. During construction alone, Gateway will create 95,000 jobs and generate $42.8 billion in economic activity in our region.

“Yet, once again, the Trump administration is targeting New Jersey by gutting this funding. As governor, I will fight tooth and nail to complete this essential infrastructure project for New Jersey. Jack Ciattarelli will not. He’s refused to name a single area where he disagrees with Trump and has already said he would never sue the Trump administration. He will choose Trump over New Jersey every time. Make no mistake: When I’m governor, I will see them in court and deliver Gateway for New Jersey,” said Mikie Sherrill.

If New Jerseyans want to know who will be the governor who fixes New Jersey’s transit systems, take a look at Mikie and Jack’s records. 

Mikie was called the “Tunnel Obsessed Congresswoman” by a member of the press back in 2019 because of her relentless focus on building the Gateway Project. In the years since, she’s secured $12 billion, including a Full Funding Grant Agreement, to build the Gateway Tunnel. She’s also brought back over $4 billion to maintain service routes, upgrade the bus fleet, and fix NJ TRANSIT stations throughout the Garden State.

Meanwhile, Jack got on the debate stage last week and said that his plan for fixing transit is to cut services. He’s already promised he won’t sue Trump on anything. And let’s not forget, he supported Governor Chris Christie’s decision to defund the ARC Tunnel.

The choice is clear: Mikie’s going to fight with everything she’s got to fix our state’s transportation systems and protect Gateway’s funding for New Jersey families, just as she always has. Jack won’t stand up to Trump, and New Jerseyans are going to pay the price.

###

data.title: RWDSU Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor of New Jersey
data.description:
NEWARK, NJ – In case you missed it, this week the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union (RWDSU) announced the union’s endorsement of Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill in her campaign for Governor of New Jersey. RWDSU members across the Garden State working in grocery, retail, warehousing, healthcare, manufacturing, transport, public service sectors and other industries will mobilize in support of Sherrill’s candidacy, sharing her strong record of leadership and commitment to working people and communities. 

“Mikie Sherrill is the kind of principled leader working people need in New Jersey. From fighting for union rights in Congress to supporting critical investments in public services, she’s demonstrated that she understands both the dignity of work and the needs of working families. She’s shown up for our members—not just with words, but with action—and we know she’ll continue to stand up for workers as Governor. RWDSU is proud to endorse Mikie Sherrill because we know she’ll lead with integrity, courage, and a deep commitment to economic and worker justice,” said Stuart Appelbaum, President of the Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union (RWDSU). 

“Our members – grocery store workers, nursing home workers, bus and shuttle drivers, public service staff, and more – kept New Jersey running during the toughest days of the pandemic, and they deserve a Governor who won’t forget that. Mikie Sherrill gets it. She’s stood with us in Washington, and we know she’ll continue to stand with us in Trenton. We need a Governor who listens to workers, respects unions, and delivers real results. That’s Mikie Sherrill,” said Charles N. Hall Jr., President, RWDSU Local 108. 

“Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill has always been accessible to labor and attentive to the issues facing working people in our state. Whether it's supporting legislation to strengthen workplace safety or advocating for fair wages, Mikie understands the daily struggles of our members and the broader labor movement. As Governor, we know she’ll fight for union jobs, safe workplaces, and strong communities. RWDSU Local 262 is proud to support her,” said Daniel Righetti, President of RWDSU Local 262.

“I’m honored to receive the endorsement of the RWDSU and its dedicated members across New Jersey. From the frontlines of our grocery stores to our distribution centers and beyond, RWDSU members are the backbone of our economy. The RWDSU is a strong and respected union, which fights hard for its members, and has a strong record of improving the lives of working people in New Jersey and across the country. I’m proud to stand with them – and to push toward a New Jersey where every worker is respected, protected, and empowered. Together, we’ll build a future rooted in fairness, opportunity, and economic dignity,” said Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill, candidate for Governor of New Jersey.

The Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union (RWDSU) represents 100,000 members throughout the United States, including 15,000 in New Jersey. The RWDSU is affiliated with the United Food and Commercial Workers Union (UFCW). For more information, please visit our website at www.rwdsu.org, Facebook:/RWDSU.UFCW Twitter:@RWDSU, Instagram: @rwdsustrong.

data.title: New Jersey State Council of Machinists Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, the New Jersey State Council of Machinists, AFL-CIO, announced their endorsement of Mikie Sherrill for Governor because of her strong record of standing up for organized labor, her commitment to building opportunities for working families, and her plan to make bold investments in our state’s infrastructure that will bring good-paying jobs to the Garden State.

“The New Jersey State Council of Machinists is a diverse labor union representing over 20,000 New Jerseyans, but we have one mission: to support skilled laborers and make sure working families are being paid and treated fairly. We need a governor who will champion that mission, which is why we are so excited to support Mikie Sherrill. Mikie’s a champion for labor, she’s a union granddaughter with an ironclad record of standing up for collective bargaining rights and fair labor standards, investing in apprenticeship programs, and fighting for working families. She has a bold vision to modernize New Jersey’s aging infrastructure and invest in the people who make our economy run while standing up against attacks on labor from Washington. We are ready to work to make Mikie Sherrill our next governor,” said New Jersey State Council of Machinists President Cristino Vilorio.

“Organized labor built New Jersey and is the key to powering our state’s economy into the future. I’m honored to receive the New Jersey State Council of Machinists’ endorsement, because this election could not be more important. Together, we’ll stand up against attacks against collective bargaining and organized labor while building pathways for working families to thrive here in New Jersey,” said Mikie Sherrill.

The New Jersey State Council of Machinists represents over 20,000 New Jerseyans and is part of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, AFL-CIO. Mikie has also been endorsed by the New Jersey State AFL-CIO.

data.title: Mayor Ras Baraka Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
NEWARK — Mayor Ras Baraka announced his formal endorsement of Mikie Sherrill to be the next Governor of New Jersey. Mayor Baraka and Mikie know there is a lot that unites New Jerseyans, and chief among them are their shared goals of lowering costs for families, helping our kids succeed, and bringing accountability and transparency to Trenton.

Together at a meet and greet in Newark, Mikie and Mayor Baraka rallied around a bold vision for the future, focused on building generational wealth for Black communities and closing the wealth gap through expanded first-time homebuyer assistance, improving Black maternal health outcomes, and ensuring that children in every ZIP code have access to a high-quality public school education. 

“I am excited to work side by side with Mayor Baraka because we love this state, and we know that for too many New Jerseyans, it’s just too expensive and too hard to get ahead. Together, we’re going to work to address some of our state’s most pressing issues, by expanding access to generational wealth, improving Black maternal health outcomes, and lowering costs for working families. And we know what we’re up against in Jack Ciattarelli, who is going to do whatever Trump tells him while New Jerseyans pay the price,” said Mikie Sherrill.

“I was recently a candidate in the race to be New Jersey’s next governor because I understand how critical the moment we are in now is.This country faces a serious threat which includes our state. We need a governor who will stand up for working people and the issues that affect our community. After a series of conversations about Black maternal mortality, the growing wealth gap, deep inequities around business and home ownership, and clearing a pathway to the middle class for the marginalized, I know that Congresswoman Sherrill is the best choice for us all. She will lead with compassion and strength to not just protect our state from Trump's overreach but against long standing economic barriers that keep our state divided and unequal,” said Mayor Ras Baraka.

data.title: EXPOSED: Jack “Is Desperate for Voters to Ignore His Anti-Abortion Record”
data.description:
Jezebel: “Ciattarelli’s anti-abortion record is years long.”

BLOOMFIELD —  Jack is "desperate" for New Jerseyans to “ignore [his] entire history of being an anti-abortion politician.” Jack can try to run, but he can’t hide.

Jack’s “years long” anti-abortion record speaks for itself — “while serving as a state assemblyman from 2011 to 2018, he voted against funding Planned Parenthood six times” and “wouldn’t support New Jersey’s Reproductive Freedom Act.”

While Jack tries to hide from his anti-abortion record, “his friendships and financial records have addressed it for him.” Jezebel reports how Jack has cozied up to other extreme anti-abortion Republicans, including donating $5,000 to Lou Barletta’s gubernatorial campaign the day the Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health opinion leaked “that would eventually overturn Roe.” Jack campaigned with Georgia Governor Brian Kemp, “the architect of one of the strictest abortion bans in the country,” in August. 

“I've said it before and I'll say it again: Jack will work to bring his Trumpian, anti-abortion agenda to our state. It's shameful and it’s not right for New Jersey,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Take a look for yourself:

Jezebel: New Jersey’s GOP Candidate for Governor Is Desperate for Voters to Ignore His Anti-Abortion Record

  • But the worst kind of anti-abortion politician is the one who tries to convince voters that they’re not really an anti-abortion politician, they’re just a guy, standing in front of their state (for a second time), begging them to ignore their entire history of being an anti-abortion politician.

  • The midterms are 14 months away, but New Jersey’s future will be decided in November. 

  • Seemingly taking a page out of Donald Trump and JD Vance’s election playbook, Ciattarelli is trying to fashion himself as a moderate on abortion—meaning he largely avoids the topic, but when he can’t, he uses phrases like “abortion limit,” which is the GOP’s preference when they’re trying to avoid saying “ban.”

  • Ciattarelli hasn’t really addressed this and seems focused on keeping up his facade; his campaign website reads, “Jack respects that this issue evokes strong feelings from well-intentioned people on both sides of the issue.” Luckily, his friendships and financial records have addressed it for him.

  • …On May 2, 2022, Ciattarelli donated $5,000 to Lou Barletta’s campaign for Pennsylvania’s Republican gubernatorial nomination, according to never-before-reported financial filings from the Pennsylvania Department of State. That was the day the Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health opinion leaked—a version of the opinion that would eventually overturn Roe. 

  • That night, Barletta tweeted: “If this is true, it would be an enormous, life-saving victory for unborn children,” along with the link to Politico’s coverage.

  • Which is to say: Barletta is a loud-and-proud anti-abortion politician. Before running for Pennsylvania governor, Barletta served in the House of Representatives between 2011 and 2019. 

  • During that time, he voted against adding an exception for the health of the mother to a federal 20-week abortion ban in 2017, according to Reproductive Freedom for All. (The bill has never made it out of the House, but Republicans continue to try and pass different versions of it.) 

  • Barletta was also one of the 150 co-sponsors of the Life At Conception Act that same year, which would have established fetal personhood and banned abortion from the moment of conception. 

  • In addition to his post the day the Dobbs memo leaked, Barletta regularly tweeted about his anti-abortion views, including this tweet from February 2022: “It is a scientific fact that life begins at conception.” It is not!

  • All that is to say, Barletta’s anti-abortion views would be obvious to anyone who supported him enough to donate $5,000 to his gubernatorial campaign (which eventually failed). If that’s a view Ciattarelli supported for the people of Pennsylvania, does he support it for the very pro-choice New Jerseyans he hopes will vote him into office in a few months?

  • Ciattarelli’s campaign did not respond to Jezebel’s request for comment on his 2022 donation to Barletta.

  • But Ciattarelli’s friendships don’t stop at failed gubernatorial candidates, and they’re also not confined to the tri-state area. As recently as August, Ciattarelli hung out with Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp—the architect of one of the strictest abortion bans in the country—who traveled to Jersey to campaign for Ciattarelli. 

  • Kemp’s six-week ban, which has zero exceptions, was confirmed by ProPublica to have killed at least two women. And when a hospital in Georgia placed a brain-dead woman on life support in May because she was nine weeks pregnant, Kemp stayed silent.

  • I understand that MAGA birds of a feather must be Trump lackeys together, but if I were trying to come off as someone who didn’t support women dying from abortion bans, I would, at the very least, not take photos with Kemp.

  • Ciattarelli’s anti-abortion record is years long. While serving as a state assemblyman from 2011 to 2018, he voted against funding Planned Parenthood six times. 

  • In 2021, after Texas passed its Heartbeat Act, Ciattarelli said it was extreme but also that he wouldn’t support New Jersey’s Reproductive Freedom Act, which passed in 2022 and codified the right to abortion in the state constitution. 

  • Trump gave him an all-caps endorsement in May, writing on Truth Social: “Jack, who after getting to know and understand MAGA, has gone ALL IN, and is now 100% (PLUS!).” In July, he rubbed elbows with a local anti-abortion leader.

  • This gubernatorial election is already the most expensive race in New Jersey history, and may serve as a crystal ball for what’s to come in 2026.

###

data.title: ESCONDAN SUS BILLETERAS, NJ: Jack planea un "impuesto del 10% a todo" en Nueva Jersey
data.description:
Todo lo que pones en tu mesa costará más si Jack Ciattarelli se sale con la suya

BLOOMFIELD — Jack Ciattarelli acaba de dejar en claro su plan: imponer un impuesto del "10% a todo, incluso a los alimentos y la ropa." En un momento en que tantas familias en Nueva Jersey ya están ahogándose con la inflación, Jack quiere hacer aún más difícil llegar a fin de mes. 

Pero ahí no termina la amenaza. Jack respalda totalmente la agenda de Trump que quitará cobertura médica a 300,000 residentes de Nueva Jersey, y aumentará los costos con aranceles que golpean directamente a nuestras familias y pequeñas empresas.

Con Jack todo se vuelve más caro: la comida en su mesa, el techo donde vives, la luz que alumbra su casa, la ropa de sus hijos, y tu atención médica. El abre la puerta para que la vida sea insostenible.  

"Yo voy a cerrar esa puerta de golpe: mientras yo sea gobernadora, nunca habrá un impuesto sobre la comida ni la ropa. Estoy lista para enfrentar a quien sea con tal de hacer la vida más asequible para las familias de Nueva Jersey. Jack es un político de impuestos y gastos y además es un títere de Trump. Nueva Jersey merece algo mucho mejor," declaró Mikie Sherrill.

Antecedentes for el New Jersey Independent:

En una grabación, capta a Jack Ciattarelli diciendo que está completamente abierto a un impuesto del 10 % a las ventas en Nueva Jersey.

  • El candidato republicano a la gobernación, Jack Ciattarelli, enfrenta críticas después de decir que está abierto a un impuesto del 10% a las ventas en Nueva Jersey, incluidos alimentos y ropa, según un audio captado durante un mitin de campaña en el condado de Bergen.

  • Acabo de regresar de Tennessee hace poco", dijo Ciattarelli durante el mitin del 4 de junio... "Estuvimos allí en un viaje de recaudación de fondos, y Tennessee no tiene impuesto sobre la renta. Lo que Tennessee tiene es un impuesto del 10% a todo, incluidos alimentos y ropa.

  • La filosofía siempre ha sido en este estado que tenemos un impuesto a las ventas del 7% para redondear las cifras, pero no hay impuesto sobre las necesidades básicas, como alimentos y ropa", continuó. "Trabajaré con la Sociedad de Contadores Públicos de Nueva Jersey. Vamos a analizar lo que hacen otros estados. Y todas las opciones están sobre la mesa".

  • La campaña de Ciattarelli no respondió de inmediato a una solicitud de comentarios.Nueva Jersey actualmente aplica un impuesto a las ventas del 6.625% sobre "la mayoría de los bienes tangibles, productos digitales especificados y ciertos servicios, a menos que estén específicamente exentos bajo la ley de Nueva Jersey", según señala el sitio web de la División de Impuestos del estado. La mayoría de los alimentos y la ropa están exentos del impuesto a las ventas.

  • Una parte de los comentarios de Ciattarelli sobre el impuesto del 10% a las ventas se presenta en un nuevo anuncio lanzado el 3 de septiembre.

  • Ciattarelli apoyó los recortes de Trump a Medicaid, afectando a 300,000 en Jersey", dice el narrador del anuncio de Greater Garden State. "Y ahora, está hablando de un impuesto del 10% a las ventas".

  • Ciattarelli apoyó la Ley One Big Beautiful Bill... que fue firmada por el presidente Donald Trump el 4 de julio. La ley reduce fondos para Medicaid, el programa nacional de seguro médico para personas de bajos ingresos, lo que, según funcionarios estatales, podría resultar en que 300,000 residentes de Nueva Jersey pierdan su cobertura médica.

  • Los comentarios de Ciattarelli sobre el impuesto a las ventas llegan en un momento en que los residentes de Nueva Jersey reportan dificultades debido al aumento de costos.

  • Aproximadamente el 39% de los hogares de Nueva Jersey tenía dificultades para llegar a fin de mes en 2023, según los datos más recientes del grupo United Way of Northern New Jersey. Un representante del grupo dijo al New Jersey Independent en agosto que espera que el porcentaje de hogares que luchan por cubrir sus gastos diarios aumente.

  • Los residentes de Nueva Jersey también enfrentan costos crecientes debido a los aranceles de Trump a productos importados. Educadores informaron recientemente al New Jersey Independent que los costos de suministros escolares están aumentando; se espera que los precios de los alimentos suban debido a los aranceles; y los costos de electricidad han aumentado en parte debido a recortes federales a programas de energía verde.

data.title: What They’re Saying: Mikie’s TV Ads “Tout” What She “Learned in the Navy: No Excuses and Finding a Way to Solve a Problem”
data.description:
NBC News: Mikie “highlighted her background as a Navy helicopter pilot and pledged to ‘stand up to anyone and everyone for New Jersey families.’”

BLOOMFIELD —  Mikie Sherrill has launched her first TV ads, “lean[ing] on her background as a former Navy helicopter pilot… saying she learned from that experience to ‘either find a way or make one.’”

As out-of-control utility costs are crushing New Jersey families, Mikie “touted her plan to address rising utility costs in the state” and “pledged to freeze utility rates” “on her first day in office.”

Take a look at what New Jerseyans are reading about Mikie’s new ads: 

New Jersey Globe: Sherrill launches first TV ads in bid for governor

  • Mikie Sherrill will go up on the air with her first TV ads as the Democratic nominee for governor today and won’t go dark until Election Day.

  • In “Bold Leadership,” Sherrill is flying a helicopter, discussing the leadership lessons she learned while serving in the U.S. Navy, and promising to use the power of the governorship to lower utility bills on her first day in office.

  • A shorter ad, “Make One,” touts another lesson learned in the Navy: no excuses and finding a way to solve a problem.

  • The ads are described as components of a multi-million dollar statewide network, cable and digital campaign.

  • Script: “(Mikie Sherrill) The Navy taught me in a crisis; you either find a way — or make one.  (Narrator) For governor, Navy helicopter pilot Mikie Sherrill. As a 20% utility rate hike crushes New Jersey families. (Sherrill) Day one as governor, I’m declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs. Using emergency powers to end these rate hikes and drive down your bills.  (Narrator) Mikie Sherrill knows a cost crisis demands bold leadership. (Sherrill) I’ll stand up to anyone, and everyone, for New Jersey families.”

  • “When it comes to delivering for New Jersey families, Mikie won’t take ‘no’ for an answer,” said Alex Ball, Sherrill’s campaign manager.  “She is the only candidate in this race with a real plan to drive down costs for New Jersey families, starting with declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs on Day One to end the utility rate hikes.”

  • Sherrill’s second ad is fifteen seconds.

  • Script: (Mikie Sherrill) “Up here, there are no excuses. The Navy doesn’t accept that things are ‘impossible.’ You either find a way or make one. This is the kind of leadership New Jersey can expect from me as governor. (Narrator) For governor, Mikie Sherrill. 


The Hill: …Sherrill release[s] first general election TV ads of New Jersey governor’s race

  • Sherrill and other Democrats have often sought to tie Ciattarelli, a onetime Trump critic who has improved his relationship with the president more recently, to Trump. The president has endorsed Ciattarelli, a former state General Assembly member, in the race.

  • Sherrill’s ad leans on her background as a former Navy helicopter pilot, which she has often emphasized on the campaign trail, saying she learned from that experience to “either find a way or make one.” She said she would on her first day in office declare a state of emergency on the cost of utilities, using her office’s powers to stop rate hikes. 

  • “I’ll stand up to anyone, and everyone, for New Jersey families,” Sherrill said.


NBC News: …How New Jersey's contenders for governor are setting up the election

  • Sherrill, meanwhile, highlighted her background as a Navy helicopter pilot and pledged to “stand up to anyone and everyone for New Jersey families.” 

  • She also touted her plan to address rising utility costs in the state… she pledged to freeze utility rates for one year.

  • “The Navy taught me in a crisis, you either find a way or make one,” Sherrill says in the ad as she flies a helicopter, later adding, “Day one as governor, I’m declaring a state of emergency on utility costs using emergency powers to end these rate hikes and drive down your bills.”

data.title: ICYMI: Republicans Are Scared to Run Against Mikie Sherrill
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In case you missed it, New Jersey Republicans are sweating the prospect of running against Mikie Sherrill in the general election, because they know she’s the best candidate to win in November. 

Last year, a prominent New Jersey Republican strategist said: “…I can tell you Republicans will be nervous if Sherrill runs. Sherrill has a compelling life story and has unapologetically remained true to progressive values in Congress [...] Republicans certainly see her as formidable[.]”

Now, Mikie’s record of delivering for the people of New Jersey and her grassroots strength are at top of mind for Republicans heading into November.

Meanwhile, the mayors in this race have never run in a competitive general election against a Republican — much less beaten one. 

Insider NJ: Sherrill Candidacy Gives Palpitations to the GOP

PARSIPPANY — Many Republicans probably think Mikie Sherrill is going to be the Democratic nominee for governor.

That sentiment is pretty evident in Morris County where a small, but influential, group of elected GOP officials and leaders met Monday for lunch at the Capital Grille.

"Mikie Sherrill is very popular in Morris County," acknowledged Thomas "Ace" Gallagher, the mayor of Hanover Township. Morris, of course, represents a large part of Sherrill's 11th congressional district.

Sherrill's perceived popularity is a potential problem for Morris Republicans, some of whom fear her candidacy this fall may mean more votes for Democrats down ballot.

Today's gathering was designed to highlight that threat and to raise money to combat it.

###

data.title: ICYMI: Mikie Sherrill Continues Small Business Tour, Promotes Her Save You Time and Money Agenda Across New Jersey
data.description:
Mikie met with business owners at A Taco Affair, Bluebird Diner, and The Green Olive

BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill continues to meet with business owners across the state about her Save You Time and Money Agenda — her plan to make government work better, with fewer delays and costs, for residents and businesses. Speaking with business owners in Passaic, Salem, and Cumberland counties, Mikie shared how her plan would help small businesses grow and drive a culture of accountability and transparency in Trenton. 

“At a time when Trump’s Jack-endorsed tariffs are costing us jobs and hurting New Jersey’s economy, New Jersey needs a governor who will fight for small businesses and protect them from Trump’s economic chaos. From Day One, I will be laser focused on driving down costs, slashing red tape and wait times, and will put transparency and accountability front and center at all our state agencies. It’s time for Trenton to start working for small businesses, entrepreneurs, and workers — and I will take on anyone, whether my own party or Trump, to make that happen,” said Mikie Sherrill.

data.title: Payne Family Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — The Payne family today announced that they are endorsing Mikie Sherrill for governor: 

“We speak with great personal respect for the talented field of candidates running for the democratic nomination for Governor. All of them are friends of the family and honorable public servants with much to offer the state. Because we have very serious concerns about the policies coming out of the White House, we place an even greater importance on winning the Statehouse in November. We do not want to see the policies of the Trump administration brought home to New Jersey. We believe that Rep. Mikie Sherrill has a positive vision for New Jersey’s future and is the candidate most capable of winning the trust of a majority of the voters. We are proud to come together as a family to announce our support for Rep. Mikie Sherrill to be the next Governor of the state of New Jersey. She was a loyal and committed friend to Donald Jr. — they worked hard together to deliver funding for the Gateway Tunnel, the most consequential infrastructure project in the country, which will create thousands of jobs in New Jersey.  Mikie has persuaded us that she is committed to carrying the torch forward on the issues Donald Sr and Donald Jr fought for in the 10th Congressional District in the Halls of Congress,” said Bill Payne. 

“Donald Payne, Jr. was a dear friend, mentor, and an expert on transportation policy. We had so many important discussions about how to better deliver for New Jersey, but when he really lit up was when he talked about his family. I’m humbled and grateful to have their support in this campaign. The Paynes have dedicated their lives to public service, improving the City of Newark and the State of New Jersey — and I look forward to carrying those efforts as governor to tackle the structural barriers that hold kids and families back,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

Payne — a former member of the New Jersey Assembly, uncle of Rep. Donald Payne, Jr., and patriarch of the family — released the statement on behalf of the family. Rep. Donald Payne, Jr. represented New Jersey’s 10th District in Congress from 2012 until he passed in 2024. Mikie and Payne, Jr. shared representation of Bloomfield, West Orange, and Montclair. 

###

data.title: ICYMI: “Sherrill counters Ciattarelli’s claims with his own record”
data.description:
NJ Globe: Jack has a “long trail [of statements] … considering a 10% sales tax modeled after Tennessee.”

BLOOMFIELD — Pulling straight from the Trump playbook, Jack Ciattarelli immediately hid behind his lawyer when confronted with his record. New reporting from the New Jersey Globe shows that while Jack and his lawyers are trying to claim he has never proposed a 10% sales tax, his own record paints a very different picture. As the Globe reported, Jack has a “long trail [of statements] … considering a 10% sales tax modeled after Tennessee.” Plain and simple, Jack got caught. Now, he wants voters to ignore his words and his record as a career politician who has voted to raise taxes on hardworking families in every elected office he’s held. New Jerseyans deserve better than a lying Trenton insider who refuses to own up to his record. 

Take a look for yourself:

New Jersey Globe: Sales tax fight escalates: Sherrill counters Ciattarelli’s claims with his own record 

  • In a blistering response, Democrat Mikie Sherrill’s campaign is rejecting Jack Ciattarelli’s accusation that she is misleading voters over his tax positions, pointing to a long trail of Ciattarelli’s own statements about considering a 10% sales tax modeled after Tennessee.

  • “Apparently, Mr. Ciattarelli is unable to defend himself effectively in a public policy debate over taxes, so he has resorted to a legal letter that has no merit,” said Raj Parikh, Sherrill’s campaign lawyer.  “Despite the best efforts of Assemblyman Ciattarelli’s puppeteer in the White House, New Jerseyans still enjoy the protections of the First Amendment.”

  • … according to the Sherrill campaign, Ciattarelli floated the idea several times and said “all options should be on the table.”

  • Parikh, in a four-page letter to Ciattarelli campaign counsel Mark Sheridan, said the Republican nominee had frequently praised Tennessee’s tax system.

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Statement Following Mayor Baraka’s Release
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill issued the following statement after Mayor Ras Baraka was released from custody: 

“I am on the road back from my daughter's graduation and have been monitoring the situation in Newark closely. I'm relieved to see that Mayor Baraka has been released and is safe. Let’s be very clear – what happened today is outrageous and frightening. I’ve long been opposed to Delaney Hall, a private for-profit prison with a history of abuse and mistreatment. Today’s events underscore that this facility, and those like it, will do nothing to make our community safer – they exist to turn profits for Donald Trump’s donors. Our first loyalty should always be to the Constitution and due process. This is a truly alarming moment and we need to stand together. When law enforcement is politicized, it’s not just dangerous — it’s the death rattle of democracy. If we don’t stop it now, we may not get another chance.”

data.title: Mikie Sherrill lanza campaña publicitaria en español destacando su compromiso inquebrantable con NJ
data.description:
Vea “Enfrentará” en inglés y español

BLOOMFIELD — La campaña de Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora anunció hoy el lanzamiento de su primera publicidad en español, resaltando cómo Mikie, piloto de la Marina, fiscal federal y madre de cuatro hijos, siempre luchará por Nueva Jersey porque no le teme a nadie.

“Mikie se enfrentará a cualquiera: desde los intereses especiales hasta su propio partido e incluso a Donald Trump, para cumplir con las familias de Nueva Jersey. Es la única candidata en esta contienda con un plan real para luchar por Nueva Jersey y reducir los costos para las familias del Estado Jardín,” afirmó Alex Ball, jefa de campaña de Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora. 

La campaña de Mikie Sherrill ha lanzado un plan publicitario digital y de radio de seis cifras como parte de una estrategia mediática de siete cifras que busca conectar directamente con los votantes latinos en todo el estado. Los anuncios llegarán a hogares latinos donde se habla o español o inglés o que son bilingües, a través de televisión, radio, plataformas digitales, aplicaciones de streaming, y correo. 

Los anuncios de “Enfrentará” cuentan con la participación del veterano del ejército estadounidense Ángel Quiles y refuerzan el mensaje de que Mikie Sherrill está lista para luchar por las familias trabajadoras del Estado Jardín. 


VEA “ENFRENTARÁ” EN INGLÉS: 

Ángel Quiles, militar retirado del Ejército de los Estados Unidos: Necesitamos una gobernadora que realmente luche por Nueva Jersey. Mikie Sherrill fue piloto de la Marina, fiscal federal y es madre de cuatro hijos. 

Mikie no le teme a nadie, ni siquiera a Donald Trump. 

Creará un informe público para que todos sepamos cómo el estado utiliza el dinero de nuestros impuestos. 

Incrementará los consejeros de salud mental en nuestras escuelas y enfrentará las empresas de servicios públicos que nos están estafando.

Porque ya basta.

Mikie Sherrill: Soy Mikie Sherrill, y siempre lucharé por Nueva Jersey.

VEA “ENFRENTARÁ” EN ESPAÑOL: 

Angel Quiles, militar retirado del Ejército de los Estados Unidos: 
Necesitamos una gobernadora que realmente luche por Nueva Jersey. 

Mikie Sherrill fue piloto de la Marina, fiscal federal, y es madre de cuatro. 

No le teme a nadie.

Creará un informe público para que todos sepamos cómo el estado utiliza el dinero de nuestros impuestos. 

Incrementará los consejeros de salud mental en nuestras escuelas y enfrentará las empresas de servicios públicos que nos están estafando. 

Porque ya basta. 

Mikie: Soy Mikie Sherrill, y siempre lucharé por Nueva Jersey.



VEA “ENFRENTARÁ” (:15) EN INGLÉS: 

Ángel Quiles, militar retirado del Ejército de los Estados Unidos: Mikie Sherrill fue piloto de la Marina, fiscal federal y es madre de cuatro hijos.

Mikie se enfrentará a las empresas de servicios públicos que nos están estafando porque Mikie Sherrill no le teme a nadie, ni siquiera a Donald Trump.

BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill’s campaign for governor launched its first Spanish-language ad highlighting how Mikie, a Navy pilot, federal prosecutor, and mother of four, will always fight for New Jersey because she's not afraid of anybody.

“Mikie will take on anybody — from special interests to her own party and Donald Trump — to deliver for New Jersey families. She is the only candidate in this race with a real plan to fight for our state and lower costs for New Jersey families,” said Mikie Sherrill for Governor Campaign Manager Alex Ball. 

Mikie Sherrill’s campaign has launched a six-figure digital and radio campaign as part of a robust seven figure paid media strategy communicating directly with Latino voters across the state. The campaign will target English, Spanish and bilingual Latino households across TV, streaming, digital, radio platforms and mail. The “Enfrentará” ads feature U.S. Army veteran Angel Quiles.

She's not afraid of anybody, not even Donald Trump.

She'll increase mental health counselors in our schools, and she'll take on the utility companies that are ripping us off.

data.title: Sherrill Opposes Republican Price Hike Bill — Unlike Jack Ciattarelli
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after voting against the Republican Price Hike Bill, supported by Jack Ciattarelli.

“Today, House Republicans passed a piece of legislation that will leave families without health care, cause children to go hungry, drive up utility and mortgage prices for middle-class families, and pay more in taxes. Jack Ciattarelli proudly supports all of it.

“This cruel bill will be simply devastating for New Jerseyans. Yet Jack has said this bill won’t be a real problem in New Jersey. But let me tell you, raising health insurance premiums on 450,000 New Jerseyans, increasing taxes on New Jerseyans by $30 billion, and raising families’ monthly utility bills is certainly a big problem. 

“Despite the chaos and pain this bill will cause, Jack’s all in because he only cares about an audience of one: Trump. On the other hand, my North Star has always been about service to this country and doing right by the people of New Jersey. I’ll continue to fight for New Jersey while Jack will keep fighting for Trump.”
