data.title: WHAT THEY ARE SAYING: Mikie’s Affordability Agenda takes a “smart, innovative, and pragmatic approach” to tackling our most pressing issues
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill introduced her Affordability Agenda last week — her plan as governor to lower costs and go after the bad actors who sell New Jerseyans. Mikie stood alongside working New Jerseyans to introduce her plan and outline how it will make life less expensive for working people. 

Read what New Jersey leaders are saying about Mikie’s Affordability Agenda:

“I’ve seen Mikie Sherrill in action in Congress, where we passed the largest climate bill in American history. As Trump rolls back our progress on the federal level, we need to elect Mikie to chart a different path forward in New Jersey. She’ll lower energy costs for New Jersey — harnessing clean, cheap energy like solar to bring down costs for consumers. She’ll pressure our regional grid operator PJM to get our clean energy online. I know Mikie has the backbone to get the job done and that’s why I’m going to work to elect her as our next governor,” said Congressman Frank Pallone.

“New Jersey has a housing affordability crisis, and Mikie’s plan is exactly what New Jersey needs to bring the dream of homeownership back within reach. As governor, Mikie will work with municipalities like Paterson to address our supply shortage and build a range of housing options for the “missing middle” — starter homes, workforce housing, and homes for seniors looking to downsize but stay in New Jersey. We need a governor who gets it and has a track record of getting things done — and that’s Mikie Sherrill,” said Paterson Mayor Andre Sayegh.

“Here in New Jersey, it’s too hard for families to access health care. Mikie’s plan will help improve transparency in health care pricing, so residents know how much they are going to pay before going to the doctor. As governor, Mikie will increase access to primary care by expanding mobile clinics and partnerships between health systems and schools, lowering long-term health costs for families across the state. And, most importantly, Mikie’s the leader who will get this done. Her Affordability Agenda takes a smart, innovative, and pragmatic approach to tackling the most pressing issues for families throughout our state,” said Senator John McKeon.

“Mikie Sherrill is the ideal choice for governor. Mikie’s Affordability Agenda puts forward real solutions to some of New Jersey’s most pressing issues, especially our housing needs. I agree with the principles of Mikie’s housing plan as it will ensure affordable and accessible housing so all residents and their families can live in the communities they love. It also creates more opportunity for others by using innovative solutions to keep costs down and gives them a real chance for economic growth,” said Morris Township Mayor Donna Guariglia.  

“Mikie Sherrill understands that clean, renewable energy like solar is the cheapest and most reliable option for New Jersey's working families and small businesses. Clean energy projects aren’t just smart environmental policy — they will keep down our rising energy costs. By prioritizing in-state clean energy investments, Mikie will not only expand our power capacity and keep rates down, but she will help create good local jobs and establish energy independence, all while cleaning up our air and combating the worst effects of climate change. Under her leadership, New Jersey will invest in lowering costs by making homes and businesses more energy efficient and will be at the forefront of national clean energy innovation while creating a healthier environment for all,” said Ed Potosnak, Executive Director, New Jersey League of Conservation Voters.

“Mikie knows that the workers building homes in the Garden State should be able to afford to live in them, and that’s why bringing down the cost of housing for families is going to be one of her top priorities as governor. She is absolutely right that we have to cut through red tape and streamline the state’s permitting process if we’re going to lower costs. Building more homes will grow our economy — and Mikie’s plan shows that she will be a governor focused on making New Jersey a place where every worker has a fair shot to get ahead,” said Mike Hellstrom, LIUNA Eastern Regional Manager.

“The impact of high food prices is a major concern for so many Mercer families, and Mikie understands we can and must do more — She came to Mercer County last year and shared her plan. As governor, Mikie will give tax credits to small grocery stores to bring more competition and lower costs. She will go after price gougers and monopolies that jack up food prices — and she will strengthen our local family farms that are so vital to our economy in Central and South Jersey," said Mercer County Executive Dan Benson.

###

data.title: WHAT THEY ARE SAYING: Dale Caldwell Receives Broad Support from Across the Garden State
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — New Jersey is excited about Mikie’s Lieutenant Governor, Dr. Dale Caldwell. Leaders across the state shared their support, highlighting Dale’s experience in the public and private sectors, and background as a pastor, small business advocate, and champion for students that will make him an effective leader in delivering for New Jerseyans.

Here’s what they are saying:

“Mikie and Dale both come from a lifetime dedicated to service above self and have taken untraditional paths to leadership. As an educator and pastor with deep experience in the private, public, and nonprofit sectors, Dale will make a strong partner to Mikie in Trenton,” said Governor Phil Murphy.

“Mikie Sherrill has made a great choice in selecting Dale Caldwell to be her running mate for Lieutenant Governor. Dale has a diverse and distinguished record of accomplishment in academics, government, the private sector, the ministry and with non-profits, and possesses a dedicated commitment to public service. This is a critical election for New Jersey’s future as our rights and freedoms are under assault, but we can be confident that Dale Caldwell will work in partnership with Mikie Sherrill to fight for the needs and priorities of our residents. They will work with the Legislature to make the lives of New Jerseyans more affordable by lowering the costs of health care, utilities and housing and expand opportunities for residents in every community across the state. I am excited by the Sherrill-Caldwell ticket and look forward to supporting them in every way,” said Senate President and Union County Chairman Nick Scutari.

“Mikie and Dale both come from a lifetime dedicated to service about self and have taken untraditional paths to leadership. They are united in their commitment to making New Jersey more affordable while protecting our rights and freedoms from Trump’s attacks,” said Speaker Craig J. Coughlin. 

“Dr. Dale Caldwell is a respected pastor, college president, entrepreneur, nonprofit executive and community leader. He has dedicated his career to public service. He is an outstanding pick for Lt. Governor and will represent the Democratic ticket with honor and strength this November. Before there was Dr. Dale Caldwell, there was his father, the late great Dr. Gil Caldwell, a respected civil rights leader who was one of my earlier supporters when I first ran for office. He is looking down proudly on his son’s incredible selection. Let’s go Sherrill/Caldwell 2025!” said Senate Majority Whip Vin Gopal.

“Dr. Caldwell is a well-rounded leader for our entire community. From social justice and education to health care and more, he understands what our people need — from a holistic approach. He’s a man with a vision for everyone, not just some, but all. Congratulations to our Lieutenant Governor-Elect, and to our Governor-Elect, Mikie Sherrill. We look forward to working with him in service to the people of New Jersey,” said Rev John Taylor, Friendship Baptist Church; President, Capital City Community Coalition (CCCC).

“At a time when New Jersey and our nation needs steady, principled leadership, Dale G. Caldwell has stepped forward with courage, conviction, and compassion. His selection as Lieutenant Governor by Democratic gubernatorial nominee Mikie Sherrill is not just timely, it is critically important. Mr. Caldwell is a rare leader; intelligent, visionary, and grounded in service. He brings a forward-thinking approach to every space he enters, shaped by decades of experience in education, government, faith, and community. As president of Centenary University, a third-generation Methodist pastor, and a longtime school board president, he has built bridges and advanced equity at every turn. The son and grandson of civil rights leaders, Mr. Caldwell understands the urgency of justice, not just as a goal, but as a mandate. His work reflects a deep commitment to those often left behind: from students and families to underserved communities across New Jersey. What makes him a good selection is more than just his resume. He leads with clarity, compassion, and a relentless belief in what’s possible when we prioritize people and purpose,” said Assemblywoman Shavonda Sumter (LD-35), Chair of the NJ Legislative Black Caucus.

“Democratic Gubernatorial Candidate Mikie Sherrill made a great choice in selecting Dale Caldwell as her Lt. Governor running mate. Dale has a lifetime of public service to his community and state as a school board member, former Assistant Commissioner of Community Affairs, pastor and college president. Mikie and Dale are exactly the type of experienced leaders New Jersey needs to navigate the uncertain future we are facing,” said Essex County Executive Joseph N. DiVincenzo, Jr. 

“Dale Caldwell is a home run for Lt. Governor. Like Mikie, he will work hard to deliver for first responders. He understands the issues facing New Jersey’s Firefighters, EMT’s and Dispatchers. He is a dedicated public servant and understands the needs of working men and women. We look forward to working with him to make sure that Mikie Sherrill is the next Governor for the state of New Jersey,” said FMBA President Eddie Donnelly.

On social media: 

Jeannine Frisby LaRue on Facebook
“Today I have attended three major events, and…in each case folks have said, “Do you know this guy Dale Caldwell who Mikie Sherrill picked as Lt. Gov nominee? I don’t know him.” 

“Well…yes…I’ve known Dr. Dale Caldwell for almost 30 years.  He’s brilliant, engaging and filled with integrity.  Dale is NOT a political animal…he has no party bosses.  Although he’s usually the smartest guy in the room, he doesn’t flaunt it.  Dale is always ready to learn.

“So…if you want to know the public service journey of Dale, David Wildstein of New Jersey Globe got it right.  And…while Dale might say I’ve been one of his mentors…not really so.  I’ve just been one of hundreds of proud people watching this young man finish Princeton U, UPenn, and Seton Hall as he climbed the corporate, nonprofit, governmental and higher education ladder…(most recently college president) the old fashioned way…he earned it! And…then my Pastor Charles Boyer tells me Dale is a minister!  Just wow!!! Congratulations, Dr. Caldwell. Job well done on this pick, Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill!  All three of her finalists were great!  She couldn’t go wrong…and…she didn’t! (Read for yourselves.)”

Mayor Bob Conley on X
“Mikie Sherrill’s choice of Dr. Dale Caldwell as her running mate speaks volumes about the bold, inclusive, and service-driven leadership she’ll bring to Trenton. Dale’s impressive background, spanning education, nonprofits, faith, and civil rights, makes clear he’s not only ready to lead, but ready to serve. Together, Mikie and Dale embody a new kind of leadership: focused on making New Jersey more affordable, more equitable, and more responsive to the needs of our communities. I’m excited to see all they will accomplish as our next Governor and Lieutenant Governor.”

Dr. Patricia Campos-Medina on X
Exciting pick for LG from @MikieSherrill I’ve known Dale since 2000 when we were both NextGen Leadership Fellows at @RockefellerFdn Since then, we’ve worked together & I know he’s a leader of principle who cares about creating opportunity for all.

BlueWaveNJ on X
.@MikieSherrill's pick for lieutenant governor, @DaleCaldwell, as a minister, educator, and a forceful advocate for justice, brings a wealth of experience and reflects the team's commitment to service.

Pennsylvania Lt. Gov Austin Davis on X
@DaleCaldwell is ready to bring a new kind of leadership to Trenton — one that focuses on possibilities, not politics, and delivers real results for the people of New Jersey. Alongside @MikieSherrill

In the news:

New Jersey Globe: Sherrill formally nominates Dale Caldwell as running mate 

  • The New Jersey Globe reported Sherrill’s running mate selection on Thursday. The 65-year-old pastor, tennis player, and former assistant commissioner at the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs will join Sherrill on the campaign trail Saturday, according to the release.

  • “I’m proud to select Dale Caldwell as my Lieutenant Governor running mate because we share a commitment to public service and challenging the status quo,” Sherrill said in the release. “Dale is the son of civil rights leaders who marched with Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. in Selma — and he’s followed in his parents’ footsteps and he has always been a voice for the voiceless.”

WHYY: N.J. Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherrill selects Centenary University President Dale Caldwell as her running mate 

  • The selection is seen as an “out-of-the-box” pick that will differentiate Sherrill from outgoing Gov. Phil Murphy.

  • In addition to serving as Centenary University president, Caldwell is also a pastor in the United Methodist Church and a former deputy commissioner of the Department of Community Affairs.

  • He also served as the executive director of the Rothman Institute of Innovation and Entrepreneurship at Fairleigh Dickinson University and as president of the Educational Services Commission.

  • Caldwell, an avid tennis player and coach, was president and CEO of the United States Tennis Association Eastern Section, founded the Black Tennis Hall of Fame and is a member of the Eastern Tennis Hall of Fame.

Courier Post: Who is Mikie Sherrill's running mate in the NJ governor election? Meet Dale Caldwell.

  • For her lieutenant governor choice, Democratic gubernatorial candidate and U.S. Rep. Mikie Sherrill, D-New Jersey, is putting her faith in a local university president who has a family history of preaching.

New Jersey Monitor: Dem nominee for governor picks university president, pastor as running mate

  • Caldwell said he has dedicated his life to public service to his church, students, and community. He echoed Sherrill’s anti-Trump warning.

  • “While we will be a voice for the people, Jack Ciattarelli will be a voice for Trump and the MAGA movement that is costing New Jersey our wallets and our freedoms,” Caldwell said in a statement.

  • Caldwell became Centenary University’s president in 2023 and is the first Black president of the private, Methodist university, which has an enrollment of over 1,000 students. 

Insider NJ: DLGA Endorses New Jersey Lt. Governor Nominee Dr. Dale Caldwell

  • The Democratic Lieutenant Governors Association (DLGA) today endorses Dr. Dale Caldwell as the next lieutenant governor of New Jersey.

  • A proven leader with a lifelong commitment to service, Dr. Caldwell will bring experience, and compassion to the role. From his work in government and education to his leadership in the nonprofit and private sectors, Dale will be ready to get to work on Day 1 to make life more affordable for New Jerseyans.

  • In a show of strong support for his candidacy, the DLGA will contribute $100,000 to Greater Garden State, the DGA-led independent expenditure effort to elect the Sherrill-Caldwell ticket this November.

  • “Dale brings an innovative approach to problem-solving, a deep commitment to the people he serves, and a relentless work ethic — qualities that have defined his decades of leadership in the private sector, higher education, nonprofits, and public service.

Insider NJ: Caldwell Campaigns with Sherrill in Carteret

  • Dale Caldwell has been a political candidate for all of two days, but already has an opinion about it.

  • "I love it," he said Saturday afternoon above the pulsating beat of the "most popular Latin fest" in New Jersey at the borough's civic center park.

  • "She takes no nonsense," one woman said of Sherrill. "She's not afraid of Trump."

data.title: ICYMI from NorthJersey.com: “Republicans are accountable” for Healthcare Cuts. That Includes Jack Ciattarelli.
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In case you missed it, the NorthJersey.com editorial board slammed New Jersey Republicans for votes to cut healthcare and raise costs, saying the bill “spells disaster for healthcare in New Jersey.” 

The Republicans who should be held accountable include Jack Ciattarelli, who cheered on the bill every step of the way — even saying he would twist arms to get New Jersey’s congressional delegation to support the price hike bill and tried to “shame” any Republican with the courage to buck Trump. 

“Jack Ciattarelli is going to own this every day on the campaign trail, where he has to defend lost healthcare and higher premiums, higher utility bills, and higher mortgage rates — all because he lacks the courage to say no to Donald Trump. This week, Mikie will hear directly from New Jerseyans who are hurt by this legislation and Jack Ciattarelli’s devastating MAGA agenda,” said Mikie Sherrill for Governor Communications Director Sean Higgins. 

NorthJersey.com: Trump's tax cut bill decimates Medicaid in NJ. Republicans are accountable. | Editorial

  • The so-called “Big, Beautiful Bill” — the federal budget package narrowly passed by both houses of Congress before it was signed by President Donald Trump on July 4 — spells disaster for health care in New Jersey.

  • The impacts of those cuts are devastating for the Garden State — and many of its most vulnerable residents in particular.

  • More than 350,000 New Jersey residents, according to the state Department of Human Services, are likely to lose health care coverage as significant cuts to Medicaid are expected to detrimentally affect NJ FamilyCare, the state-run program that administers federal health benefits. That means 1 in 5 New Jersey residents who receive Medicaid benefits will lose their coverage.

  • New Jersey hospitals and public health institutions, meanwhile, are anticipating more than $3.3 billion annually in funding cuts. 

  • Also forthcoming are significant cuts to SNAP, the former food stamp program, which is relied on by 800,000 New Jersey residents — more than 60% of whom are children or seniors. 

  • “Our country is built on the promise of the American Dream — that this country provides opportunity for everyone,” [Congresswoman Mikie] Sherrill said on July 3. “This bill is ripping apart the very foundation of that dream by giving handouts to the richest Americans while making working families pay the price. As billionaires line their pockets, children will go hungry, seniors will not be able to access health care, and New Jerseyans will see their monthly bills go up.”

  • Kean, Smith and Van Drew should be ready to face [New Jerseyans’] questions and concerns — and we strongly encourage our readers to place calls and send letters to their offices now… they should be prepared to be held accountable at the ballot box, too.

data.title: The Jack Ciattarelli-Supported Price Hike Bill is Going to Devastate Communities Across New Jersey
data.description:
Today, Mikie Sherrill traveled across the state to hear from New Jerseyans who are going to be negatively impacted by the Ciattarelli/Trump-supported Republican price hike legislation. This legislation will kick New Jerseyans off of their healthcare, hurt small businesses, kill jobs, and increase student debt and housing costs for young people looking for opportunities here in New Jersey.

For her first stop of the day, Mikie and Rep. Donald Norcross visited CAMcare, a Camden County-based Federally Qualified Health Center that provides healthcare and critical wrap-around services to underserved communities. 

“CAMcare and other Federally Qualified Health Centers are on the front lines keeping our communities healthy, providing services ranging from pediatric care, to OB/GYN services, to early education intervention. The providers and patients here are rightly worried that these cuts to Medicaid will be devastating, not only ripping people off healthcare but also pushing people into emergency rooms, which drives up costs for all of us. Because of this bill, providers will have to spend more money on paperwork instead of patients, drastically reducing the services the health center can provide. While Jack says that this bill isn’t ‘a real problem in New Jersey,’ hearing from folks today underscores just how out of touch he is with our state,” said Mikie Sherrill. 
 

Mikie then went to BEMS West Solar Farm in Southampton Township, where she toured the facility and spoke to BEMS’ owner Gary Cicero and union workers who helped to build the project about how the Republican Price Hike Bill is not only going to drive up utility costs, but will also devastate small businesses and the workforce.

“Solar Farms like BEMS provide cheap, clean power to New Jersey and support thousands of jobs across the state. New Jersey residents are already facing increased utility prices this summer, and the Republican Price Hike Bill that Jack Ciattarelli blindly supports takes a hatchet to the clean energy economy, hurting wallets, jobs, small businesses, and working families alike. While Jack supports Trump and his job-killing, price-hiking bill, my administration will focus on driving down utility costs, boosting New Jersey’s energy independence, and ensuring we have the power necessary to support the economy of the future,” Mikie continued.
 

Finally, Mikie sat down with students at Kean University and University President Dr. Repollet to listen to how increasing costs — from student loans to housing — are impacting young people trying to start their careers and live in New Jersey.

“The students I met with today at Kean are pursuing degrees in STEM, criminal justice, education, psychology, and so much more. They shared how it’s already hard to pay for college and other basic needs, and because of Trump’s Price Hike Bill, pursuing professional degrees will be even harder – putting their futures in jeopardy. Our students have big goals, and it’s up to us to make sure that the next generation is set up for success and can afford to live in the Garden State — Jack Ciattarelli has abandoned that promise to our students in order to serve Donald Trump and give tax cuts to billionaires,” said Mikie Sherrill.

data.title: Lower Costs and Better Services: Mikie Announces Save You Time and Money Agenda
data.description:
WEST ORANGE — Today, Mikie Sherrill joined small business owners in West Orange to announce her Save You Time and Money Agenda — Mikie’s plan to make the state government work better, with fewer delays and costs, for residents and businesses. Her plan will help businesses create more jobs, drive down costs for families, grow our economy, and hold Trenton accountable for delivering for New Jerseyans.

“I’m going to be the governor who lowers costs, creates jobs, helps businesses grow, supports workers, and ensures that state government is transparent and accountable to New Jerseyans. For too long, Trenton has been plagued by a culture of settling on no, rather than getting to yes, and it’s holding us back. On Day One of my administration, we’re going to change that. I’ll establish a focus on customer service and accountability at all of our state agencies, cut licensing wait times and fees that make it more expensive to open a business, and enforce publicly available deadlines for agencies to hit in the permitting process. I come from the United States Navy, where we were given a mission, and we got it done. I’ll bring that same ‘get to yes’ mentality to New Jersey, because as governor, the buck stops with me,” said Mikie Sherrill.

“As a small business owner, the founder of the Centenary Institute of Entrepreneurship and the former leader of the Rothman Institute of Entrepreneurship at Fairleigh Dickinson University, I know that this is exactly what we need to make New Jersey a better place to do business. I have worked with businesses of all sizes, and across the board, it’s just too hard to navigate state government, especially with permitting, and it’s driving local and family businesses out of the Garden State. That’s going to change in a Sherrill-Caldwell Administration. The Save You Time and Money Agenda is going to be key to lowering the barriers to doing business here, and to bringing good jobs to our state. I look forward to working with Mikie and the business community to get this done,” said Dr. Dale Caldwell.

“I am the proud small business owner of Wood Legacy Productions. When I first opened my business in 2017, I had no knowledge of how to navigate the process — there was no checklist or guidelines. Mikie’s Save You Time and Money Agenda would have been a very valuable tool in starting my business. As Governor, Mikie is going to focus on ensuring agencies get to ‘yes,’ rather than getting stuck in the process. She’s going to work hand-in-hand with the community and with business owners so they can bring their dreams to fruition,” said West Orange small business owner Lori Montague. 

“I’m here because I believe small business owners like myself need a different kind of leadership in Trenton to make real progress, and that’s Mikie Sherrill. I know she understands the challenges, she listens, and she takes action. A few months ago, I met Mikie and shared my story with her about how difficult it was to open up my business, and Mikie listened. As you can see, she’s taking action. I’m excited to be here today as she announces the Save You Time and Money agenda — it certainly would have helped me save time and money while going through the permitting process of opening up my cafe,” said West New York small business owner Nadia Zapata. 

Read the executive summary of Mikie’s Save You Time and Money below, and see her full plan here.


SAVE YOU TIME & MONEY AGENDA
 

It's your state – it should work for you. By modernizing state agencies and cutting through bureaucracy, we’ll save families and businesses time and money, lower costs to taxpayers, and drive our economy forward. Cutting red tape is critical to building out our energy generation and reducing utility costs, and will increase transparency and accountability in our government.

Executive Summary

As governor, I’m going to be laser focused on lowering costs, delivering a better future for our kids, and making Trenton transparent and accountable to the public. But for too long, red tape and bureaucracy in Trenton have stopped us from reaching these goals. As a result, New Jersey ranks near last in business friendliness, state agency wait times, and affordability. 

On Day One, I will modernize state government to make it work better – with fewer delays and costs – for residents and businesses. New Jersey deserves more transparency and accountability from our state agencies and the next governor — which will save residents time and money. I will prioritize customer service and accountability at state agencies. This means faster and more convenient interactions with the state government for all residents, and quicker, more predictable, and less costly permitting and approvals for businesses. 

This policy agenda is squarely focused on saving you time and money, and includes several key pillars:

  • Pillar 1: Establish a customer service focus at state agencies and put residents’ convenience and accountability first

    • Drive a culture shift on Day One to make state agencies focused on customer service, convenience, and accountability.

    • Make agencies accessible and convenient by directing them to expand the use of online services and cut card and convenience fees for online services.

    • Innovate and modernize New Jersey’s outdated operating systems to increase efficiency and reduce operating costs.

  • Pillar 2: Make it easier to start a business

    • Slash business and professional license wait times significantly and eliminate business registration fees.

    • Provide businesses and residents with online step-by-step guidance on how to navigate the licensing and regulatory process.

    • Turbocharge the Business Action Center to drive small business success.

  • Pillar 3: Make it easier to grow your business, create jobs, and lower costs

    • Bring together a cross-agency Fast-Track Team within the governor’s office to expedite project approvals.

    • Create a project dashboard to track your permits and simplify the approval process, reducing the cost of everything from homes to energy projects.

    • Make project approval timelines transparent, predictable, and enforceable.

  • Through this plan, I am committed to achieving real cost and time savings for New Jersey residents and businesses, including:

    • The elimination of the new business registration fee;

    • A 50% reduction in average business and professional license approval times;

    • A 25% reduction in the average wait time between booking an online MVC appointment and the date of the appointment; and

    • A 25% reduction in the average permitting wait time for a business project.

      ###

data.title: ICYMI: GIFFORDS PAC endorses Mikie Sherrill for governor of New Jersey
data.description:
WASHINGTON —Today, GIFFORDS PAC, the national gun safety organization founded by former Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords, endorsed U.S. Representative Mikie Sherrill in her campaign for governor of New Jersey. Sherrill has spent years working on behalf of Garden State residents, having been first elected to Congress in 2018, and having served our country as an assistant U.S. attorney and in the U.S. Navy.

“Throughout her life, military service, and in Congress, Representative Mikie Sherrill has shown strong resolve to get things done for her community and a willingness to take on the toughest fights facing New Jersey families,” said former Congresswoman Gabby Giffords. “In the face of growing extremism and senseless shootings, Representative Sherrill’s commonsense approach to ending gun violence is needed more than ever—and I’m proud to endorse her campaign and stand with her in this critical race.”

“I grew up in a hunting family, I qualified as an expert shot in the United States Navy, and I worked to keep illegal guns off of the streets of New Jersey as a federal prosecutor. And it’s because of that background that I know that strong, common sense gun safety legislation saves lives,” said Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill. “I’m proud to earn GIFFORDS PAC’s endorsement because New Jersey must continue to be a stronghold in our fight to end gun violence. New Jersey cannot afford to elect a governor like Jack Ciattarelli, who voted dozens of times to put more guns in our communities and against critical, life-saving protections like background checks. We owe it to our kids to end gun violence once and for all, and I am proud to have GIFFORDS alongside me in that mission.”

In 2018, Representative Sherrill made history by flipping a seat that had been red for over thirty years and becoming the first woman to represent her district. Now in her fourth term in office, Representative Sherrill has made ending gun violence a top policy focus throughout her time in Washington — in particular, she’s been a tireless advocate for expanding background checks, banning bump stocks, incentivizing the safe storage of firearms, securing desperately needed federal funding for research into the root causes of gun violence, disarming domestic abusers, and providing needed appropriations to lifesaving community violence intervention programs. In 2022, Representative Sherrill joined her colleagues in voting to pass the landmark Bipartisan Safer Communities Act — the first major gun safety bill to be signed into law in nearly 30 years.

data.title: BOMBSHELL REPORT: Jack Voted to Give Rapists Parental Rights
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In the Assembly, Jack Ciattarelli voted to give rapists parental rights if their assault resulted in the rape survivor having a child — in an extreme, disgusting betrayal of women and survivors. This is disgusting and disqualifying for someone who wants to lead our state.

Here’s what you need to know about Jack’s “history of voting against legislation that would protect children and young adults in cases of domestic and sexual violence:”

  • Jack was one of the seven legislators in Trenton who voted to allow a rapist to have custody rights over a child that was born as a result of the crime. 

  • Jack voted against a bill to terminate parental rights for rapists that resulted in the birth of a child.

  • Jack “voted against a bill that would have disqualified registered sex offenders from working at ‘teen night’ events at New Jersey businesses.”

  • Jack “three times voted against bills that would have kept sex offenders and other abusers away from children.”

  • Jack voted “against a bill that would have helped address college sexual assaults.”

  • Jack voted “no on Assembly Bill 3219, which would have permitted domestic violence witnesses under the age of 16, and victims of any age, to testify in court by closed-circuit television rather than in person.”

Jack was in the extreme minority for all of these votes — they all passed overwhelmingly with both Democratic and Republican support in the Assembly.

“I am appalled by Jack Ciattarelli’s disturbing vote to give rapists parental rights if a child is born as a result of this heinous crime – and as a former prosecutor, I’m appalled at how this betrays survivors of these heinous crimes. Jack’s record is disqualifying for someone who wants to lead our state,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Read more:

New Jersey Independent: Ciattarelli repeatedly voted against bills that would have protected children

  • Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican former General Assembly member running for governor, has a history of voting against legislation that would protect children and young adults in cases of domestic and sexual violence.

  • Ciattarelli served in the Assembly from 2011 to 2018. During that time, he three times voted against bills that would have kept sex offenders and other abusers away from children, and also against a bill that would have helped address college sexual assaults.

  • In 2013, he voted no on Assembly Bill 3219, which would have permitted domestic violence witnesses under the age of 16, and victims of any age, to testify in court by closed-circuit television rather than in person.

  • The same year, he also voted against Assembly Bill 3537, which would have terminated parental rights for individuals convicted of sexual assault that resulted in the birth of a child.

  • The next year, in 2014, he voted against a bill that would have disqualified registered sex offenders from working at “teen night” events at New Jersey businesses.

  • Also in 2014, he voted against a bill that would have allowed the New Jersey attorney general to fine higher education institutions that fail to appropriately respond to students’ allegations of sexual assault by other students.

  • Each of the bills passed overwhelmingly in the Assembly at the time, but none were ultimately signed into law by Republican then-Gov. Chris Christie.

  • Ciattarelli’s votes provide a contrast with some of his statements in the current campaign. For example, in July, after a NJ Advance Media investigation found more than 100 youth sports coaches, trainers and workers in New Jersey had been accused of sex crimes, Ciattarelli said he would “100% support mandated background checks and fingerprinting for all youth coaches, trainers, and others with close contact with children in sports leagues, as well as other activities.’’

  • During his time in office, he never introduced or voted for a bill addressing sexual assault.

  • According to NJ Advance Media, Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherrill pledged to work with the New Jersey Legislature to address gaps in state law to better protect children from abuse.

  • “I am a parent of four teenagers who play sports, so I am disgusted and concerned by these reports,’’ Sherrill told the outlet in response to its investigation.

data.title: NEW WEBSITE: Jack’s Not For Jersey
data.description:
JacksNotForJersey.com shines a spotlight on Trump lackey Jack Ciattarelli, who said his job is to help Trump

BLOOMFIELD — The Mikie Sherrill for Governor campaign launched a new website that shows how Jack Ciattarelli has turned his back on New Jersey time and again. The site shines a spotlight on Trump-endorsed, “100% MAGA” Jack, who jacked up New Jerseyans’ taxes, made $3 million from the pharmaceutical companies that fueled the opioid addiction crisis, and sold out the shore after Superstorm Sandy.

“Jack has made absolutely clear that he’s not for Jersey -- he’s for Trump, no matter the cost. And his record as a career politician is damning: he voted to raise taxes at every level of government, voted against Sandy relief three times, and will join MAGA in defunding Planned Parenthood. And he made millions peddling opioid misinformation into our communities, fueling an addiction crisis that has cost lives and livelihoods. New Jersey can't afford Jack Ciattarelli,” said campaign manager Alex Ball. 

This site follows the launch of the New Jersey Democrats’ “Jack’s Not for Jersey” press tour to “draw sharp contrasts between Democratic priorities and what they argue is Ciattarelli’s track record of supporting Trump-era economic and social policies — ones they claim have hurt working families, public schools, and New Jersey’s affordability.” 

Rep. Rob Menendez, joined by a union president and a 30-year Jersey City public school teacher, kicked off the tour and “underscored the financial toll… Ciattarelli’s support for Trump’s policies continues to have on working families.”

New Jersey Globe: Dems launch anti-Ciattarelli tour, starting outside a former Trump building in Jersey City

  • The New Jersey Democratic State Committee kicked off its statewide “Jack’s Not for Jersey” press tour today outside the former Trump Plaza Residences at 88 Morgan Street in Jersey City.

  • With the Trump name long since removed from the luxury high-rise, Democrats suggested the location was a symbolic starting point for what they called a critical campaign to expose Republican gubernatorial candidate Jack Ciattarelli’s alignment with former President Donald Trump’s policies.

  • The state party’s latest effort aims to draw sharp contrasts between Democratic priorities and what they argue is Ciattarelli’s track record of supporting Trump-era economic and social policies — ones they claim have hurt working families, public schools, and New Jersey’s affordability.

  • “Jack recently said in an interview, ‘I support the president wholeheartedly, and my job is to help him,’” said Rep. Robert J. Menendez (D-Jersey City).  “I believe that the next governor of New Jersey’s ‘job’ is not to help President Trump, it’s to help every single resident of New Jersey… The president that time and time again puts billionaires over the hardworking men and women who power our state every single day: That is who Jack Ciattarelli is about.”

  • Democrats also unveiled a new microsite, Jack’s Not for Jersey.

  • Martinique Costa, President of Laborers Local 55 in Newark, underscored the financial toll she believes Ciattarelli’s support for Trump’s policies continues to have on working families.

  • “What we’re seeing is an affordability crisis,” Costa said. “Trump’s tariffs, which Jack Ciattarelli backs, are costing New Jersey families an average of $2,400 a year. Now while we’re seeing this play out: Everyone knows that a trip to the grocery store now is not what it was when we get to check out a year ago. Costs are increasing for everything,” said Costa.  “We need to elect someone who will stand up for labor and invest in working families – I’m proud to be supporting Mikie Sherrill for governor.”

  • The press tour, which make stops across the state over the coming weeks featuring voices from a range of communities – educators, healthcare providers, union members, small business owners, and parents – all spotlighting how they say Ciattarelli’s record and Trump-aligned agenda would impact their lives.

  • Among them is Lissa Santiago, a 30-year Jersey City public school teacher. Santiago criticized Ciattarelli’s education stance, especially in light of Trump’s efforts to reduce federal oversight and funding in public schools.

  • “New Jersey residents need a governor dedicated to investing in public schools, ensuring that every child has access to a quality education that prepares them for a successful future,” Santiago stated. “However, as Trump stated, Jack Ciattarelli is ‘100% MAGA,’ which includes his stance on education. Jack has supported Trump’s push to dismantle the U.S. Department of Education… if that federal funding were to be cut, local school districts in this state will need to raise taxes by a billion to cover those costs.”


Politico New Jersey Playbook

  • New Jersey Democrats are continuing to use President Donald Trump as a boogeyman as they look to boost Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill’s gubernatorial bid against Republican Jack Ciattarelli.

  • Standing in front of the building formerly known as Trump Plaza in Jersey City on Tuesday, Rep. Rob Menendez was flanked by union leader Martinique Costa, and Lissa Santiago, an educator, for the New Jersey Democratic State Committee’s first stop in its statewide tour dubbed “Jack’s Not for Jersey.” Menendez chided Ciattarelli for his support of Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act, echoing a line of messaging Sherrill has also used.

  • “In seven months, Trump has already failed New Jersey, and Jack is tied to all of those failures because he would support every single one,” Menendez said. “That’s going to be on the ballot in November.”

  • Sherrill and her allies have consistently tied Ciattarelli to the president, with the hope that Trump’s negative approval rating in the state and repeated warnings about how his policies could impact the economy will drag Ciattarelli down.

###

data.title: ICYMI: WSJ: Global Trade War Comes to New Jersey’s ‘Little India’
data.description:
While Mikie stands with the small businesses that drive New Jersey’s economy, Trump is pummeling them, and Jack said they should feel “pain.”  

BLOOMFIELD — New reporting from the Wall Street Journal shows just how much Trump’s tariffs — endorsed by Jack Ciattarelli — are costing New Jersey’s small businesses. Trump’s 50% tariffs on India are crushing small businesses in Middlesex County. Businesses worry they “may not survive” and residents are forced to pay more, as prices skyrocket by hundreds of dollars. While Jack continues to cheer on Trump’s unaffordable tariffs and endorse “pain” for New Jerseyans, Mikie visited small businesses in Edison and will continue to fight back against Trump’s tariff regime. She also has a plan to help small businesses cut through red tape to make it easier and cheaper to start and grow a small business in New Jersey. 

Take a look for yourself:

Wall Street Journal: Global Trade War Comes to New Jersey’s ‘Little India’

  • Oak Tree Road businesses thrived by selling Indian imports and now are straining under Trump’s 50% levies. 
     

  • …after President Trump’s 50% tariffs on Indian imports took effect, the mood of Indian businesses along the thoroughfare known as Oak Tree Road has turned notably downbeat. Many of the more than 200 businesses say they are wrestling with how to deal with the tariffs, and some wonder whether they’ll be able to last.
     

  • “The economy here is plateauing or even going down,” says Mahesh Shah, vice chairman of the local Indian Business Association, which hosted the annual parade. “Smaller businesses may not survive.”
     

  • Last month, a day after levies doubled to 50%, Edison Mayor Sam Joshi hosted Mikie Sherrill, the Democratic U.S. representative running for New Jersey governor, for a lunch at the local Moghul Express restaurant. As he directed Sherrill through the noisy throng of local attendees, business owners approached her with tales of woe over tariffs.
     

  • Aqib Virani, who helps his father run an Indian jewelry shop and also was the luncheon with Sherrill, says tariffs have been especially painful for jewelers like theirs that sell by weight, on top of record high gold prices. Virani wishes he had frontloaded before the full 50% came online. Now he plans to wait a few months before deciding whether to import from India again.
     

  • When the cost of a 40-pound bag of Zebra basmati rice went to $60 from $50, for example, [Patel Brothers grocery store] increased the shelf price to $69.99 from $59.99.
     

  • Then there are items that will disappear from shelves altogether as they become too expensive to import…

data.title: MIRA: “Encuentra un Camino o Haz Uno” — Mikie Sherrill Destaca un Liderazgo Audaz para Enfrentar la Emergencia Energética en Nuevos Anuncios
data.description:
MIRA: “Liderazgo Audaz” y “Haz Uno"

BLOOMFIELD — La campaña de Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora lanzó hoy sus primeros anuncios en inglés rumbo a la elección general. Los anuncios destacan cómo Mikie, entrenada en la Marina para enfrentar los retos más duros —como la emergencia energética de Nueva Jersey— ha dedicado su vida  a lograr lo que muchos consideran imposibles.

“Cuando se trata de cumplir para las familias de Nueva Jersey, Mikie no acepta un ‘no’ como una respuesta. Es la única candidata en esta campaña con un plan real para aliviar los costos que enfrentan nuestras familias de Nueva Jersey. Desde su primer día como gobernadora declarará un Estado de Emergencia en los costos de servicios públicos para parar los aumentos y empezar a bajar las tarifas,” dijo Alex Ball, jefe de campaña de Mikie Sherrill para Gobernadora.

Mikie dentro de un helicóptero durante el comercial, “Liderazgo Audaz” y “Haz Uno” forman parte de una campaña multimillonaria en televisión y medios digitales, desplegada a nivel estatal durante toda la elección general.

MIRA AQUÍ “BOLD LEADERSHIP” 

Mikie Sherrill: La Marina me enseñó que en una crisis, o encuentras un camino — o haces uno.

La piloto de helicóptero de la Marina, Mikie Sherrill, para gobernadora. 

Mientras las tarifas de servicios públicos suben un 20% y continúan ahogando a las familias de Nueva Jersey.

Mikie: Desde mi primer día como gobernadora, voy a declarar un Estado de Emergencia en los Costos de Servicios Públicos. Usaré poderes de emergencia para frenar estos aumentos y reducir tus facturas.

Mikie Sherrill sabe que una crisis de costos requiere un liderazgo audaz.

Mikie: Voy a enfrentar a cualquiera, o a todos, por las familias de Nueva Jersey.

MIRA AQUÍ “MAKE ONE”
 

Mikie Sherrill: En el cielo, no hay excusas. La Marina no acepta que las cosas sean “imposibles.” O encuentras un camino, o haces uno.

Mikie: Este es el liderazgo que Nueva Jersey puede esperar de mí como gobernadora.

Para gobernadora, Mikie Sherrill.

###

data.title: Mikie Meets With Mexican Chamber of Commerce, Lays Out Plan To Support Latino-Owned Businesses and Expand Economic Partnerships With Latin America
data.description:
PASSAIC — Today, Mikie Sherrill met with the Mexican Chamber of Commerce to discuss her plan to support Latino-owned businesses, strengthen economic relationships between New Jersey and Latin America, and protect our state from Trump’s chaotic tariff regime, which is one of the largest tax hikes on Americans in history. The Chamber has helped grow minority-owned businesses across the state, providing critical resources and support to over 150,000 Latino-owned businesses in New Jersey. Like the Chamber, Mikie knows that Latino-owned businesses are essential to New Jersey’s economy, helping to create good-paying jobs, boost our innovation economy, and support our communities. That is why Mikie is committed to including the Mexican-American community in her administration and helping minority-owned businesses grow and thrive, by expanding access to state contracts, reducing the permitting delays and fees that businesses face, and boosting support and investment from the NJ Economic Development Authority. 

“Small businesses are the backbone of New Jersey’s economy. At a time when Trump is raising costs for businesses with his unaffordable tariffs, New Jersey needs a governor who will make it easier to start and grow your business here, and expand economic opportunities for our state. As governor, I will bring accountability and transparency to Trenton, cut through red tape that is making it hard to do business here, and expand our trade partnerships throughout Latin America. I come from the United States Navy — when we’re given a mission, we get it done. I’ll bring that same ‘get to yes’ mindset to Trenton, to ensure that our state government is lowering costs and working for New Jerseyans,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

“We are honored by Mikie Sherrill’s willingness to hold a meeting with our Board of Trustees and founding members, during which we presented the work agenda we consider strategic for the office of the next government of New Jersey. We appreciate the candidate’s openness to work jointly on an agenda that strengthens both the state government and our community,” said Francisco J Del Toro, President and CEO of the American Mexican Regional Chamber of Commerce.

data.title: Republicans are Cutting Medicaid, Food Assistance, and Education Funding for New Jersey. Jack Ciattarelli Would Double Down on that MAGA Agenda.
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In the middle of the night, Trump led Republicans in cutting health care, food assistance, and education for New Jerseyans while continuing to force a double tax on working New Jersey families. And Jack Ciattarelli is in lock step with these efforts, refusing to even entertain suing the administration when Trump’s orders hurt New Jersey. Here’s what Mikie has to say: 

“If you are curious what New Jersey would look like with Jack Ciattarelli as governor, just look at Republicans in Washington: slashing health care coverage for hundreds of thousands of New Jerseyans, cutting food assistance as Trump’s tariffs spike grocery prices, and extending the SALT cap that continues to double tax NJ families. At the same time, they’re giving huge tax breaks to billionaires.

“Ciattarelli has committed to be a yes-man to Trump: bringing DOGE to New Jersey, banning abortion rights, and defunding Planned Parenthood. That’s the cost New Jerseyans will pay with Ciattarelli in Trenton.

“New Jersey needs real leadership. I’m running to chart a new path forward for New Jersey to drive down costs for families while protecting our state from the chaos in Washington.”

data.description:
ATLANTIC CITY — This week, Mikie Sherrill spoke with hundreds of members of  the New Jersey Firefighters Mutual Benevolent Association, UNITE HERE Local 54, and CWA Local 1036 in Atlantic City. data.title: ICYMI: Mikie Sherrill is Leading the Way on Lowering Utility Costs for New Jersey Families
data.description:
Bloomberg: “Power costs have become a key issue in New Jersey’s gubernatorial election, with Democratic candidate Mikie Sherrill pledging to freeze utility rates if she’s elected.”

BLOOMFIELD — New Bloomberg reporting is shining a light on PJM raising people’s utility bills. Mikie Sherrill is leading the way in holding them accountable, as “power costs have become a key issue in New Jersey’s gubernatorial election, with Democratic candidate Mikie Sherrill pledging to freeze utility rates if she’s elected.”

On Day One as governor, Mikie will declare a State of Emergency on Utility Costs and “order a statewide freeze on energy prices.” When Mikie takes office, “the average New Jersey family won’t see an increase in utility rates for an entire year.”

New Jersey families are struggling with the out of control utility costs, but Jack Ciattarelli fully supports Trump’s price hike plan that will raise New Jersey families’ utility prices by over $200 per year. 

Bloomberg notes that “residential electricity prices have climbed about 10% from January until May and are projected to rise another 5.8% next year” and “the president’s own policies are poised to exacerbate that trend.” But Jack can’t think of a single thing he disagrees with Trump on.

“Every New Jerseyan knows that utility costs are out of control. New Jersey can’t afford to kick the can down the road — that’s why I’ve proposed bold, unprecedented action to drive down New Jerseyans' soaring utility bills. But Jack Ciattarelli is caving to Donald Trump who’s driving up energy costs, forcing New Jerseyans to reevaluate their budgets just to keep the lights on,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Take a look for yourself:

Bloomberg: Soaring Power Bills in Largest US Grid Pose Risk for Republicans

  • Surging utility bills in key battleground states are threatening to become a political liability for Republicans heading into upcoming elections.

  • Nowhere is that more apparent than on the largest US grid, stretching from Virginia to Illinois, where the cost of securing wholesale power supplies has been at a record for two straight years. The region includes two states electing governors this November, as well as four that are facing competitive House and Senate races next year.

  • That means President Donald Trump’s strategy of blaming renewable energy for surging electricity costs – including calling wind and solar “the scam of the century” last week — may have a hard time gaining traction.

  • The 13-state grid operated by PJM Interconnection LLC has become a bellwether for the evolving US electricity system.

  • The problem isn’t exclusive to PJM. Electricity prices, nationally, rose at more than twice the rate of overall inflation in the past year and are holding near a record high. But the issue’s political salience in the region suggests soaring utility bills are shaping up to be a key issue at the ballot box.

  • Against that backdrop, power costs have become a key issue in New Jersey’s gubernatorial election, with Democratic candidate Mikie Sherrill pledging to freeze utility rates if she’s elected.

  • Trump has vowed repeatedly to halve power prices within 12 months of taking office as well as double electricity capacity. Instead, residential electricity prices have climbed about 10% from January until May and are projected to rise another 5.8% next year, according to the Energy Information Administration.

  • The president’s own policies are poised to exacerbate that trend, critics say. 


Read more: 

  • NJ.com: Mikie Sherrill vows to freeze N.J. energy prices amid alarming rate hikes 

  • New Jersey 101.5: Sherrill vows ’emergency’ action on electric bills on Day 1 as governor of NJ

  • InsiderNJ: Sherrill Puts the BPU on Notice as She Vows Day One State of Emergency on Utility Costs

  • NJBIZ: Sherrill unveils energy plan to cut NJ utility costs 

  • New Jersey Globe: Sherrill says she’ll freeze utility bills in first year as governor

data.title: HIDE YOUR WALLETS, NJ: Jack Puts “10% Sales Tax on Everything” in New Jersey “On the Table”
data.description:
Everything on your table will be taxed more if Jack gets his way on higher sales taxes

BLOOMFIELD — Jack Ciattarelli previewed his plans to raise costs even more for New Jerseyans, putting a “10% sales tax on everything, including on food and clothing” in New Jersey “on the table.” The New Jersey Independent points out how Jack’s sales tax comments “come as New Jersey residents report struggling with increased costs.”

And that’s not all. Jack fully supports Trump’s price hike bill that is ripping away health care from 300,000 New Jerseyans and Trump’s tariffs that are squeezing families and businesses.

“Jack opened the door on making basic necessities cost more for New Jersey families. Well, I’m slamming the door — there will never be a sales tax on clothes or groceries when I’m governor. I’m willing to take on anyone to make life more affordable for New Jersey families, but Jack is nothing more than a Trump lackey, tax-and-spend politician,” said Mikie Sherrill.

New Jersey Independent: Recording captures Jack Ciattarelli saying he’s open to 10% sales tax in New Jersey

  • Republican gubernatorial nominee Jack Ciattarelli is facing criticism after saying he’s open to a 10% sales tax in New Jersey, including on food and clothing, according to audio captured during a campaign rally in Bergen County.

  • “I just came back from Tennessee not too long ago,” Ciattarelli said during the June 4 rally… “We were on a fundraising trip there, and Tennessee has no income tax. What Tennessee has is a 10% sales tax on everything, including food and clothing.

  • “The philosophy has always been in this state [that] we have like a 7% sales tax just to round off the numbers, but there’s no sales tax on necessities of life, food and clothing,” he continued. “I will work with the New Jersey State Society of CPAs. We’re going to look at what other states do. And every option is on the table.”

  • The Ciattarelli campaign did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

  • New Jersey currently assesses a 6.625% sales tax on “most tangible personal property, specified digital products and certain services unless specifically exempt under New Jersey law,” the state Division of Taxation’s website notes. Most grocery store food items and clothing are exempt from the sales tax.

  • A portion of Ciattarelli’s comments regarding the 10% sales tax are featured in a new ad launched on Sept. 3…

  • “Ciattarelli supported Trump’s Medicaid cuts, targeting 300,000 in Jersey,” the Greater Garden State ad’s narrator says. “And now, he’s talking about a 10% sales tax.”

  • Ciattarelli supported the One Big Beautiful Bill Act… which was signed into law by President Donald Trump on July 4. The law slashes funding for Medicaid, the nationwide public health insurance program for individuals with low income, which state officials said could result in 300,000 New Jersey residents losing health care coverage.

  • The Republican candidate’s sales tax comments come as New Jersey residents report struggling with increased costs.

  • About 39% of New Jersey households were finding it difficult to make ends meet in 2023, according to the most recent data from the United Way of Northern New Jersey. A representative of the group told the New Jersey Independent in August that she expects the percentage of households struggling to afford day-to-day costs to increase. 

  • New Jersey residents are also facing rising costs as Trump’s tariffs on imported goods go into effect. Educators recently told the New Jersey Independent that the costs of classroom supplies are rising; grocery costs are expected to rise due to tariffs; and electricity costs are up in part because of federal cuts to green energy programs.

data.title: Menores Costos y Mejores Servicios: Mikie Sherrill Presenta su Programa para Ahorrar Tiempo y Dinero
data.description:
WEST ORANGE —  Ayer, Mikie Sherrill se reunió con propietarios de pequeñas empresas en West Orange para anunciar su programa Ahorre Tiempo y Dinero, un plan diseñado para optimizar el funcionamiento del gobierno estatal, reducir retrasos y costos, y beneficiar a residentes y empresas. La propuesta busca impulsar la creación de empleos, reducir los gastos para las familias, fortalecer la economía y exigir a Trenton mayor transparencia y responsabilidad ante la ciudadanía.

“Voy a ser la gobernadora que va areduzir los costos, crear empleos, impulsar el crecimiento empresarial, apoyar a los trabajadores y garantizar un gobierno estatal transparente y responsable. Por demasiado tiempo, Trenton ha sido marcado por una cultura de conformarse con el ‘no’ en lugar de buscar el ‘sí’, y eso nos ha detenido. Desde el primer día de mi administración, vamos a cambiar esa mentalidad. Implementaré un enfoque centrado en el servicio al cliente y la rendición de cuentas en todas nuestras agencias estatales, reduciremos los tiempos de espera y las tarifas de licencias que dificultan la apertura de un negocio, y exigiremos que las agencias cumplan con plazos públicos en los procesos de permisos. En la Marina de los Estados Unidos, cuando se nos asignaba una misión, la cumplíamos. Llevaré esa misma mentalidad de ‘enfoque resolutivo’ a Trenton, porque como gobernadora, la responsabilidad recaerá sobre mí,” afirmó Mikie Sherrill.

“Como propietario de una pequeña empresa, fundador del Centenary Institute of Entrepreneurship y exdirector del Rothman Institute of Entrepreneurship en la Universidad Fairleigh Dickinson, sé que esto es exactamente lo que necesitamos para que Nueva Jersey sea un lugar mejor para hacer negocios. He trabajado con empresas de todos los tamaños y, en todos los casos, resulta demasiado complicado interactuar con el gobierno estatal, especialmente en lo relacionado con los permisos, lo cual está expulsando a las empresas locales y familiares del Estado Jardín. Eso cambiará con la administración Sherrill-Caldwell. La agenda Ahorre Tiempo y Dinero será clave para reducir las barreras para hacer negocios aquí y para traer buenos empleos a nuestro estado. Espero trabajar con Mikie y con la comunidad empresarial para hacerlo realidad," afirmó el Dr. Dale Caldwell.

Lori Montague, propietaria de Wood Legacy Productions en West Orange, compartió su experiencia: “Cuando abrí mi negocio en 2017, no tenía idea de cómo navegar el proceso. No había lista de verificación ni guías claras. En ese entonces el plan de Mikie habría sido  una herramienta invaluable para poner en marcha mi empresa. Como gobernadora, Mikie se enfocará en establecer una cultura institucional orientada a ofrecer soluciones, en lugar de dejar estancados en trámites interminables. Ella va a trabajar mano a mano con la comunidad y con los empresarios para que puedan hacer realidad sus sueños”.

Nadia Zapata, propietaria de una cafetería en West New York, recalcó la necesidad de un liderazgo diferente: “Los pequeños empresarios necesitamos un tipo distinto de liderazgo en Trenton para lograr avances reales, y ese liderazgo es el de Mikie Sherrill. Sé que ella entiende los retos, escucha y actúa. Hace unos meses le conté lo difícil que fue abrir mi negocio y ella me escuchó. Hoy demuestra que está tomando medidas. Su agenda Ahorre Tiempo y Dinero sin duda me habría ayudado a ahorrar tiempo y dinero en el proceso de permisos”.

Lea abajo el resumen del programa Ahorre Tiempo y Dinero y vea su plan completo aquí. 


Agenda “Ahorre Tiempo y Dinero”


Es nuestro estado debe funcionar para su gente. Modernizar las agencias estatales y reducir la burocracia permitirá ahorrar tiempo y dinero a familias y empresas, reducir los costes para los contribuyentes, e impulsar el desarrollo de nuestra economía. Reducir la burocracia es fundamental para desarrollar nuestra capacidad de generación de energía y disminuir los costes de los servicios públicos, además de aumentar la transparencia y la rendición de cuentas en nuestro gobierno. 

Resumen Ejecutivo:

Como gobernadora, me centraré de manera absoluta en reducir los costes, ofrecer un futuro mejor para nuestros hijos y garantizar que Trenton sea transparente y rinda cuentas al público. Sin embargo, durante demasiado tiempo, la burocracia y los trámites en Trenton nos han impedido alcanzar estas metas. Como resultado, Nueva Jersey ocupa posiciones cercanas al final en cuanto a facilidad para hacer negocios, tiempos de espera en las agencias estatales y asequibilidad.

Desde el primer día, modernizaré el gobierno estatal para que funcione de manera más eficiente, con menos retrasos y costes— tanto para los residentes como para las empresas. Nueva Jersey merece más transparencia y responsabilidad por parte de nuestras agencias y de su próximo gobernador, lo que se traducirá en no más pérdida de tiempo y dinero para la ciudadanía. Daré prioridad al servicio al cliente y a la responsabilidad institucional en las agencias estatales. Esto significa interacciones más rápidas y accesibles con el gobierno para todos, así como procesos de permisos y aprobaciones más ágiles, predecibles y menos costosos para las empresas.

Esta agenda de políticas está diseñada específicamente para ahorrarle tiempo y dinero, y se sustenta en tres pilares fundamentales:

Pilar 1: Establecer un servicio al cliente enfocado en las agencias estatales, priorizando la comodidad y la responsabilidad hacia los residentes. 

  • Impulsar, desde el primer día, un cambio cultural para que las agencias estatales se orienten al servicio al ciudadano, la eficiencia y la rendición de cuentas.

  • Ampliar el acceso y la facilidad de uso de los servicios en línea, eliminando tarifas de conveniencia y comisiones innecesarias.

  • Innovar y modernizar los sistemas operativos obsoletos de Nueva Jersey para aumentar la eficiencia y reducir los costes de funcionamiento.

Pilar 2: facilitar la creación de empresas

  • Reducir de forma drástica los tiempos de espera para la obtención de licencias comerciales y profesionales, y eliminar la tasa de registro de empresas.

  • Proporcionar a empresas y residentes guías en línea, paso a paso, para navegar los procesos de licencias y regulaciones.

  • Impulsar el Business Action Center como motor de apoyo y éxito para las pequeñas empresas.

Pilar 3: Facilitar el crecimiento de las empresas, crear empleos, y reducir costos

  • Crear un equipo interinstitucional de vía rápida dentro de la Oficina del Gobernador para agilizar la aprobación de proyectos.

  • Establecer un panel de control de proyectos que permita dar seguimiento a permisos y simplificar el proceso de aprobación, reduciendo costes en todo, desde viviendas hasta proyectos energéticos.

  • Garantizar plazos de aprobación transparentes, predecibles y exigibles.

A través de este plan, me comprometo a lograr un ahorro real de tiempo y dinero para los residentes y las empresas de Nueva Jersey, que incluye:

  • Eliminación de la tasa de registro para nuevas empresas.

  • Reducción del 50 % en el tiempo promedio de aprobación de licencias comerciales y profesionales.

  • Reducción del 25 % en el tiempo promedio de espera entre la reserva de una cita en línea en la MVC y la fecha de atención.

  • Reducción del 25 % en el tiempo promedio de espera para la obtención de permisos en proyectos empresariales.

data.title: El alcalde Ras Baraka brinda su respaldo a Mikie Sherrill en la contienda por la gobernación
data.description:
NEWARK — El alcalde Ras Baraka anunció ayer, durante un encuentro comunitario con líderes locales, su respaldo formal a Mikie Sherrill como próxima gobernadora de Nueva Jersey. La unión de estas dos voces líderes refleja un compromiso compartido: reducir los costos que agobian a las familias, garantizar el éxito educativo de nuestros niños y llevar mayor rendición de cuentas y transparencia a Trenton. 

Juntos, durante un encuentro con la comunidad en Newark, Mikie y el alcalde Baraka presentaron una visión audaz para el futuro, enfocado en construir riqueza generacional para las comunidades afroamericanas y reducir la brecha económica mediante la ampliación de ayuda para las personas que anhelen comprar una vivienda por primera vez, mejorar los resultados en lo que respecta a la salud materna de las mujeres afroamericanas y la garantizar de que cada niño en el estado, sin importar su código postal, tengan acceso a una educación pública de alta calidad.

Declaración de Mikie Sherrill:

“Me llena de entusiasmo trabajar codo a codo con el alcalde Baraka porque compartimos un mismo amor por este estado y una misma preocupación: que, para demasiadas familias de Nueva Jersey, la vida se ha vuelto demasiado costosa y el progreso, demasiado difícil de alcanzar. Juntos, vamos a abordar los desafíos más urgentes de nuestro estado: ampliar el acceso a la riqueza generacional, mejorar la salud materna de las mujeres afroamericanas y reducir los costos que pesan sobre las familias trabajadoras. Sabemos bien lo que está en juego: mientras Jack Ciattarelli, obedece sin problema todo lo que Trump le ordene, las familias de Nueva Jersey pagan las consecuencias.”

Declaración del alcalde Ras Baraka:

“Hace poco fui candidato a la gobernación de Nueva Jersey porque entiendo la gravedad del momento en que estamos viviendo. Nuestro país —y también nuestro estado— enfrenta una amenaza seria. Necesitamos una gobernadora que defienda a los trabajadores y los temas que afectan a nuestra comunidad. Después de varias conversaciones sobre la mortalidad materna afroamericana, la creciente brecha de riqueza, las profundas desigualdades en los negocios y en la propiedad de vivienda, así como la necesidad de abrir verdaderos caminos hacia la clase media para los sectores marginados, estoy convencido de que la congresista Sherrill es la mejor opción para todos. Ella liderará con compasión y firmeza, no sólo para protegernos de los excesos de Trump, sino también para derribar las barreras económicas de larga data que mantienen a nuestro estado dividido y desigual.”

###

data.title: ICYMI: Mikie Sherrill Announces Save You Time and Money Agenda To Grow Small Businesses
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Yesterday, Mikie announced her Save You Time and Money Agenda. It’s her plan to cut through red tape and increase transparency and accountability in Trenton by making state government work better. This will help create jobs, drive down costs for families, and grow our economy. Read more coverage of Mikie’s agenda below: 

In The News: 

New Jersey Globe: Sherrill releases platform targeting red tape, bureaucracy

  • Through the “Save You Time & Money” agenda, Sherrill said she plans to eliminate the new business registration fee, cut business and professional license approval wait times by half, and reduce the wait time between booking an MVC appointment and the date of the appointment by 25%. 

  • The congresswoman drove home the importance of accountability in implementing the proposed policies, saying she would be willing to replace department and agency leaders who don’t do their jobs effectively. 

  • “It’s just too difficult to navigate the permitting and regulatory environment that we have right now,” she said. … “We have the ability to do this,” Sherrill said. “We just have to set higher standards, and then we also have to cut through some of the regulations.”

WATCH: Pix11: New Jersey Governor race heats up with small business initiatives

  • If elected, [Mikie] will make it easier to start a business by slashing license wait times and eliminating registration fees. When it comes to cutting State government red tape, she says she plans to create a customer service approach at State agencies.

  • “I’m going to have a huge culture shift,” said Sherrill, “so that you can have a government that helps get to ‘yes,’ works with you, to make sure you understand what is needed to get through the process, cut down on unnecessary permitting and red tape times and make sure everyone has the opportunity to have a better customer service experience.”

BINJE: Sherrill, taking aim at Trenton bureaucracy, details initiatives to help small businesses 

  • Democratic Candidate for governor Mikie Sherrill said she wants to eliminate the new business registration fee, cut business and professional license approval times in half —even make appointments at the Motor Vehicle Commission more efficient. 

  • “I’m going to be the governor who lowers costs, creates jobs, helps businesses grow, supports workers, and ensures that state government is transparent and accountable to New Jerseyans,” she said. “For too long, Trenton has been plagued by a culture of settling on no, rather than getting to yes, and it’s holding us back.  

  • “I have worked with businesses of all sizes, and across the board,” [Dale Caldwell] said. “It’s just too hard to navigate state government, especially with permitting, and it’s driving local and family businesses out of the Garden State.”  

  • “That’s going to change in a Sherrill-Caldwell Administration. The Save You Time and Money Agenda is going to be key to lowering the barriers to doing business here, and to bringing good jobs to our state.” 

Politico: Sherrill lays out goals to cut government red tape

  • Sherrill rolled out her latest policy plan in the race for governor on Thursday, focused on “modernizing our agencies and cutting through red tape,” she said at a restaurant in West Orange.

NJ BIZ: Sherrill pledges faster business permits, less red tape in NJ

  • “By modernizing our agencies and cutting through red tape, we can truly make a difference for New Jersey families,” said Sherrill. “It’s critical for transparency and for accountability. So, here’s how I’m going to get it done.”

  • Noting that small business owners have taken a big risk in starting their businesses, which are so critical to local communities, Sherrill said Trenton should make it easier, not harder. “That’s the type of leadership and accountability that I’m going to bring to Trenton. We’re going to get to ‘Yes’ – and the buck’s going to stop with me.”

  • She also spoke about the need to cut through some of the unnecessary regulatory burdens, such as the initial fee to set up a business. “I’m getting rid of that. Because when you’re starting your first small business, sometimes just those small fees are a real impediment. Especially your very small businesses,” said Sherrill.

Quadratín Hispano: Presenta Sherrill plan para agilizar servicios del gobierno de NJ

  • El evento se centró en la lucha en curso del restaurante por utilizar su patio al aire libre, a pesar de que la citación relacionada se resolvió hace más de dos semanas. Los asistentes destacaron que West Orange debe hacer más para apoyar a su comunidad empresarial, que actúa como la columna vertebral de la economía local y el corazón de los barrios.

  • Sherrill describió los pasos destinados a ayudar a los empresarios a sortear los retrasos y obstáculos del gobierno. "Licencias y reducción de las tasas de registro… ampliación de la orientación paso a paso para que se sepa cómo navegar por el proceso y no haya conjeturas", dijo. También abordó el coste personal de los retrasos actuales: "Probablemente, haya cientos de personas… que nunca pudieron llegar a abrir su negocio, que probablemente perdieron cientos, si no miles, de dólares y que se quedaron en peor situación debido al proceso que hay ahora".

data.title: Mikie Sherrill recibe el respaldo contundente de sindicatos en todo Nueva Jersey
data.description:
Los trabajadores eligen a Sherrill como su voz y defensora de sus familias en la lucha por un futuro más justo 


BLOOMFIELD— Los trabajadores, desde los andamios hasta las aulas, pasando por las enfermeras de los hospitales, conserjes, educadores, los aeropuertos, oficinas públicas y las familias trabajadoras del estado Jardín están apoyando activamente a la congresista Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora. Respaldada por poderosos sindicatos que representan a cientos de miles de trabajadoras y trabajadores, Sherrill se consolida como la candidata de confianza del movimiento sindical en el estado. 

El Consejo Regional de Carpinteros de los Estados del Atlántico Oriental (EAS Carpenters), que representa a más de 42,000 trabajadores especializados en la construcción, expresó su firme respaldo a Sherrill calificandola como una “defensora probada de las familias trabajadoras”.

“Mikie Sherrill es una defensora probada de las familias trabajadoras y de los sindicatos”, afirmó William C. Sproule, secretario ejecutivo y tesorero del Consejo Regional de Carpinteros de los Estados del Atlántico Oriental. “Desde la defensa de las leyes salariales vigentes hasta el respaldo a la Ley PRO y la ampliación de los programas de aprendizaje sindical, Mikie ha cumplido sistemáticamente con los hombres y mujeres que construyen este estado. Mikie ha demostrado que luchará por puestos de trabajo bien remunerados, lugares de trabajo seguros y políticas que fortalezcan a la clase media. Los carpinteros de EAS se enorgullecen de apoyarla en esta campaña. 

La Asociación Internacional de Trabajadores del Hierro para Puentes, Estructuras, Ornamentación y Refuerzo que representan 3,500 miembros en Nueva Jersey también ha anunciado su respaldo total a Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora de Nueva Jersey. 

Por su parte, 32BJ SEIU, el sindicato de trabajadores de servicios inmobiliarios más grande del país, con 15,000 miembros en Nueva Jersey, también pronunció su respaldo a Mikie Sherrill para gobernadora, calificándola como la mejor opción para proteger el empleo, mejorar la asequibilidad y defender los derechos laborales, al tiempo que instó a los votantes a mantener la gobernación en manos de los demócratas.

“Desde 2016, Nueva Jersey ha logrado avances históricos para los trabajadores: se aumentó el salario mínimo, se aprobó la licencia por enfermedad remunerada y se fortalecieron protecciones que han beneficiado a decenas de miles de trabajadores en todo el estado”, afirmó Ana María Hill, directora estatal y vicepresidenta de 32BJ SEIU en Nueva Jersey. “Pero la lucha está lejos de haber terminado. Por eso nos enorgullece respaldar a Mikie Sherrill, una defensora comprobada de los derechos laborales cuyo historial en el Congreso demuestra que está lista para consolidar y ampliar estos logros. 

Estos respaldos se suman a una creciente coalición sindical a nivel estatal que ahora incluye:

  • AFSCME

  • AFTNJ

  • CWA District 1

  • HPAE

  • JNSEO

  • New Jersey AFL-CIO

  • New Jersey State Council of Machinists

  • New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades

  • RWDSU

  • SEIU NJ State Council

  • SMART

  • SMART-TD

  • UFCW

  • Workers United

  • 1199 SEIU

  • 32BJ SEIU

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Gets Fourth Convention Win in Sussex County
data.description:
NEWTON — Today, Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after overwhelmingly winning the Sussex County Democratic Convention with nearly 90% of the vote — her fourth victory this month: 

“Sussex County Democrats know we have to win this November, and I’m so grateful for their support. Back when I flipped a district in 2018, grassroots Democrats in Sussex put in the work to help us take that seat, because that’s how we build broad coalitions in tough areas and get to work on issues that matter to our local communities. The only way to beat the Republicans in November is by showing up everywhere and taking every voter seriously — that’s how I’ve turned a red district blue and helped Democrats up and down the ballot win. New Jersey is ready for a different kind of leadership in Trenton. Together, we can stand up to the chaos and corruption in Trump’s Washington and chart a new path forward here in New Jersey where everyone can get ahead.”  

###
