data.title: Innovation and Technology
data.description:
New Jersey is home to some of the most innovative and competitive companies in the world, drawn by the Garden State’s best-in-the-nation public education system and skilled workforce. New Jersey has historically been at the center of the nation’s innovation economy, but our state is not doing enough to give small businesses the tools to succeed and grow.

I will make state government work better for New Jerseyans by modernizing state agencies and cutting through bureaucracy to save families and businesses time and money, lower costs to taxpayers, and drive our economy forward. To do this, I’ve introduced a plan to cut business and professional license wait times, eliminate business registration fees, reduce delays in the permitting process, and turbocharge the Business Action Center to drive small business success. I’ll reprioritize customer service and hold agencies accountable to transparent, timely, and efficient processes and deadlines. 

Additionally, I am committed to making our state the leader in advanced technology research, development, and application once again. New technologies — such as artificial intelligence, advanced semiconductors, blockchain, cryptocurrency, and quantum computing — will determine the landscape of the 21st-century global economy, driving economic growth and job creation. In New Jersey, we need to make sure our state takes advantage of this opportunity. As governor, I will modernize and streamline how our state agencies engage with these sectors, and adopt a whole-of-government strategy to support entrepreneurs, develop our startup community, and build out clean energy generation and transmission to boost new technology development and drive affordability for ratepayers.

We also need to protect communities and families from bad actors who seek to exploit new technologies, like AI and deepfakes, to harass school-aged children or scam seniors. Keeping kids safe online is one of my top priorities, and I’ve proudly led the fight in Congress to protect against the use of deepfakes to bully kids in school like we saw right here in New Jersey last year. I will work with the legislature to ensure that New Jersey’s data privacy, harassment, and fraud laws are modernized to crack down on these bad actors and deter them from targeting New Jerseyans.

Read more about Mikie’s Online Safety Agenda, and how it will keep kids safe online and strengthen our democracy. 

Read more about Mikie’s Save You Time and Money Agenda, and how it will modernize state government to make it work better for businesses and residents.

data.title: Sherrill Slams Ciattarelli’s Surrender To Trump
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after Jack Ciattarelli’s “Surrender to Trump” tele-rally: 

“Tonight, Jack Ciattarelli once again pledged never to take Trump to court over any of his illegal Executive Orders. That is a breathtaking statement considering the lawlessness coming from Trump’s Washington. No governor should ever make that pledge, regardless of party. New Jersey deserves a strong governor who will stand up for our state, our values, and most importantly the rule of law. While Jack has made clear he will always surrender, my pledge is to lead — because in the Navy, I took an oath to put our country and Constitution first. 

”Donald Trump continues to threaten to defund New Jersey and attack our rights and freedoms, but I’ll continue to stand for the people of New Jersey and protect our future.”
 

###

data.title: Trump’s Tariffs are Wrecking New Jersey’s Economy. Jack’s All-In.
data.description:
Jack on tariffs: “You can’t expect people to understand the implications of that because it does get very, very complicated. But, you know, tip our cap to the President."

BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after today’s jobs report showed the U.S. economy losing jobs for the first time in over four years:

“Today’s jobs report shows what I have been hearing all across the state — Trump’s tariffs are wrecking our economy and paralyzing Jersey's small businesses. Jack’s all in on this MAGA chaos, telling New Jerseyans that we should be feeling pain, and saying a 10% sales tax on food and clothing is on the table. I’m running to lower costs, Jack’s running to serve Trump, and New Jerseyans are already paying a steep price from Trump’s agenda,” said Mikie Sherrill.

data.title: Jack supports Trump’s utility bill hikes, says he won’t hold those responsible for mismanagement accountable
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — New Jerseyans are seeing their utility bills spike thanks to Trump’s Price Hike Bill and New Jersey’s grid operator, PJM. Because of Trump and PJM, New Jerseyans are going to see their utility bills go up by hundreds of dollars per year, and our state will lose thousands of jobs. Mikie’s running to lower those costs, while Jack’s going right along with these price increases and job cuts because it’s what Trump is telling him to do. 

“PJM sets energy prices for New Jerseyans and decides what sources of power get plugged into New Jersey’s energy grid. And right now, PJM is ripping us off and refusing to connect new projects, which is holding us back from investing in cheap, quick-to-build power sources like solar. Despite its decision to raise our utility bills by hundreds of dollars, Jack Ciattarelli is calling PJM ‘some obscure nonprofit’ and says that holding them accountable is ‘a bunch of BS.’ Sounds like Jack won’t fix the problem, and you will be stuck with higher prices. That’s because he is too busy running to please Donald Trump and his most extreme supporters instead of serving the people of New Jersey,” said Mikie Sherrill.

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Wins Passaic County Democrats’ Endorsement
data.description:
WOODLAND PARK — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement today after winning the endorsement from the Passaic County Democrats:

“I’ve represented and delivered on key issues for Passaic in Congress, and I’m so proud to have the Passaic County Democrats on the team in this campaign for governor. Passaic Democrats know that we need to build a broad coalition to win this race — and that I’ve got the experience bringing people together, winning tough races against Republicans, and getting results for the people of New Jersey. Together, we’re going to show up and make our case to voters in every corner of Passaic, because we know that Jack Ciattarelli or Bill Spadea in Trenton would cost us everything.”

In addition to Passaic, Mikie has earned support from counties following victories in Hunterdon, Mercer, Monmouth, Sussex, Middlesex, and Morris. She was the top vote getter in Ocean County, earning twice as many votes as her nearest competitor.

data.title: Jack is Lying and “Pushing Out a Deceptively Edited Clip” Because He’s Losing on Energy Costs
data.description:
Jack’s ad “misleads voters by editing a small portion of an old interview out of context — and Sherrill was actually saying the opposite.”

BLOOMFIELD — Jack Ciattarelli is “pushing out a deceptively edited clip” that “misleads voters” to try and save his failing campaign, but New Jerseyans won’t be fooled. In fact, just on Saturday, Jack praised high utility costs as a “big help” to his campaign.

There’s only one candidate in this race with a plan to end the utility rate hikes that are crushing families — and it’s Mikie Sherrill.

Here’s the facts:

  • Jack’s ad “misleads voters by editing a small portion of an old interview out of context — and Sherrill was actually saying the opposite.”

  • Semafor and Politico note that the ad “leaves out the point of her observation” to “make it sound like the opposite,” as New Jerseyans call out the ad for being “dishonest.”

  • The Philadelphia Inquirer notes that “Sherrill was actually criticizing unsuccessful Democratic messaging that over time has made people think clean energy would result in higher electric bills while making the case that the state should invest in ‘clean, cheap power.’”

  • New Jerseyans are struggling with sky-high utility costs. On Saturday, career politician Jack Ciattarelli praised the high utility costs as a “big help” to his campaign politically.

  • When asked what his plan is as “power bills jolt voters,” “the Ciattarelli campaign did not respond to a request for comment.”

  • Mikie is the only candidate in this race with a plan to end the utility rate hikes and lower costs.

  • Mikie’s bold plan to lower energy costs is resonating with New Jerseyans across the state.

Take a look for yourself:

  • Semafor: “The Republican Governors Association created a PAC to run anti-Sherrill ads, which exploit some… moments the Democrat had during the crowded primary. One PAC ad uses a clip of Sherrill talking about renewable energy that’s “gonna cost you an arm and a leg,” but leaves out the point of her observation: that cleaner power is now affordable.”

  • NJ.com: “National Republicans released a TV ad Friday with a video clip of Sherrill… the commercial misleads voters by editing a small portion of an old interview out of context — and Sherrill was actually saying the opposite.”

  • Politico: New Jersey gubernatorial race tightens as power bills jolt voters

  • Philadelphia Inquirer: Mikie Sherrill accused Jack Ciattarelli of deceptively editing her remarks… 

  • NJ.com: Mikie Sherrill vows to freeze N.J. energy prices amid alarming rate hikes

  • NJBIZ: Sherrill unveils energy plan to cut NJ utility costs 

  • New Jersey Globe: Sherrill says she’ll freeze utility bills in first year as governor

  • InsiderNJ: Sherrill Puts the BPU on Notice as She Vows Day One State of Emergency on Utility Costs

  • Bloomberg: Soaring Power Bills in Largest US Grid Pose Risk for Republicans

  • New Jersey 101.5: Sherrill vows ’emergency’ action on electric bills on Day 1 as governor of NJ

  • NorthJersey.com: Mikie Sherrill is right. NJ must declare an emergency on utility costs | Opinion by Evelyn Liebman

  • NorthJersey.com: Mikie Sherrill's right. It's time to put New Jersey utility customers first | Opinion by Stefanie Brand

###

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Slams Trump’s Tax Increase, Self-Inflicted Economic Catastrophe
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement today on the devastating fallout from President Trump’s trade war: 

“Donald Trump just implemented the biggest tax increase in my lifetime — an economic catastrophe for New Jersey families. This will raise costs to the tune of almost $4,000 per year, and many companies have already announced layoffs. No wonder the Wall Street Journal called it the ‘dumbest trade war in history.’ Trump is single-handedly turning the economy upside down — decimating retirement savings at the same time as he and Elon Musk are trying to take an axe to Social Security and Medicare. The U.S. economy isn’t one of his bankrupt casinos — he is ruining lives and livelihoods, and I’m going to fight like hell to protect New Jersey from this chaos.” 

###

data.title: Mikie to Jack: Put Partisan Politics Aside and Condemn Trump's Disgraceful Remarks on Domestic Violence
data.description:
Trump dismisses domestic violence, Jack is silent

BLOOMFIELD — Jack “‘I do not’ disagree with Trump on anything” Ciattarelli refuses to stand up for New Jersey women as Donald Trump makes unacceptable comments dismissing domestic violence. And Mikie Sherrill is calling it out.

Jack has “declined to name any issues where [he and Trump] disagree.” It’s no wonder Jack is silent here. In the legislature, Jack voted against a bill that would have allowed victims of gender motivated violence to sue their attackers or abusers.  

“I’ve spent my entire life fighting to protect women and families, but Jack has turned his back on New Jersey women time and again. This is simple — Donald Trump’s dismissal of domestic violence as a serious crime is flat-out wrong and disgraceful. Jack, put aside partisan politics and join us in condemning Trump,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

Take a look for yourself: 

NJ.com tweet: Is there anything you disagree with the president on? JC: “Right now, I do not.” 

AP: “[Jack] Ciattarelli won Trump’s endorsement, backed his budget bill and declined to name any issues where they disagree.”

data.title: Campaign Manager Alex Ball Statement on the Final Democratic Gubernatorial Debate
data.description:
NEWARK — Mikie Sherrill for Governor Campaign Manager Alex Ball released the following statement after tonight’s debate:

“Mikie Sherrill is the candidate with momentum following tonight’s debate — she’s the clear frontrunner and is heading into the final stretch of the primary with more grassroots support and resources than any other candidate. We’re seeing her message and vision resonating in every corner of the state. That’s because voters are looking for a candidate who can beat Trump-endorsed Jack Ciattarelli, and Mikie has the track record of winning tough races against Trump Republicans. There’s a lot at stake in this gubernatorial race, and during these last few weeks, Mikie will continue to show why she is the candidate to beat Ciattarelli, lower costs for families, and chart a different path forward for New Jersey.”

data.title: IFPTE Local 194 Endorses Mikie Sherrill
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, the International Federation of Professional and Technical Engineers (IFPTE) Local 194 announced that they are endorsing Mikie Sherrill to be the next Governor of New Jersey. IFPTE Local 194 represents over 1,000 New Jersey Turnpike employees across the state.

“IFPTE Local 194 is proud to endorse Mikie Sherrill because she’s committed to standing up for working families, and she is ready to make bold investments in New Jersey’s aging transportation and infrastructure systems. As the granddaughter of a union worker, Mikie knows that unions are critical to building opportunities for New Jerseyans. She will be a partner in our fight to protect our collective bargaining rights, ensure that the folks who keep the New Jersey Turnpike running have fair wages and good working conditions, and fully fund our state’s pension system. Mikie is the ‘Tunnel Obsessed Congresswoman’ who funded Gateway and when we elect her to lead our state, she’ll be an infrastructure-focused governor — with a clear plan to invest in our roads, tunnels, and bridges, and fix our broken public transportation system with transit-oriented development. IFPTE Local 194 encourages all New Jerseyans to get out and cast their ballots for Mikie this Tuesday, June 10,” said IFPTE Local 194 President Barry Kushnir.

“Unions built New Jersey and continue to create opportunities for middle-class families to thrive here in the Garden State. I am proud to earn the support of the working men and women who keep our Turnpike safe and running day in and day out. I look forward to working together to make bold investments in our public transportation systems, fix our aging infrastructure, and ensure that working families have a fair shot,” said Mikie Sherrill.

IFPTE Local 194 joins other major unions backing Mikie Sherrill, including  LIUNA, FMBA, and NAGE.

IFPTE Local 194 is a public sector union representing approximately 1,000 employees of the New Jersey Turnpike in the Maintenance, Tolls and Office and Clerical and Technical bargaining units. Local 194 is also affiliated with the New Jersey State AFL-CIO and the AFL-CIO. 
 

###

data.title: Editorial: Kudos to Rep. Sherrill for defending people’s financial protections, standing up to Musk
data.description:
There’s been a narrative that Democrats in Congress and the Senate haven’t been putting in enough effort to protect their constituents from the gutting of services brought about by President Donald Trump and his new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) headed by tech billionaire Elon Musk. While there may be some truth to that, we’re glad that in New Jersey’s 11th Congressional District, Democratic Rep. Mikie Sherrill has taken some important action. Sherrill has joined a lawsuit to protect the Consumer Financial Protection Board (CFPB) whose activities were suspended by Trump over the weekend.“

The Consumer Financial Protection Board is critical to protecting New Jerseyans from being ripped off by big banks, loan servicers, debt collectors, and payday lenders who break the law,” Sherrill said in a statement.

We agree. Defenders of Musk will say that DOGE is saving taxpayer money and making the government more efficient, as the department’s name suggests. However, we believe it’s obvious that they are hurting common people.

Compare Sherrill’s efforts to Congressman Tom Kean, Jr., R-7, who hasn’t had to answer any tough questions at town halls about mass firings because he hasn’t held any. Meanwhile, there’s a lot of news lately about complaints from voters at Congressional representatives’ town halls around the country, mostly about the mass firings across the board in the federal government. Sherrill has held several town halls since joining Congress in 2019, with the most recent in-person one being Aug. 15, 2024 in Randolph, and the most recent telephone one being Tuesday, Feb. 11.

In a time when people increasingly need answers from their representatives, we encourage Sherrill to continue hosting town halls. What’s been happening at town halls around the country shows that people are upset, and they have the right to be. We encourage Democrats and Republicans alike to protect the services that their constituents rely on. If they don’t, they will need to answer to their voters come election season.

data.title: Questions Jack Ciattarelli Must Answer After Report that Jack is Cozying Up to “MAGA Force[s]” and January 6 Rioters
data.description:
How can voters trust “ALL IN on MAGA” Jack, who refuses to stand up to Trump even when it hurts New Jersey families? 
 

BLOOMFIELD — A bombshell report from the Philadelphia Inquirer has shone a spotlight on “ALL IN on MAGA” Jack Ciattarelli hitting the campaign trail with “MAGA force[s]” and January 6 rioters who have had their “fair share of controversy.” To say the least. 

On Saturday, Jack hosted a campaign event with “MAGA voter-registration activist” Scott Presler, who has worked to “overturn the 2020 election, support the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, and organiz[e] a nationwide protest criticized as anti-Muslim,” it’s clear that the “rally demonstrates Ciattarelli’s embrace of the party’s MAGA wing.” 

Jack continues to cozy up to MAGA extremists who have had their “fair share of controversy,” including campaigning with January 6 insurrectionist Joe Belnome. And let’s not forget: Jack attended a “Stop the Steal” rally in 2021.

Questions Jack must answer:

  • You attended a Stop the Steal rally in 2021 and hit the trail with “MAGA voter-registration activist” Scott Presler, who worked to “overturn the 2020 election [and] support the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.” Why do you excuse the dangerous behavior of the violent January 6 rioters who attacked law enforcement and tried to overturn a free and fair election? 

  • On Saturday, you were campaigning with “conservative radio host” Sid Rosenberg, who said “all Democrats are ‘degenerates, lowlives, Jew-haters’.” How can you condone Sid’s hateful rhetoric?

  • How can voters trust you when you are “ALL IN on MAGA” and refuse to name a single issue where you disagree with President Trump? 

In case you missed it:

The Philadelphia Inquirer: Why Jack Ciattarelli is rallying with MAGA influencer Scott Presler at the Jersey Shore

  • President Donald Trump’s pick for New Jersey governor Jack Ciattarelli will rally with rising MAGA force Scott Presler… on Saturday.

  • The “New Jersey Unites” rally in Seaside Heights on the Jersey Shore is part of Presler’s effort to unite Republicans in the state behind GOP nominee Ciattarelli in his campaign… 

  • Ciattarelli, a former Assembly member, has been running for governor for the better part of the last decade.

  • This time around, [Ciattarelli] “has gone ALL IN” on MAGA, as Trump said in his endorsement of Ciattarelli in a Truth Social post before Ciattarelli won the primary by a large margin.

  • Presler has made a name for himself nationally as a MAGA voter-registration activist who takes credit for helping swing Pennsylvania to Trump in the 2024 election.

  • Democrats, meanwhile, point to Presler’s past involvement with efforts to overturn the 2020 election, support of the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, and organizing a nationwide protest criticized as anti-Muslim.

  • The upcoming rally demonstrates Ciattarelli’s embrace of the party’s MAGA wing this election.

  • Ciattarelli and Presler appeared together last month at a private event in Red Bank… 

  • Ciattarelli has praised Presler as the “X factor” and “get-out-the-vote extraordinaire” multiple times.

  • Carly Jones, a spokesperson for Sherrill, called Presler “a conspiracy theorist” and criticized Ciattarelli for affiliating with him.

  • “Jack Ciattarelli hitting the trail alongside him is yet more proof that Jack will roll over and let Trump turn New Jersey into his stomping ground to drive up prices and take away our rights,” Jones said in a statement, referencing Trump’s tariffs and other policies.

  • Earlier this year, [Ciattarelli] said he supports pardons for people who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6, citing “overzealous and politically motivated prosecutions…”  

  • Conservative radio host Sid Rosenberg, who has his fair share of controversy and has been described as a “shock jock, will also speak at the rally. 

  • Last year, Rosenberg said that all Democrats are “degenerates, lowlives, Jew-haters” at the Madison Square Garden Trump rally that garnered widespread attention after one speaker, comedian Tony Hinchcliffe, called Puerto Rico a “floating island of garbage.”

  • Just on Wednesday, Ciattarelli attended three private fundraisers with Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp, the head of the Republican Governors Association… 

###

data.title: ICYMI: Mikie Small Business Tour: The Save You Time and Money Agenda
data.description:
Bloomfield — Yesterday, Mikie Sherrill hit the road with her Save You Time and Money Agenda Tour, traveling across New Jersey to speak with business owners across the state about her plan to make government work better, with fewer delays and costs, for residents and businesses. Speaking with business owners in Edison, Clarksboro, and Haddonfield, Mikie laid out how her agenda would help these businesses grow by cutting red tape and driving a culture shift in Trenton. 

Meanwhile, Jack’s willing to stick New Jerseyans with the bill for Donald Trump’s tariffs, he’s even said that he’s ok with businesses and families feeling “pain” in order to further Trump’s MAGA agenda.

“For too long, Trenton has been plagued by a culture of ‘no,’ rather than getting to ‘yes.’ As governor, I will drive a culture shift in Trenton, putting customer service, transparency, and accountability front and center at all of our state agencies. From Day One, I will be laser focused on lowering costs, creating good-paying jobs, and helping businesses grow. New Jersey has a long history of leading the way in innovation and entrepreneurship. But Jack Ciattarelli and his running mate Donald Trump are threatening that proud legacy with their unaffordable tariffs, taxes, and price hike bill. While Jack refuses to stand up for New Jersey, I will fight hard to deliver for you,” said Mikie Sherrill. 
 

“Donald Trump’s tariffs are forcing our customers to pay more on everything from vegetables to spices to snacks. And now, he’s targeting the Indian community, putting extra tariffs on products from India. Mikie Sherrill has a plan to help us lower costs, make it easier to expand our store, and hire more staff. We need a governor who will stand up for our store and our customers — not help Trump make things more expensive,” said Raj Patel, Co-owner of Patel Brothers grocery store. 
 

“Running a small business is extremely challenging right now, especially in New Jersey. Tariffs and market uncertainty are now forcing us to raise prices. The mainland United States does not have the climate to grow green coffee beans, so roasters have no option but to import it from other countries, who are now facing huge tariffs, due to politics, not economics. As a result, we now pay an additional $3,000-$5,000 for our coffee beans every month! On top of that, on the brewery side, it is extremely complicated to get permits to do anything in this state — for example, it takes weeks and tons of paperwork to host a charitable event or to partner with a neighboring small business. At a time when tariffs are costing me thousands of extra dollars and Trenton isn’t working, Mikie’s plan to lower costs and cut red tape will save us money and improve our bottom line,” said Charles Garrity, Founder and President, Death of the Fox Brewing. 

“As a small business owner, I know how much blood, sweat, and tears go into keeping a shop open — it’s time we had a Governor who made it just a little bit easier to keep the lights on. When I opened my bookstore, it took me 3 months just to get a permit for a sign. I didn’t know how the local permitting laws worked or the steps for opening a business — all I had was a dream. If I could’ve had a checklist of all the requirements, the order in which they had to be done, and a little bit of help it would’ve saved me hundreds, if not thousands, of dollars and helped me open my doors sooner. Mikie’s Save You Time and Money Agenda will do just that and help every new business owner in New Jersey avoid the nightmare I went through,” said Julie Beddingfield, Owner of Inkwood Books. 

###

data.title: Jack Votes to Raise Your Taxes
data.description:
Jack votes to raise taxes, backs Trump’s tariffs, and offers his “full-throated support” of reinstating SALT Cap that acts a double tax on New Jerseyans


BLOOMFIELD — New Jerseyans’ taxes are sky-high, thanks to Jack Ciattarelli who voted to raise taxes at every level of government.

Here’s what you need to know about Jack:

  • Jack raised taxes as a Raritan Councilman.

  • Jack raised taxes as a Somerset County Commissioner.

  • Jack voted to expand the sales tax and allow municipalities to raise taxes in the legislature.

  • Jack voted against $789 million in property tax relief in the legislature.

  • Jack pushed to raise the gas tax for years.

  • Jack has offered his “full-throated support” for extending the SALT cap, a “double tax on the Garden State” which was due to expire in 2025, raising New Jerseyans’ taxes by $30 billion. 

  • Jack is all in on the Trump “scattershot tariff policy,” which is another tax on New Jerseyans, even as he acknowledges “there’s going to be some pain.” 

No matter the cost to New Jersey families, Jack remains in full support of the MAGA agenda saying, “shame on any Republican across the country that doesn’t support this. The president supports it.” 

“New Jersey families are struggling because Jack Ciattarelli is putting the MAGA agenda instead of what’s best for our state. I’ve made clear I’ll take on anyone to lower costs for families — but Jack will cave to Trump every time, no matter the cost to New Jersey,” said Mikie Sherrill. 

Take a look:

  • Jersey Independent: Ciattarelli supported ending cap on local tax deductions, now favors law that keeps it

  • Asbury Park Press: Trump's unpredictable tariffs pressure Jersey Shore pizzerias, shops, manufacturers

data.title: ICYMI: 28 New Jersey Mayors Endorse Mikie’s Plan to Freeze Utility Rates
data.description:
The 28 mayors “emphasized the urgency of addressing utility costs, describing the situation as affecting families' basic needs and quality of life.”

BLOOMFIELD — The New Jersey Hills reported that “a coalition of 28 current and former mayors of New Jersey communities” have endorsed Mikie’s plan to declare a State of Emergency on Utility Costs and freeze utility rates. 

The mayors highlighted that “New Jerseyans shouldn't have to choose between keeping the lights on and putting food on the table,” as they shared “stories of families struggling with the financial burden, including parents reducing meals and seniors cutting back on medications to afford utility payments.”

The mayors “emphasized the urgency of addressing utility costs, describing the situation as affecting families' basic needs and quality of life.” But Jack Ciattarelli fully supports Trump’s price hike plan, which will raise New Jersey families’ utility prices by over $200 per year. 

“New Jersey mayors are on the frontlines of so many issues, and they’re hearing from families who are struggling with the out of control utility costs. I am going to be the governor who lowers your utility bills. But Jack Ciattarelli is fully on board with Donald Trump continuing to drive up utility costs, hurting Garden State families,” said Mikie Sherrill.  

Take a look for yourself:

New Jersey Hills: ‘Mayors for Mikie’ endorse Sherrill’s plan to combat rising utility costs

  • A coalition of 28 current and former mayors of New Jersey communities on Wednesday, Aug. 28, distributed an endorsement of Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherrill’s plans to address rising electricity costs.

  • The announcement was released as New Jersey residents have been facing electricity rate increases in the range of 20% or more, according to recently published energy cost data.

  • As part of her campaign for governor… Sherrill, a member of Congress representing New Jersey District 11, has proposed measures including an immediate rate freeze to halt further increases for households.

  • "New Jerseyans shouldn't have to choose between keeping the lights on and putting food on the table," said a statement from the coalition, Mayors for Mikie. In its endorsement, the group highlighted stories of families struggling with the financial burden, including parents reducing meals and seniors cutting back on medications to afford utility payments.

  • Sherrill's utility relief plan includes both immediate and long-term strategies. The immediate component would freeze current rates while her administration develops what she calls an "energy arsenal" of in-state power generation.

  • The long-term strategy focuses on expanding renewable energy infrastructure, including solar installations and battery storage systems. The plan also proposes upgrades to existing nuclear facilities and modernization of natural gas infrastructure. Sherrill has indicated she would streamline permitting processes to accelerate energy project development.

  • Sherrill also pledged to increase oversight of utility companies, requiring greater transparency in their financial operations following what she characterized as record profits. Her plan includes potential legal action against PJM Interconnection, the regional energy grid operator serving New Jersey, for what she describes as delays and mismanagement affecting energy availability and pricing.

  • Sherrill's campaign has positioned energy affordability as a central platform issue, promising action beginning on "Day One" of her potential administration.

  • The coalition of mayors supporting Sherrill's plan represents various municipalities — many of them within her congressional district. They include:

    • Robert H. Conley, Mayor, Borough of Madison

    • Carolyn Dempsey, Mayor, Chatham Borough

    • Stacey Ewald, Mayor, Chatham Township

    • Donna J. Guariglia, Mayor, Morris Township

    • Mark Gyorfy, Former Mayor, Morris Township

    • Jeffrey Grayzel, Former Mayor, Morris Township

    • Nicolas W. Platt, Former Mayor, Harding Township

    • Annette Romano, Mayor, Millburn Township

    • Nancy Adams, Mayor, Maplewood

    • Victor De Luca, Former Mayor, Maplewood

    • Dean Dafis, Former Mayor, Maplewood

    • Fred Profeta, Former Mayor, Maplewood

    • Ellen Davenport, Former Mayor, Maplewood

    • Mark Freda, Mayor, Princeton

    • Lori Hohenleitner, Mayor, Borough of Atlantic Highlands

    • Jonathan Busch, Mayor, Metuchen

    • Joshua Raymond, Mayor , North Caldwell

    • Rachel McGreevy, Mayor, Neptune City

    • Quinton Law, Mayor, Moorestown

    • Tom Menard, Former Mayor, Mountain Lakes

    • Timothy Dougherty, Mayor, Morristown

    • Jenny Mundell, Mayor, Township of Bloomfield

    • Colleen Mahr, Mayor, Borough of Fanwood

    • Jeff Martin, Mayor, Hamilton

    • Kyle Hanson, Mayor, Barrington

    • Patti Harris, Former Mayor, Barrington

    • William Portman, Mayor, Red Bank

    • Michael Mangan, Mayor, Borough of Manasquan

  • Mayors for Mikie emphasized the urgency of addressing utility costs, describing the situation as affecting families' basic needs and quality of life.

data.title: Sherrill Slams Trump’s Decision to Threaten Lifesaving Abortion Care
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after President Trump’s Department of Justice moved to drop the case to protect emergency abortion care through the Emergency Medical Treatment and Labor Act:

“President Trump’s decision is truly a gut punch and will endanger the health and lives of women who, at the recommendation of doctors, need abortion care during a medical emergency. The emergency room is not a place for politics. Let’s be very clear what this means: more of us will die because of this decision, and doctors could go to jail for simply trying to save the lives of their patients. This is not the world my daughters should have to grow up in — with fewer rights than I had, and with even worse access to the health care they need. 

“Over the past few years, we’ve heard harrowing stories from states across the country with extreme abortion bans — women bleeding out in hospital waiting rooms, being airlifted to neighboring states, and even dying after being denied emergency care. Without laws protecting emergency care, these stories are going to become a lot more common.

“In New Jersey, we’re going to need a strong Democratic governor who can fight back and move forward to protect abortion rights — whether that’s taking Trump to court, enshrining the right to an abortion into the state constitution, or standing up for Planned Parenthood when extremists like Jack Ciatarelli and Bill Spadea try to defund clinics across the state. The future of abortion rights in our state is on the line — and as governor, I’ll fight to protect reproductive freedom with everything I’ve got.”

In the House, Mikie has led the fight to defend emergency abortion care. Last year, she introduced a resolution to reaffirm that EMTALA protects access to emergency abortion care in every state. Read more from the Associated Press. 

###

data.title: WATCH: "Find A Way or Make One" Mikie Sherrill Highlights Bold Leadership to Tackle Energy Emergency in New Ads
data.description:
Watch “Bold Leadership” and “Make One”

BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill’s campaign for governor released its first ads of the general election today that highlight how Mikie was trained in the Navy to take on big challenges — like New Jersey’s energy emergency — and spent her life doing things that other people said were impossible. 

“When it comes to delivering for New Jersey families, Mikie won’t take ‘no’ for an answer. She is the only candidate in this race with a real plan to drive down costs for New Jersey families, starting with declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs on Day One to end the utility rate hikes,” said Mikie Sherrill for Governor Campaign Manager Alex Ball.

With Mikie featured piloting a helicopter, “Bold Leadership” and “Make One” are a part of a multi-million dollar statewide TV and digital campaign running through the general election. 

WATCH “BOLD LEADERSHIP”

Mikie Sherrill: The Navy taught me in a crisis; you either find a way — or make one.

For governor, Navy helicopter pilot Mikie Sherrill.

As a 20% utility rate hike crushes New Jersey families.

Mikie: Day one as governor, I’m declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs. Using emergency powers to end these rate hikes and drive down your bills.

Mikie Sherrill knows a cost crisis demands bold leadership.

Mikie: I’ll stand up to anyone, and everyone, for New Jersey families. 

WATCH “MAKE ONE”

 

Mikie Sherrill: Up here, there are no excuses. The Navy doesn’t accept that things are “impossible.” You either find a way or make one. 

Mikie: This is the kind of leadership New Jersey can expect from me as governor.

For governor, Mikie Sherrill.

data.title: Spanish-Language Media Highlights Mikie Sherrill’s Commitment to the Latino Community and Small Businesses
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — From sitting down with Latino business owners and entrepreneurs to walking in parades and rallying with families, Mikie Sherrill is listening directly to the community and taking action.

Mikie recognizes the extraordinary contributions of the Latino community — their values, work ethic, and strong families are at the heart of New Jersey’s economy and culture. That’s why she will deliver on key issues: lowering utility bills, rent, groceries, medical costs, and prescription drugs to make life more affordable; ensuring Latino-owned businesses get a fair shot at state contracts; and cutting red tape so entrepreneurs can start and grow businesses more easily. Her agenda is about saving families time and money while creating real opportunity across New Jersey.

Spanish-language outlets across the state have highlighted Mikie’s commitment to the Latino community:

Nuestra Gente Digital praised Mikie’s message directly to Latino families and her focus on reducing costs.

Quadratín reported on Mikie’s vision to make New Jersey “the capital of Latino businesses.”

Americano newspaper covered her meeting with the Mexican Chamber of Commerce, where she laid out her plan to support over 150,000 Latino-owned businesses in the state.

Front Runner New Jersey noted her call for a “State of Emergency” on high utility costs, a move that resonates with working families struggling to make ends meet. 

In a Telemundo interview with Alan Villafaña, Mikie emphasized that her administration will ensure true representation: “I want the Latino community represented at every level of my administration.”

Mikie’s campaign has been recognized by the Spanish-language press for what sets her apart: a genuine commitment to listening, understanding, and acting — as both a leader and a mother — to building New Jersey where every family can thrive with real hope, opportunity, and the chance for every family to succeed.

###

data.title: What They’re Saying: Mikie is an “Example” of a Leader Focused on Affordability, Jack is “Lagging” as He Campaigns with MAGA Extremists
data.description:
Bloomberg: “Power costs have become a key issue in New Jersey’s gubernatorial election, with Democratic candidate Mikie Sherrill pledging to freeze utility rates if she’s elected.”

BLOOMFIELD — From Atlantic City to Edison and Clarksboro to Haddonfield, Mikie met with New Jerseyans and small business owners as she highlighted how her Save You Time and Money Agenda will make it easier for New Jerseyans to start and grow a small business. 

Meanwhile, “100% MAGA” Jack was cozying up to Trump and MAGA extremists while campaigning at Trump National Golf Club Philadelphia. The contrast couldn’t be more stark. 

Take a look at what New Jerseyans are reading this week:

Mikie is an “example” of a leader on lowering utility costs as she focuses on affordability.

Axios: “One example of electricity bills' role is Mikie Sherrill, the Democratic candidate for governor in New Jersey, vowing to declare a ‘state of emergency’ that freezes rate increases.” 

Bloomberg: “Against that backdrop, power costs have become a key issue in New Jersey’s gubernatorial election, with Democratic candidate Mikie Sherrill pledging to freeze utility rates if she’s elected.”

Heatmap News: “Several people I spoke to for this story pointed to the example of Mikie Sherill, the Democrat running for governor in New Jersey, who last week vowed to freeze utility rates for a year if elected. She immediately followed that statement with a promise to ‘massively expand cheaper, cleaner power generation,’ including solar and batteries.” 

The New Jersey Hills: ‘Mayors for Mikie’ endorse Sherrill’s plan to combat rising utility costs

  • A coalition of 28 current and former mayors of New Jersey communities on Wednesday, Aug. 28, distributed an endorsement of Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherrill’s plans to address rising electricity costs.

  • "New Jerseyans shouldn't have to choose between keeping the lights on and putting food on the table," said a statement from the coalition, Mayors for Mikie. In its endorsement, the group highlighted stories of families struggling with the financial burden, including parents reducing meals and seniors cutting back on medications to afford utility payments.

  • Sherrill's campaign has positioned energy affordability as a central platform issue, promising action beginning on "Day One" of her potential administration.

  • Mayors for Mikie emphasized the urgency of addressing utility costs, describing the situation as affecting families' basic needs and quality of life.

Jersey Independent: Sherrill campaign pledges to stop rising electric bills in New Jersey

  • Energy prices are soaring in New Jersey, and Mikie Sherrill, the Democratic candidate for governor in 2025, has a plan to bring families some relief.

  • Sherrill said she’s prepared to step in. “On day one, I’m going to declare a state of emergency on utility costs,” she said, adding that she’ll freeze utility rates for a year.

Mikie is meeting with and talking to New Jerseyans in every corner of the state. Mikie is meeting with and talking to New Jerseyans in every corner of the state. 

New Jersey Monitor: NJ governor hopefuls make divergent pitches on campaign trail

  • Sherrill’s stops focused on economics. At businesses in Edison, Clarksboro, and Haddonfield, among others, she discussed the impact of the Trump administration’s tariffs on New Jersey businesses.

  • At Death of the Fox Brewing Company in Clarksboro, a craft brewery and coffee roastery, she noted how the tariffs on Brazil, a major exporter of coffee and beef to the United States, were affecting New Jersey businesses.

  • “The frustrating part for the business owner is these political fights. It’s not necessarily ‘here’s why’ or ‘here’s the targeted plan and here’s how it’s going to impact us,’” she said. “It’s all passed along to small businesses.”

  • The costs added by tariffs would soon be passed down to consumers, Sherrill warned.

  • “The thing I’ve been most concerned about — what I’ve been hearing from economists and now I’m hearing on the ground — is we’re going to start raising prices. We’re already in an affordability crisis, and worse is coming thanks to the federal government.”

Press of Atlantic City: ‘Atlantic City Won’t Be Left Behind’

  • “I promise you Atlantic City won’t be left behind in my administration,” Sherrill said. "I will take on anyone, including members of my own party, to move this state, this county and this city forward.”

  • Sherrill visited Seaview, A Dolce Resort, on Wednesday to meet with members of the Greater Atlantic City Chamber and provide insight into what policies she’ll champion for the region. It was one of several events she had scheduled in the county that day, including meet-and-greets with groups in Absecon and Ventnor.

  • “I learned in the Navy that you can either lead, follow or get out of the way,” Sherrill said. “I never flew missions with Democrats or Republicans. We all understood our mission was to serve the United States of America, and we were all able to work together to do just that. I think that’s what we need in New Jersey as we bring people together around our mission to better serve the people of New Jersey and fight for a different future than a lot of what we see coming from Washington, D.C.”

  • During her time in Congress, Sherrill's votes have affected South Jersey, helping local leaders secure $5 million in federal funding for Atlantic City International Airport through the 2021 infrastructure law. She also played a role in getting an additional $5 million for microtransit, a form of on-demand public transportation.

TAPinto: Mikie Sherrill Rallies Several Hundred Supporters in Asbury Park

  • Congresswoman Mikie Sherrill brought her campaign to Asbury Park late this afternoon, drawing several hundred people to a packed fundraiser and community gathering at Ada’s Gojjo, the Ethiopian and Dominican restaurant on Memorial Drive.

  • Drawing on her Navy background, Sherrill explained her philosophy of public service. “In the Navy, we have the saying, ship, shipmate, self. And what that means is it's never about yourself first. It's about other people, what you can do to serve, protect, and take care of others, and what you can do to lead other people,” she said.

  • Sherrill pledged to declare a state of emergency on energy utility costs, reduce prices that make it difficult for families and seniors to remain in New Jersey, and expand educational opportunities for children. She also stressed the need to push back against political attacks from both Washington and her Republican opponent.

News India Times: “Sherrill emphasized her commitment to ensuring that small businesses thrive by reducing costs, streamlining processes, and fighting against tariffs and policies she argues burden New Jersey families and entrepreneurs.”

Americano Newspaper: “Mikie is committed to including the Mexican-American community in her administration and helping minority-owned businesses grow and thrive, by expanding access to state contracts, reducing the permitting delays and fees that businesses face, and boosting support and investment from the NJ Economic Development Authority.”

Quadratín Hispano: “Mikie Sherrill se reunió con la Cámara de Comercio de México para hablar sobre su plan para apoyar a las empresas de propiedad latina, fortalecer las relaciones económicas entre Nueva Jersey y Latinoamérica, y proteger a nuestro estado del caótico régimen arancelario de Trump, uno de los mayores aumentos de impuestos a los estadounidenses en la historia.”

Asbury Park Press [Opinion | Amy Quinn]: Mikie Sherrill supports Asbury Park — and I support her run for NJ governor

  • [Mikie is] the kind of public official who gives equal attention to a senior resident of Asbury Tower and to a mayor. That’s the mindset we need at all levels of our democracy. 

  • The next governor of our great state will face conflicts and competing interests we cannot imagine in advance. 

  • My support for Sherrill is not only for her positions on specific issues, but because she’s the person I trust — the kind of person I trust — to cut through the noise and do the right thing day after day after day.


In contrast, “100% MAGA” Jack’s low energy campaign is focused on cozying up to Trump and MAGA extremists. Take a look for yourself… 

Jack at a fundraiser at Trump National Golf Club Philadelphia: “And it's great to have the President's active involvement. He and I spoke last week, we'll be together again over the Labor Day weekend, and we're gonna work with the President and the White House in every way that we can, and I'm so very grateful for his active involvement."

New Jersey Monitor: “Ciattarelli, the GOP’s nominee for the second consecutive gubernatorial cycle, spoke at a Moms for Liberty Rally in Jersey City.”

New Jersey 101.5: MAGA Struggles as Independent Voters Shift Away from Trump

  • An FDU poll found Trump's approval rating in New Jersey was plummeting…

  • Ciattarelli worked hard to secure Donald Trump's endorsement in the GOP primary…

  • However, with the edge Democrats still hold among registered voters, Ciattarelli will have to appeal to independent/unaffiliated voters to overcome that obstacle.

  • So far, he is failing to do so.

  • The trends show Jack Ciattarelli is lagging in nearly every demographic, ethnic population and geographic location. He even appears to lag among the critical independent voting block.

TLDR: Jack is leaving communities behind, while Mikie is leading the way.

New Jersey 101.5: "You've got a Democratic candidate that is holding press gaggles. That's holding press conferences. That's meeting with constituents with the cameras on. I don't see that from the Republican candidate."

###

data.title: ICYMI: “Jack Ciattarelli is Facing Questions Over His Failure to Release His Tax Returns”
data.description:
What’s Jack hiding?

BLOOMFIELD — It’s been 3,067 days since Jack Ciattarelli released his taxes as he is “facing questions over his failure to release his tax returns.” What’s Jack hiding?

While Mikie has gone above and beyond by releasing “exact values of her finances,” a “greater level of transparency and detail than what [she] is required by law to make public,” and two years of both state and federal tax returns, Jack has refused to release his tax returns for nearly ten years — making him the only gubernatorial candidate in the general election in over two decades to not do so.

Here’s the little bit we do know about Jack’s finances:

  • “…A 2021 NJ.com story about a medical continuing education publishing company, Galen Publishing, that Ciattarelli owned and from which he had income that was disclosed on his most recent publicly released tax returns, for 2017, the year he sold the company.”

  • “NJ.com reported that some of the materials published by Galen appeared to downplay the dangers of opioids.”

  • “In one paper, an author wrote: ‘Concerns about opioid dependence, addiction, or non-medical use often create barriers to effective pain management … The risk of opioid misuse is low among patients with chronic pain who do not have preexisting substance use disorders.’”

  • Jack has not had a job since 2017 and has been running for governor since 2016.

Take a look:

New Jersey Independent: Ciattarelli still hasn’t released his tax returns

  • Republican gubernatorial candidate Jack Ciattarelli is facing questions over his failure to release his tax returns.

  • …He did not release state or federal returns during his 2021 campaign for the job and hasn’t in his current campaign, according to reporting from Philly’s Voice in May.

  • He said he would release his returns this year, but gave no timeline, according to Philly Voice. According to a press release issued by Democratic nominee Mikie Sherrill’s campaign on Sept. 12, he has not released them.

  • Sherrill called on Ciattarelli to “follow her example” and release his tax returns and other details of his finances, as she has done.

  • “Transparency and accountability are important — I’m not afraid of it,” Sherrill said in the press release. “I think Jack is, since he refuses to release his tax returns or any information about the millions he made profiting off the opioid epidemic.”

  • The press release includes a link to a 2021 NJ.com story about a medical continuing education publishing company, Galen Publishing, that Ciattarelli owned and from which he had income that was disclosed on his most recent publicly released tax returns, for 2017, the year he sold the company.

  • NJ.com reported that some of the materials published by Galen appeared to downplay the dangers of opioids. In one paper, an author wrote: “Misuse or diversion of pain relievers is a significant problem, especially among adolescents and young adults. Concerns about opioid dependence, addiction, or non-medical use often create barriers to effective pain management … The risk of opioid misuse is low among patients with chronic pain who do not have preexisting substance use disorders.”

  • As of the May article in Philly Voice, Ciattarelli had disclosed to the New Jersey Election Law Enforcement Commission holdings of municipal bonds, dividends from Microsoft, as well as some investment income received by his wife, though he said they separated in 2023. He reported no salary in 2024.

  • Sherrill, on the other hand, has released the exact values of her holdings, according to the New Jersey Globe.

  • Sherrill currently owns no stocks: She sold all of her stock in 2020, a year after she took office, and converted her investments into pooled exchange-traded funds to avoid conflicts of interest.

  • “Congresswoman Sherrill has smartly decided there’s only one way to avoid the inherent conflict of interest in making decisions that affect individual stock values, which is to not buy and sell individual stocks,” Micah Rasmussen, the director of the Rebovich Institute for New Jersey Politics at Rider University, told the New Jersey Globe in 2020.

  • The Ciattarelli campaign did not immediately return a request for comment for this story.

Politico: Sherrill pushes Ciattarelli to release taxes in transparency rollout

  • Rep. Mikie Sherrill is upping pressure on her Republican opponent to release his tax returns, calling on him to do so at a press conference aimed at transparency in state government.

  • "The people of New Jersey deserve to know,” said Sherrill, who has released two years of her tax returns.

data.title: New Jersey State Council of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers (SMART) Endorses Mikie Sherrill
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, the New Jersey State Council of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers (SMART), part of one of the nation’s most dynamic and effective labor unions, announced that they are supporting Mikie Sherrill for Governor. The New Jersey State Council of SMART represents five local unions totaling over 10,000 workers across New Jersey.

“The New Jersey State Council of SMART — 10,000 strong across the state in key industries from construction to transportation and more — enthusiastically endorses Mikie Sherrill as she runs to be our next governor. We need a leader in Trenton who will be a steadfast advocate for unions and who understands the need to build the highly skilled workforce of the future right here in New Jersey. Mikie has a strong track record of standing up for organized labor while investing in the kind of apprenticeship programs and infrastructure investments that we need to build the next generation of workers and to power our economy. We know she will bring that same focus and commitment to the state house as governor,” said Joseph Demark, Jr., President of the New Jersey State Council of SMART.

“I’m proud to earn the endorsement of the New Jersey State Council of SMART. As the proud granddaughter of a union worker, I know just how important our unions are to building opportunities for working families. As governor, I’ll work alongside the New Jersey State Council of SMART to expand apprenticeship programs, protect collective bargaining rights, and fight for fair wages and working conditions,” said Mikie Sherrill.

SMART, the International Association of Sheet Metal, Air, Rail and Transportation Workers, is one of North America’s most dynamic and diverse unions with 230,000 members. SMART’s members produce and provide the vital services that move products to market, passengers to their destinations and ensure the quality of the air we breathe. We are sheet metal workers, service technicians, bus operators, engineers, conductors, sign workers, welders, production employees and more. With members in scores of different occupations, we advocate for fairness in the workplace, excellence at work and opportunity for all working families.

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Wins Big in Essex County
data.description:
CALDWELL — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement today after winning the Essex County Democratic Convention, garnering more than 60 percent of the vote with two other candidates competing from Essex:

“We’ve had a lot of great wins so far, and it’s so special to cap it off with a big win in Essex County — this is home and where we’re raising our family. Essex Dems have had my back since 2018, when we flipped a Trump district and got to work delivering for our communities. We have an opportunity to do that again for the entire state this November. To say enough is enough to Trump and Musk, and stop Jack Ciattarelli or Bill Spadea from bringing that chaos to Trenton. As governor, I’ll deliver for Essex residents — from Newark to North Caldwell and everywhere in between. I will bring a different kind of leadership to Trenton — relentlessly focused on lowering costs for working people, and defending New Jersey during this unprecedented attack on our state.”

Mikie has won convention victories in Hunterdon, Mercer, Monmouth, Sussex, Middlesex, and Morris. She was the top vote-getter in Ocean County, earning twice as many votes as her nearest competitor. Mikie has also earned endorsements from Passaic, Union, and Hudson Counties.

data.title: NRDC Action Fund Endorses Sherrill for NJ Governor
data.description:
WASHINGTON – The NRDC Action Fund, a leading national environmental organization, today announced its endorsement of Mikie Sherrill for governor of New Jersey. In Congress, Sherrill delivered results for the state by securing funding to make communities more flood resilient, replace lead water pipes, address pollution, and protect open spaces. As governor, she has a bold plan to lower utility costs and invest in clean, cheap power generation while holding PJM, the regional grid operator, accountable for mismanagement. Her opponent, Jack Ciattarelli, dismisses PJM’s role in creating the current energy affordability crises and supports President Trump’s repeal of clean energy generation incentives. 
 

“Mikie Sherrill will tackle rising electric bills for New Jersey families by rapidly expanding cleaner, cheaper energy sources and creating the good-paying jobs that come with them,” said Manish Bapna, president and CEO of the NRDC Action Fund. “She will fight to clean up polluted land, water, and air across the Garden State. We’re proud to stand with Mikie Sherrill, who has shown she can work across the aisle to get things done.” 
 

“I am honored to have the support of the NRDC Action Fund as we build the largest possible coalition to win in November. New Jerseyans are struggling to keep up with out-of-control energy costs. That’s why on Day One, I am declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs. I’ll also significantly build out cleaner and cheaper power generation, such as solar and battery storage, to bring families’ costs down. PJM, our grid operator, has been jacking up costs and refusing to connect power to the grid. I’ll take them to court to ensure New Jerseyans aren’t paying for their mismanagement. And I’ll stand up to anyone — from our grid operator and the utility companies to Trump — to solve our energy crisis and put money back into New Jerseyans’ pockets,” said Mikie Sherrill.  
 

Sherrill’s record in Congress includes championing the permanent reauthorization and full funding of the Land and Water Conservation Fund, which has preserved treasured New Jersey landscapes such as the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge, Loantaka Brook Reservation, and the Highlands forests. She has also led on major flood mitigation projects like the Peckman River Army Corps initiative and improvements under the Water Resources Development Act, strengthening North Jersey’s defenses against extreme weather. In addition, she secured funding to replace lead service lines, clean up PFAS contamination in Hopatcong, and upgrade water mains in Stanhope—delivering cleaner water and healthier communities across the state. 
 
About the NRDC Action Fund 
 

The NRDC Action Fund is the advocacy partner of the Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC), but the two organizations’ names may not be used interchangeably. Apart from NRDC, the Action Fund engages in elections to grow a pro-environment majority among elected officials in government. News and information released by the NRDC Action Fund should be identified as from the “NRDC Action Fund,” and not from NRDC. Learn more at www.nrdcactionfund.org.

data.title: NEW REPORTING: Jack Campaigns with Conspiracy Theorists Who Spread Dangerous Lies that the “COVID-19 Vaccine Could Make People Magnetic”
data.description:
Jack: “I would never mandate a vaccine.”

BLOOMFIELD — New Philadelphia Inquirer reporting shines a light on Jack Ciattarelli who is being “honored at an event featuring an anti-vaccine conspiracy theorist” “known nationally for peddling conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 vaccine.”

Jack has a long, dangerous anti-vaccine record. Jack has said multiple times, including last week and this week, that he’d “never mandate a vaccine” — blatantly ignoring the advice of doctors and trusted medical professionals and instead signing onto debunked theories from fringe activists and conspiracy theorists.

“As a mom of four, I know how scary it is to take care of a sick kid, and I am appalled that Jack is taking his cues from fringe activists, conspiracy theorists, and the likes of Donald Trump and RFK, Jr. whose extreme policies will result in reduced access to vaccines and more of our children catching preventable illnesses. People are getting sick because of politicians like Jack who campaign with anti-vaxxers and spread dangerous lies about our public health, and it's clear we can't trust him to keep New Jersey kids safe and healthy,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Here’s what you need to know:

  • “Ciattarelli has appealed to so-called medical freedom and parental rights groups that oppose vaccine requirements for students going to public school.”

  • Jack is scheduled to be a distinguished guest at an anti-vaccine gala tonight alongside keynote speaker Sherri Tenpenny, who is “known nationally for peddling conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 vaccine” and “told legislators in Ohio in 2021 that the COVID-19 vaccine could make people magnetic and suggested that vaccines interact with 5G towers — both unfounded claims.”

  • Tenpenny “was listed as one of 12 anti-vaccine activists responsible for almost two-thirds of anti-vaccine content on social media that year.”

  • Jack’s presence at the gala is also being advertised alongside Mary Holland, CEO of a RFK Jr. nonprofit, who “compared mandated vaccines to slavery. The group hosting the gala calls her a ‘courageous health freedom leader.’”

This isn’t the first time Jack has cozied up to right-wing extremists. Last month, Jack hit the campaign trail with January 6 rioters and Moms for Liberty, an extremist group that “defam[es] educators as groomers and opponent parents as pedophiles.”

Read more: 

Philadelphia Inquirer: Jack Ciattarelli scheduled to be a ‘distinguished guest’ alongside anti-vaccine conspiracy theorist

  • Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican nominee for New Jersey governor, is scheduled to be honored at an event featuring an anti-vaccine conspiracy theorist on Thursday…

  • …His face is still plastered on online fliers alongside anti-vaccine activists for the NJ Public Health Innovation PAC Gala at the Gramercy at Lakeside Manor in Hazlet.

  • The candidate is advertised as a “distinguished guest” and the keynote speaker is Sherri Tenpenny, a doctor known nationally for peddling conspiracy theories about the COVID-19 vaccine.

  • “His presence at this year’s Gala underscores the growing recognition that health freedom, informed consent, and parental rights must be front and center in New Jersey’s future,” NJPHI PAC posted on Facebook about Ciattarelli. “As our state heads into a pivotal election, Jack’s participation is a powerful signal that these issues matter at the highest levels of leadership.”

  • Ciattarelli has appealed to so-called medical freedom and parental rights groups that oppose vaccine requirements for students going to public school. 

  • [At the debate…] Sherrill argued that children are dying of curable diseases “because we are not appropriately following medical research vaccine protocol” and said she would be part of the new Northeast Public Health Collaborative, in which governors from states including New Jersey and Pennsylvania are working together on public health policy in light of Robert F. Kennedy Jr., President Donald Trump’s secretary of health and human services, dismantling federal vaccine recommendations.

  • Ciattarelli’s presence at the gala is advertised alongside Tenpenny and Jamel Holley, Leah Wilson, and Mary Holland.

  • Tenpenny, the keynote speaker, told legislators in Ohio in 2021 that the COVID-19 vaccine could make people magnetic and suggested that vaccines interact with 5G towers — both unfounded claims. She was listed as one of 12 anti-vaccine activists responsible for almost two-thirds of anti-vaccine content on social media that year by the Center for Countering Digital Hate, which called them the Disinformation Dozen.

  • She sold online education courses that said social distancing had no use in a pandemic and mask-wearing policies are a type of “mind control,” Business Insider reported.

  • Holland, CEO of Kennedy’s nonprofit Children’s Health Defense, claimed in an interview with Politico that mumps, measles, and rubella are not particularly dangerous to children, contrary to extensive medical evidence. On Steve Bannon’s War Room, Holland compared mandated vaccines to slavery. The group hosting the gala calls her a “courageous health freedom leader.”

  • Wilson, a lawyer, became an outspoken opponent of vaccine mandates after she was told she could not foster children because her biological children were not vaccinated. The PAC calls her a “Health Freedom Warrior.”

  • Holley, a former Democratic Assembly member from Union County, was described by Politico in 2020 as “New Jersey Democrats‘ most high profile anti-vaccination activist.” The gala organization calls him “a powerful voice for the MAHA movement.” 

  • Sherrill said in a statement that she is “appalled that Jack is taking his cues from fringe activists, conspiracy theorists, and the likes of Donald Trump and RFK, Jr. whose extreme policies will result in reduced access to vaccines and more of our children catching preventable illnesses.”

  • “People are getting sick because of politicians like Jack who campaign with anti-vaxxers and spread dangerous lies about our public health, and it’s clear we can’t trust him to keep our kids safe and healthy,” she added.

  • “As Governor, he will oppose a one-size-fits-all vaccination schedule, support medical and religious exemptions for vaccines, and create a parental rights ombudsman in state government to give parents more of a voice on key issues, including those seeking a philosophical vaccine exemption,” [Ciattarelli spokesperson Eric] Arpert said.

  • The subject of vaccines is becoming increasingly important for state leaders while the federal government changes long-held stances on vaccinations and shifts under the guidance of Kennedy, who has leaned on unsubstantiated and debunked theories.

  • …Trump claimed without definitive scientific proof that using the pain reliever during pregnancy is dangerous, a contention that scientists have debunked.

See also: Philadelphia Inquirer: Why Jack Ciattarelli is rallying with MAGA influencer Scott Presler at the Jersey Shore, New Jersey Monitor: NJ governor hopefuls make divergent pitches on campaign trail

data.title: Violación a la ley: La Administración Trump divulga ilegalmente los registros militares no redactados de Mikie Sherrill
data.description:
La campaña de Sherrill exige a Ciattarelli y a la Administración Trump detener la utilización y distribución de registros divulgados ilegalmente

BLOOMFIELD — La candidata demócrata a la gobernación, Mikie Sherrill, emitió la siguiente declaración después de que la Administración Trump divulgó ilegalmente su expediente oficial de servicio militar (OMPF) a Nicholas De Gregorio, un operador de la campaña de Jack Ciattarelli bajo la dirección de su estratega principal, Chris Russell. De Gregorio no solo estaba en la lista corta para ser Vicegobernador de Ciattarelli, sino que además es uno de los principales donantes del candidato republicano.

La Administración Trump violó de manera flagrante la ley federal al entregar los registros militares personales no redactados, de Mikie Sherrill, a la campaña de Ciattarelli, que luego los usó como arma política. Esta es una filtración alarmante y peligrosa que debe investigarse a fondo. Con este acto, la Administración Trump y la campaña de Jack Ciattarelli demuestran que están dispuestos a atacar la vida privada de cualquier persona, incluso de quienes han servido a nuestro país, con tal de ganar poder. Estamos exigiendo a Jack Ciattarelli y a la Administración Trump que detengan inmediatamente la distribución ilegal de los archivos militares de Mikie Sherrill, los cuales contienen información altamente sensible como su número de Seguro Social. Esto no solo le afecta a ella: abre la puerta a que cualquier ciudadano o veterano vea su información personal utilizada de manera política y sin protección legal. Este acto es una falta de respeto al servicio de todos los veteranos, pone en riesgo la seguridad de sus datos y muestra que Jack Ciattarelli hará lo que sea con tal de ser elegido, aunque eso signifique romper la ley y traicionar la confianza del público. Y eso debería preocuparnos a todos en Nueva Jersey,” expresó Sean Higgins, Director de Comunicaciones de Mikie Sherrill para Gobernadora.

Mikie Sherrill recibió esta carta de los Archivos Nacionales notificándole sobre la divulgación ilegal de su expediente oficial de personal militar OMPF.

El equipo legal de Mikie Sherrill para Gobernadora ha enviado cartas de demanda contundentes a los Archivos Nacionales, a la campaña de Ciattarelli, a su estratega principal Chris Russell y a Nicholas De Gregorio, dejando en claro que estas violaciones no quedarán impunes. Si persisten en esta conducta ilegal y deshonrosa, se enfrentarán no sólo a las consecuencias legales, sino también al juicio político de los votantes de Nueva Jersey, quienes no tolerarán ataques tan sucios y peligrosos. 

###

data.title: Craig Sicknick and Harry Dunn Endorse Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, Craig Sicknick and Harry Dunn endorsed Mikie Sherrill for governor, citing the need for a strong Democratic governor to stand up to attacks from Trump’s Washington. Sicknick, a native of Middlesex County, is the brother of fallen Capitol Police Officer Brian Sicknick, who died on January 7, 2021, after being attacked at the January 6 insurrection. Dunn is a retired Capitol Police Officer who also was attacked by rioters and testified before the House January 6 Committee. 

“I wasn’t too involved in politics before January 6, 2021, but I’m doing everything I can to honor the life of my brother, Brian. Now, President Trump just pardoned those who attacked my brother and took his life — a gut punch not only to my family and other Capitol Police officers, but also to the rule of law. With an unchecked Donald Trump about to take office for another term, I know we need a governor with the backbone to stand up for New Jersey and our values, and that’s Mikie Sherrill,” said Craig Sicknick. “Mikie is somebody that is unafraid to speak truth to power — and her loyalty has always been to country and Constitution. Mikie has the integrity, vision, and courage to guide New Jersey through these next few years and I’m proud to support her in the Democratic Primary. 

“Mikie Sherrill is a leader who stands for the values that unite us as Americans — a veteran who has served our country in uniform — and I hope you will join me in supporting her campaign for governor,” said Harry Dunn. “Mikie believes in accountability, transparency, and ultimately delivering for people, because that’s what public service is about. With the lawlessness already coming from Trump’s Washington, we need to rise to this moment as a country and it’s on us to elect strong Democratic governors like Mikie who will be on the front lines protecting our rights and freedoms.”

Click here to read Mikie’s statement on the pardons for January 6 rioters. 

##

data.title: OUT OF TOUCH: Jack Ciattarelli Praises High Utility Costs as a “Big Help” to His Campaign
data.description:
New Jerseyans are struggling with sky-high utility costs. Career politician Jack Ciattarelli thinks it’s a “big help” politically.

BLOOMFIELD — Jack Ciattarelli is celebrating the out-of-control utility costs that are crushing New Jersey families, saying it’s a “big help” to his campaign.

Mikie Sherrill is the only candidate in this race with a plan to end the utility rate hikes and lower costs by declaring a State of Emergency on Utility Costs on Day One. But Jack is only in this race for himself, even when it costs New Jerseyans.

“It is appalling that Jack Ciattarelli is celebrating the fact that Garden State families are being crushed by sky-high utility costs. I’ll take on anyone to lower energy bills and make life more affordable for families. Jack supports Trump’s bill that will raise utility costs by hundreds of dollars, making New Jerseyans foot the bill,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Transcript:

Fox Business Host: “This past spring, there was a 17% rate increase that was passed. How much is that helping you?”

Jack Ciattarelli: “It's a big help.”

See also:

  • NJ.com: Mikie Sherrill vows to freeze N.J. energy prices amid alarming rate hikes

  • NJBIZ: Sherrill unveils energy plan to cut NJ utility costs 

  • New Jersey Globe: Sherrill says she’ll freeze utility bills in first year as governor

  • NorthJersey.com: Mikie Sherrill is right. NJ must declare an emergency on utility costs | Opinion by Evelyn Liebman

data.title: WATCH: Mikie Sherrill Joins Local Independent Pharmacist to Outline Plan to Stand Up to the Middlemen Increasing Drug Costs for New Jerseyans
data.description:
CHATHAM — Mikie Sherrill released a new video today explaining how Pharmacy Benefit Managers (PBMs) are ripping New Jerseyans off, and outlining her Affordability Agenda, which includes a plan to stand up to PBMs as governor. In the video, Mikie speaks with Amit Sikka at Liberty Drug & Surgery Pharmacy in Chatham. Mikie and Amit outline how Pharmacy Benefit Managers raise the price of prescription medications for consumers while driving local neighborhood pharmacies out of business.

“As governor, I am going to be totally focused on driving down costs for the people of New Jersey, and ensuring no family goes bankrupt simply for trying to access high-quality health care. I’ll hold PBMs accountable for achieving cost savings for consumers, not lining their own pockets, making sure they’re not directing consumers towards those more expensive drugs that are driving up their costs,” said Mikie Sherrill.

“These companies are all profit-driven. We want to drive costs down, they want to increase their profits, so something’s got to give. So in the end, two groups get squeezed, it’s us, the independent pharmacy, and also the customer who wants the medication [...] what PBMs want to do is dispense the brand-name medication, which increase costs for the overall system and costs for the customer as well,” said Amit Sikka in the video.

data.title: New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
The New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades is honored to announce our formal endorsement for Mikie Sherrill for Governor," stated Shaun Sullivan, President of the New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades. "Mikie is a proven fighter who consistently stands up for the working men and women of New Jersey. Her dedication to service and unwavering commitment to our constituents make her the ideal choice to lead our state."

Congresswoman Sherrill’s distinguished career reflects a profound commitment to protecting the freedoms and way of life for all Americans. As a helicopter pilot during wartime in the United States Navy, she demonstrated exceptional strength and dedication to our nation.

Since her election to the United States Congress in 2018, representing the 11th district, Congresswoman Sherrill has consistently championed the rights and needs of hard working individuals and union members. She has earned the prestigious "gold standard" of a 100% pro-union voting record in Congress, a testament to her steadfast support.

"Mikie has never turned her back on us, and as a union leader, I will not turn my back on her," President Sullivan continued. "She has earned our support, and the New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades is 100% united behind the endorsement of Mikie Sherrill for Governor."

In a time of significant division, the need for labor to unite behind a strong leader like Mikie Sherrill has never been more crucial. The New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades is proud to confirm that it’s local unions stand in full solidarity with this endorsement. This includes:

Steamfitters Local 475
Plumbers Local 24
Pipefitters Local 274                                
Sprinklerfitters Local 696
Plumbers and Pipefitters Local 322      
Sprinklerfitters Local 692
Plumbers and Pipefitters Local 9           
Sprinklerfitters Local 669
Gas and Utility Workers Local 855

Mikie Sherrill has always stood up and fought for us. Now it’s time we fight for her. The New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades looks forward to actively supporting Mikie Sherrill’s campaign as she seeks to become the next Governor of the great state of New Jersey.

The New Jersey State Association of Pipe Trades represents over 11,000 men and women in all aspects of the piping industry.

Shaun Sullivan is President of the NJ Pipe Trades  ssullivan@ualocal475.org

data.title: Transparency and Accountability
data.description:
New Jersey families work hard for every dollar they earn. But when those dollars are sent to Trenton, taxpayers are all too often left in the dark about how their money is being spent. This lack of transparency weakens public trust and allows waste and inefficiency to go unchecked. Families are expected to manage their household budgets responsibly. It is only fair to demand that the government should do the same.

That’s why, as governor, I’ll launch a first-of-its-kind online “Report Card” where New Jerseyans can track state contracts and grants in plain language. You’ll see where the money goes, what it’s supposed to deliver, and whether it actually does.

The Report Card will provide key information on state programs — what they cost and what they do. State contracts will be posted online, with plain-language updates on whether taxpayers received what they paid for. Just as importantly, this plan will measure outcomes — not just dollars spent. It is time for programs to be evaluated to determine if they actually deliver results for New Jersey families.

This plan has one goal: to make Trenton answer to the people who pay the bills. It builds trust, cuts waste, and makes clear that every dollar must be spent wisely, saving money for taxpayers.
