data.title: What They’re Saying: Illegally Leaked Records are “Blatant Abuse of Power,” Jack Ciattarelli “Has No Respect for Veterans” and “Should Be Ashamed”
data.description:
Senator Andy Kim: “This blatant illegal partisan attack against [Mikie] is an affront to everyone who has worn the uniform.”

BLOOMFIELD — Following the bombshell CBS News report of the illegal weaponization of the National Archives against Mikie Sherrill by the Trump administration and the Jack Ciattarelli campaign, veterans, New Jerseyans, and elected officials — both Republican and Democrat — are speaking out about the “egregious” and “disgusting abuse of power” that is a “weaponization of the National Archives” and “an attack on veterans, their privacy, and the rule of law.”

Washington Post staff writer Meryl Kornfield points out the difference in what was and wasn’t redacted in the file:

  • “Not redacted: Sherrill's Social Security number, home addresses for her and her parents, life insurance information, performance evaluations and the NDA she signed for classified info”

  • “What was redacted: the Social Security numbers of her former superiors”

Veterans across the country and across the aisle are sounding the alarm:

  • Navy veteran Mike Embrich: “Jack should be ashamed of himself.”

  • Former New York Congressman and Army veteran Max Rose: “Jack Ciattarelli — like Donald Trump — has no respect for veterans and no regard for our military.”

  • New York Congressman and Army veteran Pat Ryan: “Leaking a veteran's private information, including their Social Security Number, for political gain is a disgusting abuse of power. Mikie Sherrill is a Patriot. Jack Ciattarelli and his allies are a bunch of hacks.”

Here’s what New Jerseyans are watching and reading:

WATCH: MSNBC

WATCH: ABC 7


WATCH: ABC 7


Former U.S. Secretary of Transportation and Navy veteran Pete Buttigieg: “No veteran should have their social security number leaked, let alone passed to a political opponent by the government. The Trump administration owes Mikie Sherrill, and all Americans, an explanation of the breach of her personal data, and it must be investigated so something like this cannot happen again.”

Arizona Senator and Marine Corps veteran Ruben Gallego: “This isn’t politics as usual. It’s a blatant abuse of power. Mikie served our nation with distinction and honor for nearly a decade. This is an attack on veterans, their privacy, and the rule of law.”

Nebraska Congressman and Air Force veteran Don Bacon: “My personal military records along with several other GOP AF vets were illegally released to the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee in 2022. The behavior was wrong then & it's wrong now. The military must do better to protect veterans’ privacy.”

Former Illinois Congressman and Air National Guard veteran Adam Kinzinger: “Insane.”

Michigan Senator Elissa Slotkin: “Leaking confidential info to politically weaponize Mikie Sherrill’s long record of service to her country is below the belt, and publishing her personal info should be completely off-limits. No matter your political persuasion, most Americans are sick of this nasty, zero-sum politics from candidates like Jack Ciattarelli.”

Maryland Congressman Jamie Raskin: “Trump’s illegally releasing veterans’ personal records from government files for partisan reasons. This is a total outrage and a scandal. Release the Epstein files, leave the great patriot Mikie Sherrill alone and keep the federal government out of partisan campaigns.”

California Governor Gavin Newsom: “The Trump administration has ILLEGALLY released the private military records of the Democratic nominee for NJ Governor, Mikie Sherrill. They cheat, lie, and rig because they know they are going to LOSE. We have to keep calling it out.”

Kansas Governor Laura Kelly: “This Administration’s decision to illegally release Mikie Sherrill’s unredacted military records in order to attack a political opponent is deeply disturbing and dangerous. Every veteran, every branch of our armed forces, every American, should be outraged.”

Former Virginia Congresswoman Abigail Spanberger: “My friend Mikie Sherrill proudly served our country. Her military service should be honored — not questioned and certainly not weaponized. The Trump Administration's breach of privacy is a slap in the face to our nation's brave servicemembers. It's shameful.”

Illinois Congressman Sean Casten: “This disrespects all of our veterans who served their country without political favor. Who sacrificed. And who expected in return that they would be treated with dignity by all future Presidents, not just the ones they politically agree with.”

Texas Congresswoman Veronica Escobar: “This is the least transparent administration in recent memory - even illegally withholding information from members of congress. But when it suits their political agenda, they release more than what’s legal. Stay strong Mikie Sherrill. Millions are cheering you on.”

Pennsylvania state Representative Malcolm Kenyatta: “This illegal doxxing of Mikie Sherrill is yet another case of the blatant corruption all too common in this shit show of an administration. She has more ethics and patriotism in her pinky than her opponent, who serves only one man — SAD!”

Former South Carolina House of Representatives member Bakari Sellers: “Trump Administration broke the law and gave Mikie Sherrill’s opponent her social security number, life insurance info, parents info then Jack Ciattarelli distributed it after being told not to. This is wild.”

data.title: Jack Ciattarelli’s Biggest Donor was Sued for Jacking Up Rents on New Jerseyans
data.description:
Gothamist: “Ciattarelli’s ties to the Kurtz family could be seen as being at odds with the interests of New Jersey’s roughly 1.2 million renter households.”

BLOOMFIELD — Reporting from the Gothamist shines a light on how Jack Ciattarelli’s largest donor was sued for using an algorithm to jack up rents for thousands of tenants across the state as Jack refuses to do anything to lower skyrocketing rental prices.

The story notes that Jack’s ties to his largest donor, the Kurtz family and its company the Kamson Corporation “could be seen as being at odds with the interests of New Jersey’s roughly 1.2 million renter households,” as “Kamson has also faced fines from state regulators over a slew of building violations at one of its apartment complexes in South Jersey where two small children were killed in a fire in 2023.”

In contrast, Mikie “has pledged to crack down on negligent landlords and the type of rent increases identified in the attorney general’s lawsuit.” Rider University's Rebovich Institute for New Jersey Politics director Micah Rasmussen sums it up — “if one candidate is addressing these marketplace failures and the need to fix the rental marketplace and one candidate isn't, then you need to take note of that as a voter. And you also need to ask yourself why.”

“Jack Ciattarelli’s biggest donor was sued for using an algorithm to jack up rents on New Jerseyans across the state. And we're really supposed to believe he's going to make rent more affordable? Get real,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Read more: 

Gothamist: Real estate donations to Ciattarelli place rising rents at center of NJ governor’s race

  • It was a simple question, but the answer was revealing.

  • During Sunday’s debate between the two candidates vying to become New Jersey’s next governor, an audience member stood up and asked how they planned to lower skyrocketing rental prices.

  • Democratic nominee Mikie Sherrill went on the attack. And her response has drawn attention to a wealthy real estate family that’s poured hundreds of thousands of dollars into backing Republican nominee Jack Ciattarelli and how the family’s company has used a price-setting algorithm to determine rents for thousands of tenants across the state.

  • “We know Jack's not going to do anything about it because one of his biggest donors is actually being taken to court and sued on this very issue,” Sherrill said on the debate stage.

  • Although she didn’t mention the donor by name, she was referring to the Kurtz family and its company, the Kamson Corporation, which owns and operates over 10,000 apartments in New Jersey. The company is one of 10 real-estate firms — along with the software business RealPage Inc. — that state Attorney General Matthew Platkin likened to a cartel. In a lawsuit his office filed in April, it argues that the companies’ use of RealPage’s algorithm amounts to collusion in driving up rent prices, though they are contesting the accusation.

  • The Kurtzes are among Ciattarelli’s biggest donors. Family members have donated more than $750,000 to Ciattarelli’s multiple bids for the governor’s office since 2021, according to campaign contribution data reviewed by Gothamist, including a $200,000 contribution to a political action committee in June that’s running attack ads against Sherrill.

  • Affordability issues are at the center of what is becoming a tight race for governor, and political experts said Ciattarelli’s ties to the Kurtz family could be seen as being at odds with the interests of New Jersey’s roughly 1.2 million renter households. Kamson has also faced fines from state regulators over a slew of building violations at one of its apartment complexes in South Jersey where two small children were killed in a fire in 2023.

  • …Sherrill has pledged to crack down on negligent landlords and the type of rent increases identified in the attorney general’s lawsuit.

  • Micah Rasmussen, director of Rider University's Rebovich Institute for New Jersey Politics who formerly served as a press secretary for Gov. Jim McGreevey, said her stance shows a willingness to tackle concerns about possible collusion in the rental market head on.

  • “If one candidate is addressing these marketplace failures and the need to fix the rental marketplace and one candidate isn't, then you need to take note of that as a voter. And you also need to ask yourself why,” Rasmussen told Gothamist. He was a panelist in Sunday’s debate.

  • Ciattarelli’s campaign did not respond to a request for comment on the family’s donations.

  • A long list of donations

  • Richard Kurtz, the family’s 85-year-old billionaire patriarch who once sold New Jersey’s most expensive home, founded Kamson in the 1970s. He and his son Jeff now run the company, which owns large apartment complexes across the state, including a 699-unit development in Blackwood, New Jersey and multiple complexes in towns such as Clifton, Piscataway and Lumberton that contain 300 to 400 dwellings.

  • The elder Kurtz has personally donated $4,900 to Ciattarelli since 2021, the cap on individual donations at that time. Records show he also donated $250,000 to the conservative political action committee Kitchen Table Conservatives, which is backing Ciattarelli.

  • In 2022, Politico reported that Kurtz was behind another pro-Ciattarelli political action committee, Garden State Rescue. Records show Kurtz injected $487,500 into the group in 2021.

  • Jeff Kurtz has donated $16,500 to Ciattarelli since 2021. Records show his wife Sharon also donated $5,800 to Ciattarelli in 2024, the maximum allowed that year.

  • The family has also donated $25,600 to Democratic NJ Rep. Josh Gottheimer since 2021, according to campaign finance data.

  • Matt Hale, associate professor of political science at Seton Hall University, said that, while it’s normal for politicians to have big donors, voters could be turned off by Ciattarelli's connection to the Kurtzes, given the allegations against them.

  • “One of the ways that you judge a candidate is by the company they keep. I think that that one way voters look at it as [he’s] buddies with rich people that aren't me. And I don't know that that's a great message,” he said.

  • In total, Ciattarelli’s campaign alone has received over $250,000 from real-estate industry donors in this year’s gubernatorial campaign. Industry advocacy groups that have also received donations from the Kurtzes have fought statewide legislation that would ban the use of rent setting algorithms like those offered by RealPage. They’ve also lobbied against rent-control measures.

  • The three-alarm fire that killed two small children in May 2023 damaged more than a dozen apartments at the Kamson Corporation’s 1,492-unit Fox Meadow complex in Maple Shade, New Jersey.

  • A year after the fire, the state’s Department of Community Affairs conducted a five-year routine inspection of the Fox Meadow property in October 2024. The agency’s report found 1,044 violations. These included 287 marked as “life safety” issues. Of those, 276 noted that smoke and carbon monoxide detectors were missing in apartments and the buildings’ hallways.

  • Months earlier, the father of the children who later died, Alan Marles, had told ABC6 Action News that the family’s apartment had an “infestation” of mice and falling drywall. Other Fox Meadow residents told ABC6 that their requests to fix problems went unanswered and that some had moved out over safety concerns.

  • Maple Shade Police investigated the fire that killed the Marles children. The department denied an open records request for the findings of its investigation citing a criminal investigation exemption. Efforts to reach the Marles family for this story were unsuccessful.

  • Kamson has paid $21,250 in fines from the state over property violations at Fox Meadow since 2022.

data.title: ICYMI: Mikie Sherrill To Declare A State of Emergency on Utility Costs on Day One
data.description:
ICYMI: Mikie Sherrill To Declare A State of Emergency on Utility Costs on Day One

BLOOMFIELD — Yesterday, Mikie announced her plan to enact a State of Emergency on Utility Costs. She’ll freeze the rate hikes, so that the average New Jersey family sees no increase in their utility rates over the next year. She’ll massively build out cheaper and cleaner power generation by cutting red tape and permitting delays, allowing the state to immediately break ground on new solar and battery storage projects, expedite capacity upgrades at our nuclear plants, and modernize our existing natural gas facilities to make them cleaner and more efficient. Mikie will also require more transparency and accountability from our utility companies, including PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric, Rockland Electric, and our grid operator PJM. While Mikie is focusing on taking on powerful utility companies and fighting for New Jerseyans, Jack has called PJM — the largest grid operator in the nation — an “obscure nonprofit” and has said that holding them accountable for jacking up costs is “BS.”

Mikie’s plan was met with wide coverage from across the state. Here’s what they are saying:

In the News:

New Jersey 101.5: Sherrill vows ’emergency’ action on electric bills on Day 1 as governor of NJ

Democratic candidate for governor Mikie Sherrill has vowed to declare a "state of emergency" over New Jersey’s spike in power bills and freeze utility rates on “day one” in office.

“More power generation means lower bills,” Sherrill said, adding "This means immediately breaking ground on new solar and battery storage projects, expediting capacity upgrades at our existing nuclear plants, and streamlining the modernization of existing natural gas facilities to make them cleaner and more efficient."

Sherrill said she would instruct her state attorney general to take on massive power grid operator, PJM, while adding that Ciattarelli has said holding the company accountable is a bunch of “B.S.”

Sherrill was also joined by Park Ridge Mayor Keith Misciagna, of the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers 164, who said “her opponent seems to have no plan whatsoever,” Misciagna said at the podium before Sherrill spoke.

NJ.com: Mikie Sherrill vows to freeze N.J. energy prices amid alarming rate hikes

New Jersey Democratic gubernatorial nominee Mikie Sherrill vowed Wednesday to freeze rapidly rising electricity bills if elected, campaigning on an issue that has caught fire in the hotly contested race for the state’s top political job.

Sherrill said she would declare a state of emergency on her first day in office and order a statewide freeze on energy prices while repeating her policy stances to invest in solar and nuclear energy production, creating what she termed an “energy arsenal.” She also supported efforts to modernize natural gas production and investments into battery energy storage.

The New Jersey League of Conservation Voters on Wednesday lauded Sherrill’s plans. “Mikie’s plan to cap energy prices in the short term and speed approval of new solar energy projects, the cheapest energy in America, while safeguarding our open space and environmental protections, will create union jobs while providing cheap, clean energy that we need to lower costs for the long term,” the organization’s executive director, Ed Potosnak, said in a statement.

InsiderNJ: Sherrill Puts the BPU on Notice as She Vows Day One State of Emergency on Utility Costs

Mikie Sherrill, Democratic nominee for Governor, said if elected she would enact a Day One State of Emergency on Utility Costs, promising to freeze rate hikes, build out cheaper and cleaner power generation, and require more transparency from utility companies, including PSE&G, JCP&L, Atlantic City Electric, and Rockland Electric, and our grid operator, PJM.

“New Jersey families are being crushed by their utility bills and we’ve reached a crisis point," Sherrill said. "But in the Navy, you learn that in times of crisis, you have to lead, follow, or get out of the way. I’m running to lead, and I am going to be the governor who lowers your utility bills. So on Day One, I’m going to declare a State of Emergency on Utility Costs to freeze these rate hikes and build out New Jersey’s energy arsenal, which will immediately lower costs. And I’m not afraid to take on anyone – whether it’s the utility companies, our grid operator, or my own party — to get it done. Meanwhile, Jack Ciattarelli is going to sit back and let Donald Trump drive up energy costs while making New Jerseyans foot the bill."

Sherrill made the announcement alongside Herb Michitsch, a Kenilworth senior, and Keith Misciagna from IBEW Local 164, who shared how the 20% utility rate increases are already stretching their budgets thin.

NJBIZ: Sherrill unveils energy plan to cut NJ utility costs

At the center of Sherrill’s plan is a day one declaration of a state of emergency on utility costs.

When asked if the governor had the authority to freeze utility rates, Sherrill said her team has determined that, as governor, she would have the power to – pointing to a stakeholder process with utility companies and PJM to analyze prices/costs, as well as highlighting money that comes into NJBPU that could be used toward this.

New Jersey Globe: Sherrill says she’ll freeze utility bills in first year as governor

The aggressive proposals come as Democratic state officials seek to address the 20% increase in electric rates that arrived this June and another, smaller bump expected next June. The rising prices are a potent political issue heading into November, with the governorship and Assembly at stake: Democrats largely blame the region’s energy grid operator, while Republicans blame Democratic clean-energy efforts.

Sherrill announced her plans at a press conference outside the Kenilworth home of Herb and Mary Michitsch, who have been married for 57 years and lived in the house for 53 years. Herb said they used to pay less than $100 per month in utility bills, but the prices are now “creeping up” to $400 per month.

Under the state of emergency, the Democrat said she’d immediately break ground on solar and battery storage projects, as well as expand capacity at existing nuclear plants and modernize existing natural gas plants. Sherrill said she’ll “open up the books” of the state’s utility companies, including PSE&G and JCP&L.

On Social Media:

League of Conservation Voters, New Jersey: Through her bold new plan to reign in energy costs, @mikiesherrill is showing once again that she’s willing to take on Donald Trump and his corrupt oil and gas CEO friends. While Jack Ciattarelli’s policies would enrich corrupt fossil fuel companies and cause prices to skyrocket, Mikie is working to protect New Jersey families from Donald Trump's extreme fossil fuels agenda.

New Jersey Sierra Club: Mikie Sherrill will tackle several problems on her first day in office- affordability, holding PJM accountable, and investing in clean energy. This is what true leadership looks like. We need to ensure that we elect Mikie Sherill as NJ’s Governor, a leader who is not afraid to hold powerful interests accountable for their impacts on NJ’s families.

Evergreen Action: New Jersey residents are feeling the impact of rising utility costs, and Mikie Sherrill's plan goes right at the source of that increase: PJM Interconnection's mismanagement of the grid. For too long, consumers have paid the price for PJM’s decision to slowwalk connecting cheaper clean energy to the grid while its utility members make more money from expensive fossil fuel infrastructure. Mikie Sherrill's plan will hold PJM accountable, invest in affordable clean energy and prevent rate increases for New Jersey residents.

We need more leaders willing to confront the status quo head-on, not just manage around it. PJM must start putting working families first and fast-track connecting cheap clean energy to the grid, instead of padding utility profits with expensive new gas plants. PJM’s utility-members’ greed and PJM’s mismanagement are blocking hundreds of low-cost clean energy projects while sticking ratepayers with the bill. Enough is enough. It’s time to stop protecting utility interests and start holding PJM and utilities accountable to the people they’re supposed to serve.

###

data.title: Environment 2
data.description:
Here in New Jersey, we love our natural spaces — from the shore to the Pine Barrens to the Delaware Water Gap. Securing our natural heritage for the next generation is a sacred obligation. We’re also the state that built this nation in the Industrial Revolution, and our landscape still has the scars to prove it. Meanwhile, climate change threatens our communities as flooding gets worse every year and we prepare for the next Superstorm. 

We need a comprehensive strategy to clean up brownfields and Superfund sites, protect our wild spaces, and build the infrastructure to take on the future. As energy demand grows, we need to build the energy of the future — first solar, then, ultimately, nuclear power. We don’t have to choose between our environment and our economy — we’re going to build a green, prosperous future in New Jersey.

data.title: Statement by Mikie Sherrill on the President’s Pardons for January 6 Rioters
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Today, Mikie Sherrill released the following statement on President Trump’s pardons for more than 1,000 individuals who were convicted of criminal offenses related to the violent U.S. Capitol riot on January 6, 2021: 

“These pardons undermine the rule of law and betray the brave law enforcement officers who risked their lives defending the Capitol on January 6. It is even more disturbing that the president pardoned violent offenders — like Julian Khater, the individual who assaulted U.S. Capitol Police officer Brian Sicknick, a New Jersey native, and pled guilty to assaulting officers with a dangerous weapon. My heart is with the Sicknick family and the Capitol Police officers who put their lives on the line every day. Here in New Jersey, we’re going to stand up for our Constitution, defend our rights and freedoms, and respect the law enforcement officers who keep our communities safe.” 

###

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Slams Elon Musk on Amtrak Privatization
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement today after unelected billionaire Elon Musk proposed that the federal government privatize Amtrak: 

“Seemingly not content with firing thousands of veterans or working to cut Medicaid health coverage for kids and seniors, Elon Musk is now proposing the idea of privatizing Amtrak — yet another raw deal that will raise costs for New Jersey. NJ TRANSIT already has to fight for its share of Amtrak resources toward maintenance and repairs on the Northeast Corridor tracks that it rents from Amtrak. If Amtrak were privatized, reduced federal support and a focus on profits would put NJ TRANSIT on the hook for even more of those costs, forcing them to increase fares or cut service — making the commute even more expensive and less reliable for New Jerseyans. It would also mean less oversight and accountability when Amtrak’s decisions harm our commuters. 

“Put simply, Musk’s proposal would be a nightmare scenario for NJ TRANSIT and the Northeast Corridor — robbing our commuters to benefit billionaires like himself. So let me be clear: Musk will have a fight on his hands if he comes for our transit system.”

###

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Slams PJM for Additional Rate Hikes
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after PJM — New Jersey’s regional grid operator — announced an additional spike in their energy auction prices today, which will translate to a utility rate increase of up to 5% (or $140 per year) next year, on top of this year’s 20% increase.

“New Jerseyans across our state have been appalled looking at their utility bills this summer because of PJM’s mismanagement of our energy grid and the subsequent spike in utility costs. Today, they added insult to injury as they announced another surge in auction prices, which will increase New Jerseyans’ utility prices once again at the end of 2025. PJM has refused to plug clean, cheap power like solar into the grid while giving preference to coal and oil, and I strongly oppose their actions that are making New Jerseyans pay the price once again. 

“While PJM’s mismanagement raises your bills, Jack Ciattarelli is doing everything he can to increase them even more. He is fully supporting Trump’s plan to cancel a huge number of new energy projects, which will kill over 20,000 jobs in New Jersey and raise prices by $240 per year, and he has no plan to lower energy bills or secure energy independence for New Jersey. We can’t afford that nonsense and have no time to waste.

“I’ll be the governor who lowers your energy bills: I’ll cut through red tape to install community solar projects on state properties, capped landfills, and brownfield sites to lower your bills right away. I’ll take on PJM by forcing them to plug solar projects into the grid, fill vacant board positions with people who are accountable to the public, and slash red tape to reduce delays in getting new projects connected to the grid, and I’ll take them to court when they don’t prioritize ratepayers. I’ll make a bold push for energy storage to ensure we are able to deploy renewable power. We also need a reliable source of electricity that can meet our state’s needs for decades to come, and that’s nuclear power. I’ll work with neighboring states to expand safe nuclear power capacity in New Jersey at a low cost, which will provide clean electricity for generations.”
 

###

data.title: Trump’s tariffs are putting New Jerseyans out of work. Jack’s going right along with him.
data.description:
Jack on tariffs: “You can’t expect people to understand the implications of that because it does get very, very complicated. But, you know, tip our cap to the president”


BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after today’s national jobs report showed the weakest three-month period of job growth since COVID because of the rising costs inflicted by Donald Trump’s tariffs, which will be the largest tax hike on Americans since 1968 once fully implemented:

"Donald Trump’s tariffs are a tax hike, plain and simple. They are raising prices on businesses, costing the average family $2,400 each year, and putting New Jerseyans out of work — and Jack is going right along with him. I hear from New Jerseyans about how the rising costs of housing, utilities, and healthcare are keeping people up at night. I’m running for governor to make sure families can afford to live here, while Jack's running to serve Donald Trump, even if that means causing New Jerseyans, in his own words, ‘short-term pain.’ That ‘pain’ is here now, New Jersey has lost 12,000 jobs in just the last two months because of these tariffs.

“And yes, here in New Jersey, we understand what Trump’s tariffs mean: higher costs and less opportunity for working people trying to get by. Jack has a serious problem — you can’t claim to be for a more affordable New Jersey and at the same time line up behind Trump’s Tariffs. And we understand where Jack’s loyalties lie, with Trump, not with us.”

###

data.title: Mikie’s Got Momentum: Statement on the Mercer County Convention Victory
data.description:
Democrats on the ground in communities across New Jersey want Mikie as their candidate for governor 

LAWRENCEVILLE — Today, Mikie Sherrill released the following statement after winning the Mercer County Democratic Convention: 

“Mercer Democrats voted for a different kind of leadership tonight and I’m so honored to have their support. This is a campaign we’re building together — and I’m going to take our message to every corner of the state, keep building our momentum, and earn support from voters who are on the ground fighting for a better future in their communities. 

“With all the chaos coming from Trump’s Washington, this is a crucial moment in time, and the way we fight back is we show up. My promise is that I will always show up for New Jersey, and no matter how big the fight, I will always have your back. I’ve always run toward the fight — and that’s how I’ll lead as governor. Mercer County deserves a governor who will get to work to address our housing crisis, support our state’s capital city, and ensure we provide the necessary resources for all our residents to thrive.”

###

data.title: ICYMI: Trump and Jack-Backed “Unpredictable Tariffs Pressure Jersey Shore Pizzerias, Shops, Manufacturers”
data.description:
Jack endorsed “pain” from the Trump and Jack-backed tariffs. Now, the “unpredictable tariffs” “pressure” local New Jersey businesses feeling the pain.

BLOOMFIELD — Jack Ciattarelli is all in on the Trump “scattershot tariff policy,” saying “there’s going to be some pain” for New Jerseyans. Jack was right. 

New reporting from the Asbury Park Press highlights how Jersey Shore businesses are “grappling” with the Trump and Jack-backed “scattershot tariff policy, trying to calculate how much of the price increase they can absorb, how much they can pass onto customers.” The Jack-backed tariffs are bad for business — “making it more difficult for companies to decide how much to hire or how aggressively to expand.” 

“No matter the cost to New Jersey, Jack is all in on Trump’s tariffs and even endorses the ‘pain’ that New Jerseyans will face because of it. New Jersey families and businesses are struggling, but Jack would rather score points with Trump than stand up for our state,” said Mikie Sherrill.

Here are just a few examples of the New Jerseyans who are feeling the pain that Jack has embraced:

  • “At the Shore, a pizza place hit with higher costs for Italian flour is restructuring”

  • “A manufacturer that exports its high-tech systems is worried about how other countries will retaliate”

  • One business owner said, “his customer base is working class, so he absorbed the first increase. But he can't continue cutting into his profit margin.”

###

data.title: Sherrill: Ciattarelli Will Bring MAGA Court to New Jersey
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill today released the following statement on U.S. Supreme Court rulings: 

“Once again, Trump’s hand-picked Supreme Court is driving a MAGA political agenda, threatening Constitutional rights and civil rights that have been on the books since the end of the Civil War. Jack Ciattarelli has pledged to turn New Jersey’s state supreme court into a partisan mess, just like Washington, saying he would only nominate far-right justices in line with his extreme MAGA agenda. This means justices who would favor efforts to roll back abortion rights and defund reproductive healthcare; who would threaten community safety by permitting firearms modified to be weapons of war; and who would reject efforts to hold powerful interests accountable for polluting our soil, water, and air. That’s not my vision for New Jersey — I’m committed to defending our Constitution, just like I did in the Navy, and nominating state supreme court justices who will uphold the rule of law and protect our communities. These decisions show that the stakes of this race are important for our state, our rights, and our values.” 

###

data.title: Mikie Sherrill Slams Alina Habba’s Sham “Election Integrity” Announcement
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Mikie Sherrill, a former federal prosecutor at the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the District of New Jersey, released the following statement: 

“There are few people less credible or qualified to lead an ‘election integrity’ effort than Alina Habba, who has made a career of lying professionally for Donald Trump. Let’s not forget what Trump’s election lies have done: undermined faith in our democracy and ignited a violent insurrection on January 6. Habba has stated her goal of turning New Jersey red — a frightening statement from somebody who is supposed to be impartial and uphold the Constitution above all else. This is dangerous, and I will fight back against any attempt to roll back access to the ballot box or bring Trump’s attacks on our democracy to New Jersey state elections.”

data.title: ICYMI: Foreign Policy for America Endorses Mikie Sherrill for Governor
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — In case you missed it, Foreign Policy for America announced its endorsement of Mikie Sherrill to be the next Governor of New Jersey. Mikie, and her former colleague Abigail Spanberger, earned the group's first-ever endorsements in gubernatorial races. Foreign Policy for America’s endorsement underscores the importance of electing a Democratic governor who can stand up for New Jersey as Donald Trump undermines America’s economy and standing on the world stage.
 

​​“Right now, the American people need leaders they can trust. We need leaders who are committed to protecting and serving their communities—not their own egos or their billionaire friends. That’s why we’re proud to endorse Abigail Spanberger and Mikie Sherrill. While the White House imposes mindless tariffs that will devastate American farmers and small businesses while raising prices, Mikie and Abigail will stand up for common sense solutions that protect New Jersey and Virginia families,” said Andrew Albertson, Executive Director of Foreign Policy for America. “Mikie and Abigail have spent their entire lives serving this country. They’re proven national security leaders who understand the stakes. We’re proud to support them now as they continue to step up and serve their communities.” 

###

data.title: Maine Governor Janet Mills Endorses Mikie Sherrill
data.description:
BLOOMFIELD — Maine Governor Janet Mills endorsed Mikie Sherrill for New Jersey Governor today, underscoring that Mikie is the leader for this moment as states are under attack from Trump’s Washington. 

“When it comes to protecting democracy and the rule of law, Democratic governors are on the front lines. New Jersey needs a real fighter to stand up to Trump — just like I did at the White House — and I know that’s Mikie Sherrill,” said Maine Governor Janet Mills. “From her service in the Navy, Mikie knows that real leaders run toward the fight. Mikie is strongest when times are the toughest, and I am proud to endorse her candidacy for governor.”

“Governor Janet Mills has gone toe-to-toe with Donald Trump and shown us all how to stand up to the bully in the White House, and I’m honored to have her endorsement,” said Mikie Sherrill. “Democratic governors are on the front lines fighting back against Trump’s chaos in Washington. From protecting abortion rights to growing our economy in the face of Trump’s destructive tariff policy and federal cuts, women governors are leading the way — and I am grateful for the support of leaders like Governor Mills.” 

Mikie has also been endorsed by EMILYs List, Latina Civic PAC, Elect Democratic Women, Chatham Moms for Change, Morris County Democratic Women’s Caucus, the Democratic Task Force of the Women’s Political Caucus of New Jersey, Vote Mama, National Women’s Political Caucus, and more. 

###

data.title: New Poll Shows Mikie with a Resilient Lead in Race for New Jersey Governor
data.description:
Jack’s allegiance to Trump and support of tax increases is breaking through

Mikie’s campaign has raised over $7.35 million

BLOOMFIELD — A new poll shows Mikie Sherrill continuing to lead the way in the race for New Jersey governor, as she holds a seven-point lead with 50% of the vote.

“New Jerseyans are excited by Mikie’s bold leadership and vision to chart a different path forward for New Jersey, and it’s evident in the momentum we’re seeing across the state. In contrast, Garden State voters know the truth about Jack Ciattarelli, who has pledged loyalty to Trump even when it hurts our families, and they will reject him for a third time this November,” said Mikie Sherrill for Governor Communications Director Sean Higgins.

To date, the campaign has raised over $7.35 million securing contributions from all 21 counties, putting her more than $1 million over the requirement for matching funds.

Since the June 10 primary, Team Mikie has contacted over 3.1 million voters, made over 1.2 million phone calls, and knocked over 285,000 doors.

Voters are responding to Mikie’s record of service and plan to drive down costs. During the week that the poll was in the field, Jack and allied organizations spent twice the amount of money attacking Mikie as she spent outlining her vision, but voters aren’t buying it. New Jersey voters are quick to report that Jack is “too close to Trump” and “a puppet of party leaders,” concerned that Jack “would raise taxes” because he “supports a 10% sales tax.”

###

data.title: Abortion and Reproductive Rights
data.description:
The decision of if and when to start a family is one that every woman deserves to make for herself — and that’s why I have always fought for access to abortion and comprehensive reproductive health care. Since Trump’s handpicked Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, I’ve led the fight to protect women’s access to emergency abortion care, block efforts to ban medication abortion like mifepristone, and ensure military servicewomen have access to abortion and contraception, no matter where they are stationed. While New Jersey is a leader in reproductive freedom, I know that as governor, there is more we can do to ensure every woman has access to the reproductive health care she needs. And with Donald Trump back in the White House, we have to protect access to abortion rights here in New Jersey.

I strongly support enshrining the right to an abortion in New Jersey's state constitution to permanently protect reproductive freedom. Despite laws in place to protect access to care, too often women in New Jersey face additional barriers in getting care. New Jersey must take action to require comprehensive insurance coverage for all reproductive health care services, including abortion. I will continue our work expanding access to contraception and IVF services so that every New Jerseyan has affordable access to the family planning services they need. We will be the first line of defense in protecting reproductive rights.
